I received this item free in exchange for an honest review.I havent used matching set shampoo and conditioner in years.  If the shampoo works for my hair, the conditioner leaves my hair greasy and lifeless.  If I like the conditioner, the shampoo is too harsh.  As a result I have used L'Oreal Paris EverPure Sulfate-Free Color Care System Moisture Shampoo, 8.5 fl. Oz. and L'Oreal Color Vibrancy Nourishing Conditioner 25.4 FL OZ for the past year or so.  I dislike their mates as well.This shampoo and conditioner combo I LOVE!  Both work perfectly and my hair is left soft and shiny. I received this free in exchange for an honest review.I am new to the oils world so this has been my first diffuser.  I use it in my bedroom and have quickly become reliant on it.  My sinuses have been in tizzy since the fall Michigan weather has been going from the 70s to the 40s to the 70s and then back again.  Im left with a stuffy head and headaches.  A little Eucalyptus oil in this thing and I am breathing easy!  If I am stressed out, I add a little lavender and I am relaxing.The light is a little bright for me, so I use it without.  Its easy to operate and works really, really, well.  It lasts about 6 hours before the water runs out and it automatically shuts off.  I like that it is going strong while I sleep, but turns off on its own when its time.I would have rated this 5 stars had it come with operating instructions.  Being a newbie I wasnt sure at all how to operate this.  Luckily another review had a video that I was able to watch and figure it out.  Im sure if this isnt your first youd be able to figure it out easily.I will be purchasing more for other rooms in my home.  My son has already requested one for his room as he claims it relaxes him!Cherise Everhard,  November 2015

I got this for my desk at work as I am often asked a million stupid or repetitive questions every day.  When the insanity of it starts to get to me, I consult my magic 8 ball and what the 8 ball says goes.  It makes us office chicks laugh and helps keep me from stabbing anyone.It has the standard 8 ball responses.  Reply hazy, my sources say, ask again later, etc.  But it also contains some weather related replies keeping with the frozen theme.  The frozen answers dont really fit with the standard yes or no questions you ask the ball  but a few times theyve added a bit of unexpected hilarity and have been oddly appropriate.The powder blue and snow flake paint adds a nice feminine play on the traditional black ball.  It  looks great amongst the fun tchotchkes on my desk.Itd make a great stocking stuffer for your frozen fan!Cherise Everhard, November 2015

Ok, I hated Kyle in the first Whiskey Creek book. I hated him, I hated Olivias sister, Noelle, and I almost hated Brenda Novak for creating two of the most despicable creatures, ever. But with each book I found myself warming up to him. I still dont buy his excuses  but I dont want to stab him anymore, thats progress and I did want him to get his happily ever after. 5 minutes with Noelle is enough punishment for most hard criminals, let alone one small town guy who made one enormous mistake.Lourdes comes to Whiskey Creek looking to hide from fame and to get her music career back on track. Nothing is going the way she thought it would. Shes having trouble with her manager boyfriend, her music and her confidence. After renting Kyles house they end up being force together and find they get along and have a lot more in common than the surface would suggest.I liked Lourdes and I liked Kyle  I liked them both together. But man oh man, Ms. Novak  I could have totally done without anymore Noelle! Her and her dumb parents are like nails on the chalkboard to me. Kudos on writing characters that make me want to smack the crap out of them!! Noelle pops up enough in this book to make you crazy and to wonder if Kyle should be sainted.The cover of the book is a little misleading - But the feel good Christmassy romance is alive in well in this book. This series continues to be excellent.Cherise Everhard, October 2015Book provided by the author in exchange for an honest review.

I have super long and super straight hair.  I am almost 40 and have a TON of grey hair that I get rid of with regular dye jobs.  That can make my hair very dry. I normally buy packets of Ion deep conditioner at the beauty supply place where I pick up my dye.  It is a dollar a packet and does a very good job.This product, however, not only covers better, it conditions better.  I keep it in my shower now and try to condition once a week.  I can really feel the difference, and I can see that my hair looks shinier.  The smell is light and floral  it smells very good.I thought Id be out of the jar in no time, considering the amount I use with the Ion product I am used to  - but I find that even though this product is thicker, it spreads nicer and because of that I am not using as much.I really saturate my hair from the top of the neck to the ends and then lightly apply to the hair that covers my scalp.  Because my hair is so straight it can get greasy and looked weighed down.  I dont get that with this.This is an excellent product and I am glad I got the chance to try it.Cherise Everhard, October 2015I received this product, free, in exchange for an honest review.

The author gave this book to me in exchange for an honest review.Margery is a college student who stumbles upon an arrogant loner on campus who is so rude to her that naturally she starts stalking him and wanting him.  Im all for the bad boys but Valmont is such an arse in the beginning that I didnt like him and was so confused as to how the author could think anyone would.Margerys dialogue at first comes off juvenile and the interaction between her and Valmont is odd. While I found myself liking the idea of the story, the execution of the story I was lacking.  Besides some editing issues, I found myself thinking the author took for granted we knew what she was thinking or where she was going, so instead of stopping to show us the path  she just let us blindly follow.  I found myself reading and rereading paragraphs trying to piece together what I had missed, only finding I missed nothing  and was justifiably confused.While this book is a series of 5 short stories combined, the totality still feels small and short.  The 5 total read like a normal one story novella.  I didnt understand Valmonts relationship with the school and the teacher or why it was introduced.  I didnt understand his relationship with his family, his uncle or his cousin  or why that was introduced.The sex scenes are graphic, but lacked the detail and storytelling that make them real or hot.  I felt like the author was more interested in shocking the reader than titillating the reader.Im not a professional editor or reviewer, obviously, but I am a professional reader.  My advice to the author would be to use more detail in her writing, show us ALL of what you are thinking, not just bits and pieces and hope we can put them together.  Get more readers to edit your work, honestly, and let you know where the holes are.  Your ideas are good  you just need to develop them a whole lot more.Cherise Everhard, October 2015

I got this for my husband and son so they could see the critters that come poking around their bate pile.  I didnt expect to get so excited to see what pictures we capture, but I find myself looking forward to each viewing.This is our first trail camera, so we kind of stumbled through the set up process.  While the instructions seemed very straight forward there were one or two steps I would have wished for more detail.  Our first viewing of the pictures we were excited to see we captured 20 plus pictures overnight.  Unfortunately, they were all of my husbands face, my son walking around and one squirrel.After that we kind of narrowed down where we went wrong and how to adjust the settings a bit.  Now we have captured deer, a woodchuck, turkeys and a TON of squirrels!Like other reviewers have said the pictures at dawn and dusk, when it goes from light to dark or dark to light, arent as good quality as the others taken in dark or light.  The transition seems to confuse the camera so any pictures taken at that change tend to be poor.  Luckily, the transition doesnt seem to last long.Im really impressed with this camera and the pictures that it takes.  I look forward to each wildlife photo captured.  I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone who likes to get candid photos of wildlife.Cherise Everhard, October 2015

My first thought when receiving this was Wow!  The packaging was extremely well done and elegant.  It is a presentation that would definitely befit a gift giving.  Its beautifully done and the watch was in the box securely, and protectively, but it still managed to be a beautiful package.My second thought was boy is this thing heavy!  Taking out of its protective box I was taken aback by how heavy it felt.  It definitely has some weight to it, more than what Id normally like on my wrist.  You definitely could feel its presence.My third thought was this thing is huge.  I didnt have to unclasp the watch to put it on, I slipped it over my hand easily where it hung off my wrist way too big.  I looked in the extensive instructions on how to remove a few clasp-thingies (No thats not a technical term) but was sad to see there werent any.  So I had to wait to go to a local jeweler and have them do it.  That was kind of a bummer, I was looking forward to wearing it instantly.My fourth thought was this watch is built to last.  It feels and looks incredibly sturdy and strong.  I dont think this is a watch that is going to break or scratch easy.  It just seems to have been made with a lot of care.  I dont know the Invicta name or their reputation, but I was impressed by the quality that seems to ooze from this watch.My fifth and final thought was, sadly, its kind of manly.  The head and the band (Again, Im sure these arent technical terms) are quite large and not at all feminine or delicate.  In fact when I opened it, my husband thought it was for him.  After I told him it was mine and put it on he declared thats a mans watch.  The face of the watch, to me, keeps it from being a mans watch, but the rest of it could totally be a mans watch.  Its just not as girly as Id expect with a name like Angel.Overall Id give this watch 5 stars, happily and easily, based on quality vs. price, had the watch been a little more feminine, lighter and not so huge.Cherise Everhard, September 2015

Maya and Del were in love and once upon a time were to be married.  But Maya left Del heartbroken and they both went their separate ways.  Years later they are both in their hometown again for different reasons and forced to collaborate on a city project.  Theyve both changed, a lot, but as they work together they find that even though theyre different people now some things like their chemistry and attraction havent changed.This threesome in the long running and for me, much loved, Fools Gold series has not been my favorite.  When this one started I thought I was going to really love it.  I love old loves reunited and given the second chance.  Its one of my favorite story lines.  This book started out pretty strong, compared to the previous two, so I had high hopes that this book was going to make up for the mediocre previous two but for me that loving feeling soon fizzled out and while I found myself liking the story I wasnt wowed and I didnt love it.Part of the problem was the conflict in the story was strange to me.  I didnt get why Dels mom was doing what she was doing and it seemed odd and selfish and screamed Im a martyr!  Then when the conflict comes to light Dels reaction was over the top and mean.  I didnt get that, either.  I didnt like that part of the story and it was unnecessary filler.While I like Del and Maya I never fell for them like I have for previous characters in the story.  They were OK  nothing special.  The story wasnt bad but it wasnt great either.  Im glad I read it as I still havent lost my love for Fools Gold or this series, I have high hopes that the next threesome will bring back the greatness I expect from this author and series.Cherise Everhard, September 2015

I got this for my hubby and I am glad I did  so far he's worn it quite a bit.  Over a t-shirt with it left unbuttoned, or buttoned up, he really likes it.With the weather changing and getting a little cooler, it's been put on at night when the temperature drops and we are still out and about.I have washed it several times and so far it has maintained it's color and the fabric looks and feels great.  It didn't shrink at all from washing it and it fits and looks like it did the first time he put it on.I like the way the shirt looks on him, it's casual but not as casual as a flannel that he would normally reach for.I definitely will be buying more shirts like this one for him.Cherise Everhard, September 2015

With everyone wearing the fitbits  I was a little jealous of the gadget, but it was an expense I couldn't justify.  So with the offer of this item, I jumped on it.It was really easy to set up.  I downloaded the free app from the app store and followed the booklet instructions.  Then I synced my phone and the watch together.  I think it took all of 5 minutes from start to finish.  At first I tested it walking and counting my steps and then checking to see what it clocked.  It was pretty accurate, give or take a few steps here and there.The feature of monitoring your sleep was a trip.  I was really amazed at how accurate that was.  It was interesting to see how much or  how little restful sleep I actually got.I don't have the NUYU scale so I had to enter my weight in manually on my phone, no big deal.The calorie counter was also a nice feature and worked well.My little complaints with the device are it's looks  it's kind of ugly to me and the the synchronization.  A lot of times I had to to try two to three times before it would take.  I also forgot to sync it one night and so all the extra walking and calories I had burned the day before were lost.  That was a bummer.I didn't use it in the water or shower, when I see water resistant I am not to confident with it's capabilities.  I prefer the water proof title.All in all I can't complain about it, it's worked great for me.Cherise Everhard, September 2015

Lucy and Ian come head to head over the fate of a childrens camp.  Lucy wants to save her beloved camp and Ian is purchasing it to develop the land.  As they fight for what they want chemistry enters the picture and they find themselves attracted and at odds.I liked Lucys character and I enjoyed Ians as well.  I liked their story and the story of the camp, and their back stories.  What kept me from loving this book were all the side characters and stories.  I believe side characters add to a story, but in this case they added too much.  This isnt a lengthy novel and so much of the focus was on Lucys sister, Ians sister and all the drama that came from both, that I felt like Ian and Lucy didnt get their full story.  There characters and relationship didnt develop as much as they could have if the focus would have been more fully on them.Its an easy book to get lost in, and I would like to see what happens to all the characters in the book, side and main.  I just hope in future books we get a promise of a future story from the side characters instead of them sharing the main characters spotlight.  It was a nice way to spend a few lazy hours!Cherise Everhard, September 2015I was given this book in exchange for an honest review

I received this product, free, in exchange for an honest review.I am new to the oils world  so I havent quite learned all the uses for the products yet.  So far though, I am enjoying the journey and the oils!OK, first I received the pump  although it didnt work.  Disappointing?  Sure.  Was it a deal breaker?  Did it ruin my day?  No, I simply work around it.  The pump would definitely simplify things but I just muddled through until I could transfer the oil to an old and empty soap container that I cleaned out.As I am new to oils, I am really new to carrier oils.  I was a little concerned as to how this would absorb into my skin.  I pictured myself slicked up like I was covered in baby oil.  Luckily, that wasnt the case.  My first application was to my knees with some oils to help with joint swelling and arthritis.  The oil absorbed into my skin without leaving any greasy look.  I was able to apply it at work without anyone noticing anything but my herby scent.I will definitely purchase this carrier oil, again.  It has been very helpful.  I have yet to read the free ebook with the tips for uses, but that is on my list as I get more into the oil world!Cherise Everhard, September 2015

I am new to the oils world  so I havent quite learned all the uses for the products yet.  So far though, I am enjoying the journey and the oils!With this oil I have used it mainly for my aches and pains.  I have used it mixed with a carrier oil and massaged it into my sore and very angry knees.  I found that it helped ease the stiffness and ache in my knees.  I have also used it on my hands and back of my neck, mixed with the carrier oil, when the long days at my work computer have taken its toll.  I find the scent is just as therapeutic as the application itself.  It helps clear my sinuses and my head while easing my aches.I cant speak too intelligently on the quality of the oil as I lack any real comparison, but I have been impressed with my dealings with the company and am happy to see the organic label on the bottles.  I am already looking to expand my oil collection and knowledge.Cherise Everhard, September 2015I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review

I am new to the oils world  so I havent quite learned all the uses for the products yet.  So far though, I am enjoying the journey and the oils!With this oil I have used it mainly for its healing benefits.  Ive used it on some cuts and scrapes that myself and my family have received over the past month or so.  Ive been really surprised at how quickly my cuts seem to heal vs. my usual treatment of just soap and water and maybe some Neosporin in the mood hit.I also have used it mixed with a carrier oil and massaged it into my sore and very angry knees.  I found that it helped ease the stiffness and ache in my knees.I cant speak too intelligently on the quality of the oil as I lack any real comparison, but I have been impressed with my dealings with the company and am happy to see the organic label on the bottles.  I am already looking to expand my oil collection and knowledge.Cherise Everhard, September 2015I received this product in exchange for an honest review

I received these shorts for free in exchange for an honest review.I got these shorts with my husband in mind.  I am trying to get him to practice Yoga with me and thought these shorts might give him the extra boost he needs to join me.He loves these shorts.  They are extremely comfortable and breathable.  They wash very nicely and the integrity of the fabric, the shape of the short has remained the same, wash after wash.  The quality of the shorts is what I have come to expect from YogaAddict.  Theyre wonderful.They move with my husband, without being confining - but they dont gape or bag while bending and shifting from Yoga pose to Yoga pose.I would definitely recommend these for the Yoga man out there  they will make your practice comfortable, and they will last you quite a long time.Cherise Everhard, September 2015

My Sister and my Grandmother introduced to me to Diane Mott Davidsons writing years and years ago  and half the fun of reading them was seeing what yummy stuff was going to be cooking.  Getting this cookbook was a fun trip down culinary lane!Ive only cooked two recipes so far  The Anniversary Burgers (a fancied up grilled burger) and Big Bucks Bread Pudding with Hard Sauce.  The burgers were delicious  a great way, and easy way, to elevate your burgers.  They were juicy and flavorful.  The Bread Pudding was also very yummy; however, I did not care for the hard sauce.  It contained rum extract and that is not a flavor I care for.  The pudding itself was cooked individually in a muffin tin  making the serving size perfect.  We ended up eating the puddings minus the sauce, no one in my house cared for the sauce.The next two recipes on my to-cook list are Blondes Blondies and Stir Fry Chicken with Asparagus.  The variety in this cookbook is nice.  The recipes are simple and the ingredients seem to be easy to find, nothing too exotic.  The list of ingredients for the recipes seems to  minimal  another plus.Cherise Everhard, August 2015

I had reservations about reading this book.  It sounded heavier than what I am used to with Kristan Higgins writing.  The subject matter of both Jenny and Rachels storyline is disturbing to me, Rachels especially, and I wasnt sure I wanted to read her heartache.  I read Kristan Higginss books for their humor and happily ever afters.  So I really hesitated to read something I was sure was going to make me feel miserable for the players within.That being said I ended up loving this book.  Yes there are some emotionally draining moments  but thankfully Kristans humor is present enough to balance the scales.  The book isnt an easy mindless read; in fact its the opposite.  I found myself questioning decisions made within and learning that maybe I am not so black and white on certain matters as I thought I was.The hero of this story, to me, is Leo.  I adored him.  I loved his snark and his contradictions.  I loved his rough exterior and tender heart.  I loved the way he and Jenny were just themselves together, imperfections and all.These characters grew throughout the story, adapted with their circumstances and learned to be a different kind of them.  Their personas didnt change  just evolved.  It was a reminder to me how much things can affect you.  How we continue to everyday to become more of ourselves.I cried through the better part of the end of this book.  I was so invested in these characters, their lives, I felt like I was a part of their world.  This isnt a book that will leave you feeling miserable; there is plenty of happy on the horizon  just different versions and chapters of happy.It was an excellent read and I am glad that I talked myself into it  I wouldnt have wanted to miss this.Cherise Everhard, August 2015

Im one of a rare breed that LOVES going to the dentist.  I love it because I love how clean my teeth feel when I leave.  This toothbrush gives me that same feeling.There are three different speeds for the cleaning and whitening settings.  I have not made it past the first speed.  The other two speeds rattle my brain too much and arent comfortable at all for me.  I do not feel like I am being short changed in the cleaning department because the brush isnt at full speed.  I think it does a fine job  I love it.I like how easy the head comes off the handle  my medicine cabinet shelves are too short for it to be all put together and be able to stand up.  So I just pull it apart before I put it away.I have only had this for a couple of weeks so I havent really utilized the whitening portion of it so I cant speak to its powers on that  only its amazing cleaning.I am a fan of this brush and plan on purchasing one for my each member of my family.Cherise Everhard, August 2015

Im not a world traveler and I am rarely on a plane  but we do have a lot of weekend trips, camping and whatnot.  I chose this item specifically with my husband in mind who seems to pack a months worth of clothes for a one night stay.  It drives me wonky.  This didnt really limit the amount of things he packed  just helped make room for mine and my sons things.The shirt folder was probably the best part of this set.  I havent been able to ever fold shirts correctly so I was glad to have this to teach me and help me.  We were able to squeeze quite a lot into these and though I was worried about wrinkles, as I am NOT going to iron, there were surprisingly few.The price seems a little steep to me, and I will be honest had this not been offered to me for free, I wouldnt have purchased this.  But now knowing exactly what it does and having an idea as to the quality of the product I think I would be open to buying more in this line.Cherise  Everhard, May 2015

This book was given to me by the author/publisher in exchange for an honest review.This is a series of werewolf serials put into one book.  There is a different werewolf pack starring in each book  though you will hear all the pack names woven in and out of the stories, since each pack is aware of the others.I really liked this series and I think this set is the way to read it.  Once I figured out that each story was actually a set of super short series combined to make it one read, I decided that I had lucked out discovering them this way.  I think having to read one separately, or while waiting for others to be published would have driven me nuts.  I am glad I got to read them in their entirety all at once!I really enjoyed this take on the werewolf world and the little things that made it unique for me.  I liked how each pack was very different in their culture.  The only thing they have in common is there werewolf/shape-shifting abilities.My one problem with this story was the editing.  There are some very easy to spot and fix mistakes.  One of the bigger ones is that in two separate stories the author calls a main character the wrong name, several times.  This confused the heck out of me.  I was like Who is Rhiannon?  Who is this Nic?  And it caused me to go back and reread  thinking I missed something crucial.Other than that I was totally immersed in this world and I am going to start her dragon series, next.Cherise Everhard, May 2015

I love everything tree, Irish, Celtic, Pagan, etc so this necklace spoke to me on many levels.  When I was offered it, I jumped at the chance.I have been wearing it since it was delivered and have received many compliments.  I love the way it looks and feels.  It looks like it would be heavy but its amazingly light.  It looks gorgeous.The chain is thin and the clasp small  I thought it would be a necklace Id have trouble putting on by myself, but so far Ive had no problems.When I began this review I went to the product page to see what the price was and I was surprised by how little it is selling for!  Its really a fantastic deal; I really thought it was going to be much more than that.This would be a terrific gift for any tree and/or Celtic lover!Cherise Everhard, May 2015

It looks like I am the only one who isnt thrilled with this pizza oven.  Some of the problems that occurred were complete user error  others were design flaws, to me.Day 1: we get ready to have pizzas for dinner.  Its assembled and ready to go in a few short minutes  Bonus!  It was very easy to put together.  I continue in reading the instructions and discover for first time use you have to cook the stone on high for twenty minutes and then let it fully cool before cooking.  Well by the time this was all said and done  we grabbed something else for dinner.Day 2:  oven is ready to go  and so are our pizzas.  Unfortunately our pizza peel did not fit with this grill and we were having one hell of a time transferring pizza to oven without dough tearing and toppings dropping.  After trying everything in our arsenal  we eventually folded the pizza in half to make a calzone.  It was easier to get in there without a peel  but was still a pain in our arse!Observations and tips:You definitely need to purchase THEIR pizza peel.I didnt find it was cooking evenly so we spent our time moving and rotating in order to avoid edges getting overcooked and the middle undercooked.If youre set on this grill  get the stand.  We were cooking on our patio and the low profile made it very hard to see what was going on.If toppings drop down the sides it creates a real mess and is not that easily cleaned.Read all the directions BEFORE planning your pizza night.Personally, I didnt think the final product was worth it.  It will be a long time before I try this again.Cherise Everhard, May 2015

Jasmine is a plus sized model on her first real photo shoot when she encounters Mack and Victor  soon she discovers they are were-bears.  She handles the surprise like they told her they like cheeseburgers.  No big deal at all.This is a really short story.  The plot and the characters arent fully developed and then its ending  abruptly.  I was a little taken aback.  I felt like I never got the whole story and thats a shame because it could have been so much more.There is a twist at the end during the sex scene that I didnt seem coming and as much as I like my kink, I didnt think it fit.  It came out of left field, for me, and I think the story would have been better without it.  It didnt feel true to the any of the characters.I really would have liked a longer more developed story.  This one had great potential, but just didnt live up to the promise.Cherise Everhard, April 2015

I got this item for my husband and son who like to hunt.  It arrived just in time for Turkey season to open up.They already have one of the plastic decoys. This one next to it looks so much more lifelike.  It is very easy to set up and take down.  They already prefer it over their normal decoy.When setting up, however, my husband noticed that no matter which of the positions you put the turkey in  the tail drags on the ground, preventing movement.  He likes the decoys to move a bit so he thinks the stake needs to be longer.The price is definitely great for the product  I think it is worth the price and then some.  Most decoys are in one position and cost a little less.  With the 3 different positions to choose from, it seems you get more for your money.We are very pleased with this product and look forward to it helping us put some turkey in the freezer!Cherise Everhard, April 2015

I was given the first book in the series by the authors in exchange for an honest review Once I finished that one, I immediately purchased this one and dove right in.  I was aching to know what happened next.This is the 2nd book in a 4 part series about Finola a seemingly normal woman and Sebastian the white tiger shape-shifter she has become enamored with.  The books are cliffhangers and this one was really had me lost in the story.  I groaned out loud when I came to the end!You get to know the characters a little more, and as you do you get more invested in their story.  Both Finola and Sebastian have hidden layers and I have a feeling we are only scratching at the surface so far.Its another extremely short read, I raced through it this afternoon.  It has me crazy twitchy for the next two  its that good.  Even though its shorty, it is plenty steamy, suspenseful and sexy  though Id be lying if I said I didnt wish each book was full length.  Im loving it too much for it to end so quickly!Cherise Everhard, April 2015

I received this book free in exchange for an honest review.Finola Malley is having a really bad night.  She just broke up with her boyfriend, gets called into work and then gets attacked by some men and approached by a white tiger in the parking garage.  It kind of makes your bad days look good in comparison, doesnt it?When all is said and done she finds herself face to face with a breathtaking and very naked man.  The attraction is instant and puts a serious effort into making a bad night end really well.I blew through this book in about an hour maybe a little more.  To say this is a short story is an understatement.  Its more like an appetizer than a short story, though I am still hungry for the main course, I am happily satisfied while I wait.  It was a delicious first course.After reading this book, I immediately had to purchase the next one  I am dying to read the next chapter in Finola and Sebastians life.  I discovered that their story has been divided up in to 4 stories.  Had the other two been available I would have snatched them up as well, but it looks like I have a month or so to wait.  Uhhhhggg!There was a what I thought a kind of big editing boo boo, but I am hoping it will be easily fixed otherwise I found this tale practically perfect.This is an enjoyable sexy read and will leave you wanting more.Cherise Everhard, April 2015

I like cereal.  Never for breakfast but I like it for lunch, snack, dinner and sometimes dessert.  I have had and been a fan of Kelloggs Special K for years, but have only ever had the original flavor.  Those are delicious by themselves but the other 2 flavors provided in this set were outstanding.I have been taking them to work with me.  Eating them with and without milk.  I prefer them with the milk, but without the milk they are a quick easy snack to help sustain me through the day.My new favorite flavor is the fruit and yogurt.  I could eat that every day  all day.  I like the convenient containers  very handy for us cereal lovers on the job.  My favorite thing about this is that is forces portion control on me.  I tend to be a bit of a glutton when it comes to cereal.  I use an obscenely large bowl and then when I am finished if there is milk left over, I add more cereal.  It is a vicious cycle.I havent yet seen this product in my grocery store, but I am on the lookout.  I will definitely be purchasing this again.  The cereal stays fresh, keeps me honest and fits great in my lunchbox.Cherise Everhard, April 2015

I received this product in exchange for an honest review.Im trying to be a good girl and utilize more natural and healthy ways to fix what ails me.  This lavender oil has been beneficial in helping with headaches, relaxing and helping me get to sleep.Just today I had a headache right between my eyes  so I put a little on my finger and rubbed it under my nostrils.  The speed in which my headache was gone, was incredible.This oil is strong so a little goes a very long way.  At night if I need help relaxing or sleeping, I place a few drops on a tissue then tuck it in my pillow case where I can smell it.I have had this bottle since September and still have plenty left.  It really has come in handy.Cherise Everhard, April 2015

I ordered these for work, thinking they were adult sized.  Not being able to cancel the order once I realized my mistake, I was stuck with them.  I cant comment on how they would fit on a young girl of the same size as I dont have one.  All I can comment on is my impressions of the product.First, had they arrived in my size I wouldnt have worn them, they look like uniform pants to me.  The cheap polyester kind that would make you cringe if you had to wear them.  The feel of them is rough and unforgiving.  There is a sticker on the pant that says flex fabric but nothing about them says or feels flex.  Quite the opposite.I cant imagine any young girl that I know wanting to wear these.  They are just not very hip or stylish.  Its like a blast from the polyester past.  I picture myself wearing them and my thighs sweating.  LOL!  They just dont look comfortable, they dont feel comfortable.They looked like a decent casual dress work pant on the picture, but up close they are just too manly and too uniform for this lady and any young girl I know.  They look itchy and unbreathable.Cherise Everhard, February 2015

Like everyone else on the planet we have become smoothie freaks.  The husband and I prefer green smoothies while our son likes the fruit smoothies and milk shakes.My regular blender is a beast and also breaks ear drums.  Since I like to mix my green smoothies for breakfast whilst the hubby is still sleeping, this wasnt always polite.  This isnt a silent machine by no means, but compared to my blender its a not as deafening.  It also is quicker with the smoothie-ing so I dont feel AS guilty about my noise making in the morning.I love that the container you blend in is the container you drink from.  Less clean up!!  The directions ask that you dont fill the container past the 20oz mark.  I suggest you follow that rule.  I had premade some smoothie packets that got a too generous in the oz department now and then and when they went over the 20oz mark there was spitting and sputtering coming from the seal making a mess.  Not fun.Other than my operators error I have not had any issues.  Its pretty user friendly.  My son uses it on his own and he tends to play the helpless victim whenever he can so Mom will do it for him, but he had a hard time faking not being able to make a milkshake with this thing  its too easy.It cleans up really easy and the containers fit right in the cabinet with our cups and glasses.  The price seems comparable to the job that it does. Make sure you have enough liquid in the jar to make the smoothie smooth.  This blender tends to come to a halt if there isnt enough liquid.Cherise Everhard, February 2015

I got this light for the closet that has been built under the stairs in our dungeon, er basement.  There was no light previously and it is a closet that is used by my husband quite frequently.  He had just complained to me about the lack of lighting in there when the offer to review this product came about a day later  it seemed like fate!When the light arrived I was skeptical.  Its a teeny tiny light-bar.  I thought the petite light wouldnt illuminate a drawer, much less a closet.  I set it out on the counter and headed to work, mildly disappointed in my husbands surprise.When I got home that night I noticed the box was missing so I asked him about it.  He saw it on the counter, assumed correctly and happily that it was his and immediately installed it.  He just peeled the plastic off the sticker and stuck it in the center of the closet  voila, illumination! I asked if it worked and he looked at me like I was nuts, and replied yes.I had to see for myself.  I opened the door and the light popped on!  I could see!  The light IS tiny but its shine is mighty!  Upon standing there in shock, unmoving, it eventually turned off.  So I moved it a little and it turned back on.  I was really impressed.Our closet is about 5 tall by 3 wide and 3 deep.  It easily lights up the entire thing.  I would definitely buy more of these little wonders as the price is reasonable as well.Cherise Everhard, February 2015I was given this product in exchange for an honest review

This is a very tasty and sweet little snack to have handy.  It's not a snack if you have a craving for chips or something salty but if your sweet tooth is craving something, this could do the trick.I took this to work one day and after sampling it, I was very surprised by how much I enjoyed the taste and the crunch.  It was very hard to put it away and not eat the whole bag.  I stuck to the recommended serving size, which wasn't a lot, considering I wanted to devour the whole bag, and felt really good about having a healthy little snack at work.There isn't anything in its ingredients you can't pronounce.  It's just apples, apple juice and cinnamon.  No complaints there.  Non GMO, organic, no added sugars... again, no complaints.My only complaint is that it's a product of Chile.  Seriously?  With all the apple orchards in this country, heck, in my state alone, we have to import this from Chile?  That also may be why this is a pricey little product.  I don't get that part of it, but everything else was good!Cherise Everhard, January 2015

I have one of the first Kindles so there is no back light.  I dont read a lot in bed, but on occasion, I like to.  I was worried that even with the light it would be hard on my eyes.  It really isnt.  I find that if I put the light directly on the screen I get a brighter glare from the bulb but if I tilt it slightly to the side I receive a nice even light on the screen.It clips nicely and securely to my thick Kindle case.  The light adjust and moves easily and stays in the position I settle on.  I have even clipped it on pages of my current paperback reads successfully.  You need to clip it to a decent chunk of pages, but it doesnt mar or tear the pages.Its winter in Michigan and its dark and dreary, even with my living room lights, I am finding the extra light helpful this time of year.  Its amazing the difference it has made.Cherise Everhard, January 2015

I have the typical 4 sided grater that stands on its own with a variety of slices to choose from.  I tried this new one out on some parmesan and sharp cheddar cheeses and some citrus fruits.I liked the handle, its grip felt nice, natural.  I didnt feel as comfortable or as stable as I do when using my normal grater.  I kept waiting to slip and slice my hand open.  Luckily that never happened.  It sliced through everything very nicely and evenly.  I was impressed with the ease in which this little tool did its job.Im not sure I am ready to get rid of my old standby, but I can definitely can see me making this a part of my favorite cooking gadgets.Cherise Everhard, January 2015

When the charger arrived it had 3 out of the 4 bars lit up.  Naturally everything I own was fully charged, so I couldnt test it out right that minute.  About 2 weeks later I finally remembered to take it in to work where I am everyones iPhone charging station.  My girlfriends phone had died and she had already began charging it with my normal spare, and was at 20% - I had her switch to this one and within about 45 minutes she was fully charged.  Not the fastest charge, but her phone has a series of charging issues so we were very happy with the results.  When we were done, it still showed 3 bars!Ive never had a portable charger before, and I am finding this one to be very convenient.  I have used it a lot more than I thought I would, just thrown it in my purse with my phone and let it do its thing.I cant speak intelligently on its dual charging capabilities as I have yet to try that out.  I have only used it to charge one thing at a time, I imagine when I do finally use that I will update this review with my findings at that time.The battery itself holds its own charge very well.  I thought Id be charging that a lot more than I have been.  Its really very impressive.I have been very happy so far with mine and would definitely buy another or purchase one for a gift!Cherise Everhard, January 2015

I received this bag, for free, in exchange for an honest review.I love my yoga bag!  It fits my yoga mat in it nicely, without any struggle.  It also fits my mat towel, and my water bottle in the main compartment.  There is an inner zipper I can keep my license and keys and an outer zipper compartment for phone and keys.  The straps are adjustable and/or removable.There isnt much I can add that hasnt been mentioned in the product description.  My one critique is that my bag is black, and pretty standard looking.  I can see it getting lost in a sea of other yoga bags I wish there was a place on the outside to write your name or a cute little Yoga Addict name tag.The bag is lightweight and durable it seems to be very well made.  I had splashed a bit of coffee on my bag, and it wiped clean with a damp cloth.  The price seems comparable to other bags and seems a great gift for the yoga fan in your life.Cherise Everhard, December 2014

Grey and Ben had been childhood friends and sweethearts.  Then just a few short days before their wedding  Ben dies.  Greys world is destroyed.  Jagger, Ben and Greys lifelong friend, has been with Grey through the past two years watching her struggle to put her life back together.  When Grey decided its time for her to return to their hometown of Thatch, Jagger joins her.This book had a lot of angst and a lot of love in it.  Jagger has been in love with Grey since they were kids but stepped aside when Ben staked his claim first.  Hes getting impatient waiting for her to be his.  Hes ready, but when they get home there seems to be more than the ghost of Bens memory to contend with  Thatch is swimming in drama.I really loved the relationship between Jagger and Grey.  I liked that their friendship was old and solid and his feelings for her completely romantic and endlessly deep.  The sadness and struggles they both felt and dealt with regarding Ben also felt very real to life and brought many a tear to my eyes.What kept this book from being a five star  was the needless and what seemed endless drama once they reached Thatch.  It came at them from all sources.  It got to be way too much.  Too much drama, too many secrets, just too much for this girl.Even with all drama, this book was an excellent read and makes me wonder who is going to star in the next Thatch book.  It was my first book by Molly McAdams, but it wont be my last.Cherise Everhard, December 2014

I love this pan!I have used it to cook sandwiches, chicken, chicken breasts, fish, etc.  I love the grilled/ridged bottom that allows the food to be elevated above the fat.  So far I havent found one thing I dont like about the pan.The pan seems to cook evenly.  Its very light, yet durable.  Clean up is a dream and it there isnt a residual odor from the food cooked previously.  Sometimes when you cook a food with a strong scent, fish, onions.  It can linger on a pan even after it has been washed.  I havent found that to be true in this case.  Whatever has been cooked washes away completely, even the scent.I dont know what to say that hasnt already been said.  I can see where the price might scare some people off, but in this case you really do get what you paid for.  I cant see this pan only lasting for a short time, I see it being around for a while.  Ill be asking Santa to bring me some more this Christmas  I love mine!Cherise Everhard, October 2014

The cable that came with my iPhone 5c was crazy short.  I couldnt set my phone on my dresser, in the windowsill, or anywhere in my bedroom except for the floor.  I use my phone as an alarm clock so it is essential that I be able to get to it, but I hated having it where I could stomp it in a sleepy stupor.  I loved in constant fear that my phone would die by squishing.This chord is awesome!  Now my phone can reach my dresser from the outlet, or my window sill and I dont have to fall out of bed in an attempt to quiet the alarm before it wakes hubby!It didnt come with the wall outlet attachment, but I just used the one I bought for my iPhone and it worked perfectly with it.  I havent noticed any difference in the charging time or wireless performance as it states on the package.  It works just like my iPhone cable did.Im always nervous when trying a new brand, but luckily those nerves didnt last long.  I  have been using this product for a couple months now and if my cable should go missing, I would definitely purchase another one to replace it.  I am very happy.Cherise Everhard, July 2014This product was given to me in exchange for an honest review.

A friend of mine bought some towel hooks while on vacation one year and I have wanted some ever since.  Unfortunately, every time I found some, they were the wrong finish or design.  When I found these, I was excited.They fit nicely on my cabinet drawers or doors, whatever I chose.  Unfortunately, what they dont do is hold a towel.  I dont care the size, the thickness, the style Ive tried it all.  They fall off.  The actual hook is so small I dont think it could hold Barbies towel.Even after I failed with every hand towel I could come across, I began searching for towels with loops on them.  I figured a loop would have a better chance on the hook.  I finally stumbled across a set of towels from Target by Threshold that have tiny loops.  I thought I hit the jackpot.  I run home and place my towels on the hook and the towel touches the ground.  Gross.  So I put the hooks on the cabinet drawers and Success!!  Well, for a moment.  The minute you dry your hands, or open the drawer, the towel STILL comes off.My husband is going to try to bend the hook some more  to the point of closing it just enough to slide the towel loop in.  If that doesnt work, Im chucking them in the trash.  They were supposed to be handy in the kitchen; they are just causing me more work and money!!Cherise Everhard, July 2014

First of all I love this series and this author, I always feel like I have to say that before I give a not so favorable review.  3 stars arent bad, but its not that great, either.Larissa has been the personal assistant and masseuse to hunky ex-football star, Jack.  Recently relocated to Fools Gold with Jacks business and partners, Larissa has embraced Fools Gold and its people.  She and Jack have an interesting dynamic.  Not only are they co-workers, they are charitable partners and best friends.  They depend on each other for so much.  They balance.That is until Larissas mom comes to town and tells Jack that Larissa is in love with him.  Suddenly these two are looking at each other in whole different light.  Could Larissas mom be right?  And what could that do to their already perfect relationship?Since the beginning of this threesome of books, I have been eager for this story.  I liked the glimpses of Jack and Larissa I have read previously and their story had real promise.  Unfortunately the closer they got to their romance, the less they seemed like who they were.  Their characters morphed into something I didnt really recognize.  They both had their hang ups with the past but it got old real quick and the level of hurt and cruelty that was dished out, by multiple characters, to each other was ridiculous.Basically what started off strong and had me excited took a detour and changed the way I felt about their story.  Sure you get your happy ending, no surprise there, but its the conflict between Jack and Larissa, Jack and his ex and co-workers, that took this 5 star story down to a 3.  Luckily the conflict was short-lived.  Had I not had such high hopes, this may not have bothered me so much.  Still a good story, just could have been better.Cherise Everhard, July 2014

I like this necklace and have received several compliments each time I have worn it.  It is very delicate and feminine looking  but it is made sturdy enough that I dont feel like it is going to break at any moment.I did not receive the box it said it would ship in.  Instead it came in a tiny plastic bag shipped in a padded mailer - probably not the wisest packaging and shipping choice.  No the clarity and color is not the best, but it states the grading accurately and really at .25cttw you cant tell the color or the clarity without getting out a professional jewelers loop.  The photograph is an accurate representation and I think the price also reflects that.  It looks beautiful to me.I have a horrible time wearing necklaces as I find the chains are constantly snagging on my hair.  As a result when I do wear necklaces they are usually beaded or leather.  It has been nice to add another dressier necklace to my collection that I can wear without going bald in the process or ending up with a hair chain by the end of the night.Cherise Everhard, July 2014

I tested these new shoes out on vacation.  Probably not the smartest idea, but what better way to put a new shoe to the test than roaming from tourist attraction to tourist attraction?First of all with any new shoe it seems there is a breaking in period - a time to get used to the new shoe and how it feels on the foot.  I didnt experience that breaking in period.  In fact, from the moment I tried on the shoe I loved the fit.  Walking around all weekend long just confirmed my earlier thoughts.  The shoe is fantastic.I was hesitant ordering these shoes online, afraid I would get a shoe that didnt fit well.  The shoes are very light weight and fit my foot perfectly.  It is a very flexible shoe.  I did a half hour aerobic workout to test their flexibility on some more vigorous foot movements and the shoe passed with flying colors.  I dont run, but found this shoe to be great for walking and aerobics.I have never owned a New Balance shoe before, but after this one they will be the first I try in the future.  I cant find anything to complain about - the color, the look, the fit, the feel and the price are all wonderful.  After a weekend of breaking in my new shoes, I am blister free and happy with my new shoes!Cherise Everhard, July 2014

Living in the small town of Plum Orchard, working as a phone sex operator and fending off the moral patrol on a daily basis wouldnt seem like an ideal situation.  But Marybell Lyman has had one hell of a life  and no one knows the depths of her secrets, not even the women she considers her best friends/family, her fellow call girls.  For the past 4 years she has hidden behind what she calls her shield  a colorful spiky Mohawk hairdo and enough Goth makeup and clothing to put Marilyn Manson to shame.  She has a heart of gold  but most people stay far away, except Tag Hawthorne.  He seems to have made it his lifes mission to get to know the untouchable Marybell.  And he is the one person in the town she needs to keep hidden from.When I first started this book I was pleasantly surprised by the steamy sexual situations and witty banter.  I was intrigued by Marybells mask and past and found myself wanting to know more.  I even had decided to order the first books in the series so I could get to know the other side characters better and the back story more.  The more I learned the more curious I was to know how it all started.  I was convinced this was going to be a 5 star rating and I wanted more!But then somewhere along the way, I began to lose the enthusiasm and excitement.  As Marybell and Tag got closer, the feel of the book changed.  Things got a little cheesy and dramatic and then the momentum of the book slowed and suddenly I was more focused on just getting through this one, no longer interested in reading anymore.  By the end of the book I was happy with the result, but not elated or blown away.  It was a good book and although it wasnt as great as it started, I still enjoyed it.  Am I interested in reading anymore in the series?  Maybe, but Im not in the hurry that I once was in.Overall it was good.Cherise Everhard, June 2014

3.5 starsI love playing games with my son and husband.  We dont have much in common when it comes to indoor activities or television shows, so games we all enjoy are always welcome.First things first  some tedious assembly is required before you can play.  The instructions were easy enough to follow but it was still more work than what Id like when I want to play a game.  The score board/answer cards that you assemble are of cardboard and I ripped two in the process, they still work, but that made me wonder how long they are going to last.The game rules and directions were easy to follow and we all got a kick out of taking the oath at the beginning of the game and coming up with a punishment if we should be caught in lie.The giant green foam fingers were fun, at first, but soon became too hot and constrictive feeling.  We ended up alternating between holding them and wearing them.The game itself was fun to play but we decided more players, like my sisters family, would be even more fun.  It was a learning experience finding out what each of us Would or Have done, and we laughed a lot and talked a lot through the questions and turns.The age recommendation is 12 and up, and my son is almost 12  each card gives you a choice of 3 questions and a couple times I found it hard to ask one that would apply to him as they seemed a little over his head, not inappropriate, just not applicable.Overall, we had a lot of fun with this game and I cant wait to try it with a few more people.  I think even kicking the kids out of the equation and adding some adults and a few beverages could make for an entertaining evening.Cherise Everhard, June 2014

3.5 starsI inherited my mother in laws Nikon N50 years ago when she received the digital version.  I love the camera and had often borrowed it whenever we vacationed or I wanted to document an event with flawless photos.  Along with the 35-80mm lens I also have a 300mm lens.I like the padding in this bag, the shoulder straps, pockets, etc.  What I dont like in this bag and the other bags in my collection is that it seems that I either can store my camera and one lens or two lenses and no camera.  I wish I could comfortably fit all 3.  I like alternating between the two lenses and I do it quite frequently, especially while on vacation.  I have yet to find something that, like this one, is easy to carry and also good on protection, yet can haul everything.The one camera bag I do have that fits everything is more like a piece of carryon luggage - great for storage, but a pain for lugging around.I love the way my 300mm lens slides down into this one and is supported by the padding.  I wish there was more storage.  I realize I am a dinosaur, but I love film.  Id like to be able to comfortably fit film, extra batteries, etc.  I have a collection of Crown Royal Bags that I use to store my extra lens, film, batteries, etc.  I guess I can continue to carry one of those around in addition to this camera bag.  So I look a little ghetto with the tell-tale purple and yellow bag, at least I know where all my stuff is! Im still going to keep my eyes open for my perfect camera bag.Cherise Everhard, June 2014

My neighbor introduced me to this product many summers ago over a glass of wine.  She polished my wedding ring with the polishing cream, then put it in the little jewel soaker while we drank and chatted.  When she removed it I could not believe how clean my ring was  more than that I couldnt believe how filthy it had been!  It looked brand new.Since that time I have been a fan.  I have purchased it for every female in my family for Christmas and have used nothing else, since.  Because I have a platinum ring I have to occasionally I take my ring to the jewelers to get the scratches polished out because platinum scratches easy (not from the cleaner), but I no longer have to pay for them to clean it as I keep it clean with this stuff myself.Once upon a time my sister ruined a turquoise and silver ring of mine in jewelry cleaner my mom had  it destroyed the stone.  So far I havent found anything that this is harmful to.  I even left an amethyst necklace in it over night on accident and was pleased it was shiny  not ruined.This stuff lasts FOREVER!  When the polish cream started to harden, I just added a little water to soften it and it worked like new.  It is well worth the money.The addition of an eye glass cleaner this time around was new to me. But I have used it and found it works excellent as well!I am a huge fan of this product and will continue to buy and recommend it to others!Cherise Everhard, June 2014

My office manager recently brought in her Keurig so we ladies dont have to make the long trek to the coffee station in the main lobby.  Now we have our fancy coffee daily and dont have to fight with the salesman and customer to get a cuppa!I keep a drawer of snacks for those times when my hunger overtakes me and I need a quick fix, trail mix, raisins and instant oatmeal packets are always on hand.  When I was offered this product I was excited as it takes the normal oatmeal packets to a whole other level.I first poured the oatmeal and the fruit and nut packet in a mug and soon realized it was going to be way too small for my meal.  I didnt like how crammed it was going to be  so I transferred those contents to a bowl  then set the mug under the Keurig as directed.  Placed the little apple spice container in the machine and presto  a fragrant hot water came out.  It smelled like Hot Cider or Wassail - Yum.  We arent quite sure what ounces our Keurig is so I had used the smallest setting.  In mixing the oatmeal I felt, at first, it was going to be too watery.  So I ended up dumping a bit of the remaining water down the sink.  I was bummed that after it sat a while it thickened and I realized that water would have been perfect as it was a tad too dry for my tastes.  But the flavor was delicious and the oatmeal wasnt as mushy as instant oatmeal usually is.The next time I made it I used the full cup of water and was happy with the results.  The texture and moisture was perfect.  The addition of the fruit and nut packet make it more of a meal than a snack, but sometimes that is just what I need.  The box it all comes in is a bit bulky and space sucking, so I immediately ditched the box and used my own storage for its contents.  Its hearty, sweet and delicious, easy and quick to make.  I will be buying more and keeping them handy at work.Cherise Everhard, June 2014

I was all kinds of excited when I learned Elizabeth Lee would be writing a new series featuring motocross riders. I thoroughly enjoyed Reid and Nora's story in the first book, Throttled, and was anxious to get to read Brett's story. I wanted to see him get tamed. :)I can't deny I was a little apprehensive of the pairing between Brett and Georgia at first. She had been through so much already with losing her first husband at a young age and I wasn't entirely sure how she would pair with manwhore Brett. My fears were laid aside relatively quickly during this book because, honestly, once things started happening between them, Brett had eyes for no one else. (The best version of "tamed" I can ask for.) Even still, it wasn't all smooth going between them. While I can't say she was still hung up on her first husband, his loss definitely affected how she looked at life and love. She was terrified at the thought of losing love again and when the guy you're falling for has a dangerous job as Brett does, those fears get stirred up pretty quickly, understandably.I wound up really loving Brett and Georgia's story. He was healing from his injury. She was healing from losing Jamie. They were both going through a lot and I loved how they were there for one another. They had crazy chemistry and things got pretty steamy between them. While there were plenty of feels with this book, it was pretty low on angst, which I appreciated. There's no doubt these two were better together than apart. I loved reading along as Georgia got a second chance at love and began truly living again. I also, of course, enjoyed watching Brett find something real. It was a great story.Of course, we get a glimpse into some pretty special moments between Nora and Reid <3 as well as learning more about some of the other characters we were introduced to in the first book. And after the buildup between Chase and Hoyt  and that epilogue  I can't even tell you how much I'm already looking forward to their story in Clutched. February just can't get here fast enough!I received a copy of this book from the author in exchange for an honest review.

Kendall Ryan is an author whos been on my list of authors to try for quite awhile now. Somehow I missed this books release, but when I started seeing the companion novel Monster Prick advertised, I knew Id found just the book I needed to try. So, naturally, I decided I needed to read this one before Monster Pricks release so I had the whole story. Im glad I did. This was a great quick read that was as funny as it was sexy. I definitely enjoyed it.Books with manwhore lead characters are often off-putting to me, but this one wasnt. (I think that was because I did a little research and learned he was reformed early on, so we didnt really see that side of him. That Im ok with.) Hayden was an arrogant ass and crass as the day is long, but he was also funny and  deep down  a good guy. Hes on par with some of the other unapologetic manwhores Ive read in books and I did enjoy him. His mind was a fun place to spend a couple hours.I liked Emery, too. She was intelligent, driven, real and, most importantly, didnt roll over for Hayden immediately. She was (more or less) immune to his charms, but willing to consider building a friendship with him. Of course, these things have a way of escalating quickly when two people have as much chemistry as they did. But I liked that she held him at arms length at first anyhow. I enjoyed watching them get to know each other and become something more than friends with benefits.Screwed was a good book and one that I devoured in a matter of a couple hours. I found myself engrossed in Hayden and Emerys world and I enjoyed the lack of true angst  though there were twists and misunderstandings  and the abundance of humor. Ive already looking forward to Gracie and Hudsons story in Monster Prick. (Come on, November 17!)

Since I first picked up Wallbanger years ago, I've considered myself a big fan of Alice Clayton's books. She has her own special brand of humor and it shines through in the dialogue  internal and otherwise  of each of her heroines. It's not often I find books that are genuinely laugh out loud funny. Except, you know, when I'm reading one of her books. I had high hopes for Nuts and I wasn't disappointed.I love love loved the rural setting of Nuts. Watching Roxie transition from life in Hollywood to a much slower-paced life in upstate New York was wonderful... and, more often than not, hilarious. It was really fun to watch her come into her own back in her hometown, even if it was "temporary" at the time. I enjoyed reading along as she introduced the residents of Bailey Falls and the patrons of her mom's diner to new and delicious meals and as she interacted with them. (And, of course, hot farmer Leo.)The chemistry between Roxie and Leo was apparent from their very first meeting, when  thanks to some rogue sugar snap peas  he ended up facedown in her lap on the floor with his (wal)nuts all over the place. (Which, PS, is one of my absolute favorite scenes in the entire book. I literally laughed out loud. Went back and reread it. Laughed out loud again. Brilliant.) Leo was just what Roxie needed to keep from getting bored during the summer back in her hometown. And, you know, it was just for the summer... so what could go wrong? It was never meant to be anything serious. (*cough*)Of course, it's not all fun and games and sexy times (though there are PLENTY of those... and they're hot). There has to be a little drama to drive the story forward, right? I was honestly 100% surprised by the "twist" introduced in the book. It took me aback for a little while because it was a pretty big secret to keep, but I got over it. And, honestly, I think it even made the whole story that much better once I accepted what was going on.Nuts was a great start to a smart and sexy new series. The characters were fantastic. I loved the humor. The sexy times were pretty darn hot. There was really only one thing that didn't sit all that well and that was the heavy handedness of the talk about organic farming. And, honestly, that was more my personal beliefs (as well as growing up with a lot of traditional farmers, and working with them to this day) and not something that was wrong with the book. That said, it still didn't keep me from thoroughly enjoying the book. The secondary characters were nearly as fantastic as Roxie and Leo. I can't wait for Cream, the second book in this series. I think Oscar and Natalie will make a fantastic pair and I'm excited to read their story. Oh, backtrack for a second... the epilogue? From Leo's perspective? 1000% perfection. It might be my favorite chapter in the entire book. I finished this book with a happy heart and a goofy grin.I received a copy of this book from the publisher in exchange for an honest review.

I'm going to leave a short but sweet review for this one before I leave a full review on my blog next week. I loved everything about this book. EVERYTHING. I was so ready for the conclusion to Gavin & Dixie's story, but I wasn't sure if my heart could take it. I knew it would be an emotional journey and I was right but it was beyond perfect for them. I couldn't have asked for a better ending to what is easily one of my favorite new adult series. It was sweet, sexy and had feels for days. I hated seeing this series come to an end, but when that end as good as this one was? All I can do is smile, wipe a tear and plan to a full series reread soon. :)

Kristen Ashley has done it again! (Not that I'm at ALL surprised by this. She's a genius.) I started Walk Through Fire in the midst of a moment of panic during a HUGE book hangover and it was exactly the thing I needed to get me over it. (And, of course, leave me with a hangover for a completely different book.)Anyone who follows my blog knows I'm a total sucker for a second chance love story. It's one of my favorite tropes. The first part of Millie and Logan's story ended twenty years ago  we don't know exactly why, but we do know it wasn't pretty. I had some rough moments with Logan during the beginning of this story, ones I was entirely sure I'd be able to move past, but I did. Oh, did I ever. It took some time, but I was singing the man's praises for sure by the end.I liked Millie at the beginning, though I was a little cautious because I didn't know what exactly she'd done in the past to break Logan like she did. I didn't want to be too far in her corner if there was a chance she'd done something unforgivable. Gods, it was just the opposite. Of course, I'm not going to spoil things for you, but damn. Her story broke my heart. It was with the revelation of the truth that Logan finally won me over entirely, too. It wasn't all pretty, but it was real and raw and I felt every single minute of it.Of course, moving on from issues of the past was only part of the challenge for this couple. His daughter was determined to cause problems  I don't know when I last wanted so badly to wring the neck of a character in a book  and there's the ongoing saga with Benito that kept me on edge several times throughout this book. Through it all, however, there was no doubt in my mind that Millie and Logan were the real deal and that they would, eventually, work past the other things and move towards something real again. They had it all  chemistry, passion, love and mutual respect. They got each other. They understood each other's lives. They belonged together.I loved getting lost in the world that Kristen has built here with Chaos. I love her writing, characters and stories. I feel like I'm living it, not just reading it. I had ALL THE FEELS and I loved (nearly) every second of it. And that epilogue? *contented sigh* I couldn't have asked for anything more perfect than that was. I'm not entirely sure who gets the next book (but damn, I sure hope it's Hound) but I do know I'll be waiting anxiously to find out and get my hands on it.I received a copy of this book from the publisher, via NetGalley, in exchange for an honest review.

Surviving Ice was of the read in one sitting variety for me. It grabbed me right from the very start and there wasnt a chance I was stopping until I finished it. I loved Ivy and Sebastian both, so I was as gripped by their chemistry  and eventually the romance  as I was the suspense.Ivy was a great, strong female lead and I admired the way she was handling everything surrounding the death of her uncle. A lesser woman wouldve broken, but she remained strong. She intrigued me in Chasing River, so I was thrilled to learn the final book in the series would be hers. Sebastian was a fantastic male lead. I loved that we got to spend roughly half the book inside his head. (Dual POV, when done right, are my favorite.) He was keeping plenty of secrets and couldve been quite dangerous to Ivy, but I still liked him. And I LOVED the sexual tension between him and Ivy.It was impossible not to find Ivy and Sebastian a perfect match. They complemented each other so well. They were both strong and independent. Their chemistry was smokin hot right from their very first meeting. I couldnt wait to see how the story between them progressed as secrets were revealed. Oh, and its worth mentioning their chemistry at the beginning and the resulting sexual tension gave way to some SERIOUSLY HOT sexy times. I was definitely fanning myself.Surviving Ice wasnt an edge of your seat type of suspense book, but I liked that part of the storyline. I was so sad for Ivy and her loss and I was legitimately concerned about how much she knew and what danger that knowledge would land her in. I NEEDED to know how things would turn out and thats definitely part of what kept me obsessed with finishing this book  in a matter of just a few hours. The other parts, of course, was the characters and the kissing. :)Man, I hate to see this series come to an end, but Im glad it wrapped up the way it did. I had pretty high expectations for this final book and it exceeded all of them. I thought it was a great way to finish up this series and, though Im sad its over and that I have to give these characters up for now, I cant wait to see what Kathleen gives us next.I received a copy of this book from the publisher, via NetGalley, in exchange for an honest review.

Lia Riley is one of my new favorite adult contemporary authors. If it wasn't official after Last First Kiss and Right Wrong Guy, it definitely is after Best Worst Mistake. I loved her new adult series, but I think I might love the Brightwater series even more. (Shhhhh.) I've been looking for a series to fill that small town sweet romance hole left in my heart when Candis Terry's Sweet, Texas series ended and this is definitely the one. Of course, it's also over now (*wipes tears*) so I guess I have to go back to the drawing board again.Best Worst Mistake was exactly the book I needed in my life when I read it. It was sweet, sexy, heartwarming and romantic. I fell head over heels for the characters and loved their story. It's a kind of Beauty & the Beast retelling and it just totally made my heart happy. Be prepared for the big cheesy grins  and a fair few feels  when you read this one.I've been waiting for Wilder Kane's story since I first heard about him earlier on in the series. And, let me tell you, Lia wastes no time jumping into the story this time around. That first chapter? Holy cow. There wasn't a chance in hell I could put this book down once I started. It was definitely of the "read in one sitting" variety for me. Wilder was nothing short of amazing. I do love watching a closed off man let go of the baggage of the past and realize that life can still be good  or even great  even if it's different than he thought it would be. I just wanted to give him a big hug and tell him it would be alright... that it would be BETTER than alright.Quinn was no slouch herself. She was intelligent, sassy and a little bit awkward. I swear, I fell for her about the first time she started babbling  something she does A LOT. I loved her quirky side and her book-themed tees. I liked how honest she was and my heart ached for the things she was dealing with when it came to her father and his health... and the possible implications on her own health. She was such a realistic character. You couldn't help but love her.Together Wilder and Quinn were nothing short of magical. There was heat  oh boy was there  but there was also something real and raw, right from the beginning. She helped him realize that he's not a broken man and that he's more than the sum of his injuries. He helped her realize that life is worth living and enjoying to the fullest, even if there might be an expiration date on the memories made. My heart was so full as I watched these two come together, let go and find something real. Add to that appearances by the earlier couples and Grandma and this book was the perfect series-ender.I'm so sad this series has come to an end, but even more, I'm excited to see what Lia gives us next. She's definitely on my auto-buy author list. I'll read anything she writes and I strongly suspect I'll continue to love each new character, book and series. I can't recommend this one enough!

Upon reading the blurb for this book at the end of Perfection, I promptly went to Amazon, bought a copy and jumped right in. I'm a total sucker for romances between two enemies. Rory and Connor had a heck of a history  and the whole town knew it. I couldn't wait to see what would happen when those competitive, angry feelings turned into something else. Throw in a fake relationship and some very real chemistry, and I was totally hooked.I really liked both Rory and Connor. Their backstory made me shake my head and laugh. It was over-the-top... in the best way possible. When they are both picked to work on the same construction project, sparks fly and things just get more interesting. I loved their banter and their chemistry. They might've been rivals who hated each other in theory, but there was so much more there than that. The plot was a little spastic at times, but I didn't care one single bit. I enjoyed reading about these two characters so much, the oddities barely registered. I knew once the fake relationship agreement was thrown in, things would get interesting quickly and I was right. I had a big ol' goofy grin on my face during the biggest part of this book.Checkmate was fun. I liked that characters from the first two books made an appearance and reading this book strengthened my resolve to both go back and read the first book and continue reading this series. Not only was it laugh out loud funny, it was also charming, sexy and romantic. I'm definitely a fan of this author and series.

This book was first brought to my attention by my friend Steph (of No BS Book Blog) when she did the Harry Potter Spells Book Tag. Unlike me, Steph isn't big on the "reading for feels" thing so when she talked about how she loved this one, how much it made her feel and how she regularly rereads it, I knew I had to find out what all of the fuss was about.If I'm honest, I have to admit that after a couple chapters, I wasn't sure if this book was for me. I kept going because I trusted Steph's opinion and there was something kinda charming about the characters, even if there were a couple things bugging me. I'm really glad I kept going, too. It was a delightfully quirky, romantic and funny book.Though this was the second book in the series, I didn't really feel lost or like I'd missed much by not reading the first. (Though I do plan to go back and read it at some point.) The only thing that was kind of a mystery was the Bradford obsession with food. I'm not sure if the first book clears that up any or not. While odd, I could still read and enjoy the book without knowing the trigger for their obsession.The characters totally made this book. I liked Zoe pretty well from the start. I could sympathize with her over her weight issues and Trevor's attitude in the beginning towards her made me really skeptical I would come to love him. There's just no easy way to put this  he was a douche. He was attracted to her, but didn't know what to do with those feelings and it wasn't pretty at first. BUT, he mellowed. He accepted his attraction and I absolutely loved watching him fall for the woman who is unlike the women he's usually attracted to. I think I loved it most of all because of the way his character transformed and the awkwardness that ensued as he accepted his feelings. They were super cute together once he stopped being a jerk.Perfection was funny and heartwarming and definitely gave me plenty of feels. As uncertain as I was in the early chapters, I liked this one a lot. Plus the blurb for the following book caught my attention so I'm pretty sure I'll continue on with this series... and I still want to go back and read the first one.
