What I would have liked to know before I bought this EROTICA/PORN book. (Minor spoilers)THIS BOOK IS FOR ADULTS ONLY1. What type of book is it: adventure, action, drama, etc?  An erotic supernatural monster harem story.2. What is the story about, in general? The story involves Zack/Mary figuring out what the `big plan' behind all the coincidences in his/her life has been. Sadly, it might INVOLVE that plot but it's not ABOUT that. The book is about Zack/Mary and his/her friends exploring every possible erotic genre and fetish imaginable. The book, in essence, tries to break through almost every possible social taboo short of child pornography and incest.3. What/Who is the target audience? I believe the book is tilted towards a male adult audience. Females can enjoy it too, but they aren't the target. Nevertheless the story does touch on many fetishes.4. What are the erotica genres in this book? Major Emphasis:  Non-human (Fae, Were, Yeti, Vampire, Succubus). Lesbian sex. Heterosexual sex. Sharing. Swapping. Polygamy. Loving Wife (The wives DO have sex outside of the relationship. Often with people the husband never meets or knows.) Group sex. Minor Emphasis:  Fetish (Public bathroom sex, office Sex, watching, peeking). Debatable Emphasis: Transsexual (Magic changes genders, so it's not exactly a man dressing as a woman or a woman dressing as a man).5. How is the proofreading? Very few spelling errors or kindle format mistakes. Thus, its good.6. Do the characters evolve? Are they likable? The character development gets pretty shallow as the book descends into almost unrestricted smut and ego porn. There are some limits, but few. Zack does evolve, not because of action events in the story, but because he is changed into a woman and now explores his feminine side upon occasion.7. Do you have to suspend disbelief? The only real thing that threatened my disbelief was the introduction of the Grandparents. A book and change in this series and Grandparents suddenly pop up like whack-a-moles. They are mentioned in one liners, here and there, but never as ALIVE.Beyond that, I didn't take the book too seriously considering that it abandons non-erotic pretenses and engaging romance.8. Does the story keep its pacing?  The story gets pretty dull as it avoids exploring the vast dimensional universe that Zack visits. The adventure usually comes to Zack in the form of demonic/Arch-Demon attacks or requests to help with the sporadic rescue or tragedy. Like the previous book, most of the book story takes place at Zack's home or the mall. The Tarantula is a third spot.This book is not really about Zack's dangerous conflicts. It's about providing Zack and family the necessary credible scenes for sexual exploration and taboo breaking. As an EROTICA book, it considerably overreaches. As an ADVENTURE book, it's pretty dull.9. Is the book worth the asking price? This is a $5 book and closes on the upper level of standard ebook prices. Considered on its own merit, I would have liked to pay less. Since the first book is priced at 99 cents, the combo price is alright.In conclusion: This is a thematically shallow book that is very ambitious in its desire to break through reader taboos. It does this through Zack's character development and by sacrificing the inherent adventure possibilities in the vast dimensional world. Dangerous story conflicts are filler. They are used to provide credible reasons for Zack to explore his different genders and break through the mentioned taboos. The background plot calcifies under the constraints required to push the porn/erotica relations. Some readers might find credible romance strained because intimacy is shared with far too much ease to match the heartfelt proclamations of love. The proofreading is above average, with almost no spelling errors or kindle format goofs. The price is $5 which is merely `ok' for this story volume but, if combined with the 99 cents of the first book, remains cheap. This is a rather risky book. It explores so many erotic genres that many a reader might be offended at one time or another. A reader might enjoy the erotica if they try to read it with a very open mind. Story wise, it might not be involving enough to satisfy most expectations.2.7 Stars

What I would have liked to know before I bought this book. (minor spoilers)(Eventually... FOR ADULTS ONLY)1. What type of book is it: adventure, action, drama, etc? This is an urban fantasy romance harem story. It's also rather `slice of life' manga-ish. I was NOT aware of this when I began reading.2. What is the story about, in general? The story is about Zack. He is a down on his luck Shadow Walker that wants to find a job to pay the rent without going crazy. The job he finds turns out to be a door for self discovery with some light adventure, and a lot of sexy monster girls.3. What/Who is the target audience? Young adults and those with a penchant for harem manga genre.4. How is the proofreading?  Average. I have found some spelling mistakes and a ton of Kindle format errors. The combination of `goofs' is not glaring but does permeate the entire story.5. Is there character development? Evolution is slow but it is there. The main character is written cute, funny, VERY wounded, generally submissive, powerful and kind to a fault. He is the other side of the `bad boy' passion stereotype. In short, he is almost Tenchi Muyo (manga character) in his qualities. These qualities are there from the very beginning, but the reader slowly explores them through the book. I am not sure if it should be called character `evolution'. It's more along the lines of character `exploration'.The characters began to blur together for me. There were simply too many to keep track properly. Twice, I had to backtrack to figure out who a secondary character was. Also, most of the women are `drum roll' babes or almost babes. It made me wish for a dumpy grumpy female protagonist of some kind.6. Are the characters likable?  It's a light romance harem story. That only works if the protagonists are likable.  There is a level of compelling perversity about the whole set of relationships because ... ehem ... its one guy and a lot of women ... and they don't mind sharing.7. Do you have to suspend disbelief? Any idealistic world where loving partners easily, willingly and without malice share their intimacy with others strains my disbelief. I am not saying it doesn't happen. I am saying that it MOSTLY doesn't happen. Lastly, I found the marriage thing supremely ridiculous. That's all I'm going to call it, `marriage thing'. I have a MINOR spoiler tag and think this is as far as I can push it. I wish it had been funny so I could laugh about it.8. Does the story keep its pacing? This book has a very interesting supernatural premise that is used as a basis for a male fantasy harem story. The books focus is soft erotica. The story is not based around pornography but it IS based around sexual tension, and eventually involves sexual acts. Though I don't mind some 'ego porn' (scenes were the protagonist is lauded with praise or admired) the book is eventually clogged with far too much of it. Most of the story takes place in two places: a mall and an apartment. Thus, if there is any doubt, this book is NOT an action story. It has some action events, but those are merely used as tension building devices to stroke the `ego porn' aspect of the story.9. Is the book worth the asking price? It is a 99 cent ebook. That is very cheap for a 550-600 page book.In conclusion: This is a very slow soft erotica urban fantasy harem book that focuses on sexual tension and some soap opera drama. Eventually, two scenes are so explicit they cross the line into full porn/erotica. The main protagonist's abilities and the world building might intrigue some readers. As the erotica and ego porn increase, readers might grow less enchanted with the story because most of the action seems injected not for itself, but for the cuddling and hugs afterwards. The fertile ground for grand adventure is left mostly, but not completely, fallow. Events grow increasingly hokey until swift changes near the end of the book finally clip the 'hokeyness' to manageable levels. This might be too little too late for some readers. There is very little that will interest readers outside of the `boy fantasy` or 'monster erotica' target audience. The proofreading is average because of kindle formatting errors, missing words, switched words, etc. The price is VERY cheap. Regardless of my disappointments, I was entertained by the story to the point that I think it is a slightly above average `ok' read. If you're the target audience, give it a try. It won't break your bank.3.1 Stars

What I would have liked to know before I bought this book. (no spoilers)1. What type of book is it: adventure, action, drama, etc? This is a sci-fi alien invasion survival thriller.2. What is the story about, in general? The story is about the adventures of a small group of scientists and U.S. Marines that find themselves among the very few survivors (less than 10) of an alien invasion.3. What/Who is the target audience? Teenagers, young adults and alien invasion aficionados.4. How is the proofreading? The kindle version suffers from a lack of scene divisors. The fact that you don't initially know when a scene begins or ends, trips the reader up considerably.5. Is there character development? We get to at least know the characters. Their personalities are unchanging, without evolution. On top of that, the conflicting personalities have a predictable diorama that could have been picked from any multitude of movies. Almost none of the protagonists show more than cursory pain at the loss of their loved ones. It made the characters incomplete, almost vaguely robotic. The only prevalent worry of planetary death is emphasized at every opportunity. Not too shabby on this point.6. Are the characters likable? So-so. I don't find most of the characters particularly immature. I find their actions logical, if lacking the deepness of truly rounded individuals. I like that the characters make believable mistakes. Some of those mistakes felt dumb, but were in line with the stress of the situation. Of all the characters, the Marines were the most entertaining. They were the ones actively involved in pushing the overall conflict thread forward.7. Does the story keep its pacing? This is the part that hurts the story quite a bit. Most of the read is rather dull because it is predictable. There are maybe three action scenes that were interesting. The rest of the time, I was able to telegraph exactly what was going to happen chapters ahead of time. I didn't need to read the content. I actually tested this by coming on to a crucial point, analyzing the tendency of the story and simply skimming ahead. I was spot on. The ending, admittedly, was NOT exactly predictable. Yet, that was the one point where the story should have had some amount of predictability. In short, the ending was very unsatisfying.8. Do you have to suspend disbelief? A LOT of logic errors, moments of improbability and other factors strained by disbelief. ****For the sake of not providing spoilers in the review, I am going to list all these points on a comments thread.****9. Is the book worth the asking price? It is a 99 cent ebook. There is no reason at all to not purchase the ebook and give it a chance. It is less than a bottle of water.In conclusion: This story is a mixed bag. In one hand the story experiences a rather dull and predictable series of events. These -do- manage to remain within the scope of the story's alien invasion. On the other, it has good moments of action that sporadically inject energy to the dull story. Most characters don't evolve beyond the range of their initial roles and lacked the scope of well rounded personalities. The dialogue felt mature, but the predictability made it a little inconsequential. The ending, honestly, is disheartening because it is the sort of thing that should happen MIDST book, not at the end. The proofreading is good, except that there is ZERO indications of when a scene ends and another starts (kindle format). The price is modicum at 99 cents. In short, this is an 'OK' story, with serious kindle formatting problems, a bland ending and generic protagonists.2.6 Stars

What I would have liked to know before I bought this book. (minor spoilers)1. What type of book is it: adventure, action, drama, etc? This is a fast paced superhero action thriller.2. What is the story about, in general? The story is about Mathew, a normal yet brilliant man with a vicious tumor that decides to roll the dice by scheming his way into a superpowered death match, in order to earn the money to be cured.3. What/Who is the target audience?  Superhero fans, comic fans, young adults and teenagers.4. How is the proofreading? I didn't notice any spelling errors. Good job.5. Is there character development? No. The characters have very static roles. The main protagonist doesn't face any real moral dilemmas. Sure, he had to overcome difficult trials, but every single life and death encounter, except for one, had little moral ambiguity. The main character, literally, only kills the `blood thirsty' players. He never has to contend with the dilemma of killing or fighting someone that doesn't deserve it. He has difficult hurdles but not difficult choices. He is also rather generic. Frankly, he's a little unimpressive. Except for the love interest, I find all secondary characters lacking in depth. Regardless, they support the main protagonist in a compelling manner.6. Are the characters likable? Sure, the main protagonist is likable. Understand that the main character's affliction is an almost exact carbon copy of John Travolta's role in the movie `Phenomenon' and move on from there. You will find analogs for Superman, Shadowcat, Silver Samurai, a dumb Franklin Richards, an evil Quicksilver/Flash, Colossus and Giant Man, among others. The character clichs are obvious but they are done in a somewhat compelling manner. They somehow didn't break my story immersion. Understand that the reader doesn't really get to know these characters very well. They serve a role and are discarded. At most, they felt like distant acquaintances.7. Does the story keep its pacing? Yes. It is a royal rumble. What's not to like? Having said that, the book was rather cookie cutter and sanitized. The story doesn't take any real risks with the main character. The protagonist enters a death match and only kills the ones that perfectly earned their deaths.  I wish the story had taken at least ONE real risk, but it doesn't. Either way, it was entertaining. I can't say I was bored. This book moves pretty fast.  Every single twist and turn that this book is able to deliver, I have seen elsewhere. I mostly knew who would defeat whom and how. Perhaps someone with less reading experience will be surprised. I welcome their rush of discovery.A bright note is the light romance. It was actually well done, relaxing even.8. Do you have to suspend disbelief? Yes. There wasn't any real brilliance in how the protagonist went about fighting in the deathmatch. In fact, the tactics were very predictable. My disbelief is challenged with the convenience of coincidences that allows the protagonist to have the PERFECT ally, with the perfect weapon, at the perfect time and in a perfect position.  I count at least 5 coincidences in a row for that to happen.9. Is the book worth the asking price? The ebook is $5 and is within the range of a standard read. It's not an excessive price.In conclusion: A story with a world premise that is very interesting but that does not take any risks. The main protagonist faces no compelling morally ambiguous or ethical contentions. The most glaring moral ambiguities conveniently fix themselves. With one or two exceptions, most supporting characters lack enough depth to be deeply memorable. The light romance manages to be both sweet and enjoyable. The flow of the story is pretty fast and steady. The action is well written, if not very surprising. The price is $5 and approaches the high end of standard ebook prices. I didn't notice any spelling errors as the fast pace kept my attention moving. In short, the merits of this read hedge out the weaknesses with enough style to be entertaining. I think most readers will have some fun.3.1 Stars

What I would have liked to know before I bought this book. (minor spoilers)1. What type of book is it: adventure, action, drama, etc? This is a military sci-fi action story.2. What is the story about, in general? The story is about Jeffrey, his son Leif and Stacey. The three are embroiled in a crazy conspiracy that will endanger local space.3. What/Who is the target audience? Teenagers, young adults, fighter pilot aficionados, military sci-fi aficionados and those who enjoy the strangest conspiracy theories.4. How is the proofreading? I didn't see more than two errors the entire time.5. Is there character development? Yes and no. The story timeframe is pretty short. Because of this the reader doesn't really evolve with the characters. How much evolution can a character do in one or two weeks? Of all the protagonists, Jeffrey is the only one that stands out as a three dimensional character in more ways than one. We have a compelling physical description, a skill set, a particular way of looking at events and experience. Leif lacks description and feels generic. Stacey is the typical clich babe with the tough background that makes her more appealing. Frankly, all characters beyond Jeffrey are pretty shallow. Antagonists are one dimensional in extremis for most of the read. Their character evolution comes too little too late.6. Are the characters likable? Yes and no. Jeffrey is likable because he is the only one that feels `real'. The other two main characters I can only describe as `fuzzy'. It's like I can't quite picture them as people, more like generic frames. They aren't unlikable, but they don't instill a sense of investment. The antagonists are probably the worst of the lot. They are (forgive me for the childishness) lame. I felt more entertainment, even more respect, for the generic one dimensional scene fodder goons than the actual antagonist leaders.  The antagonist leaders are crazy. I don't mean `compelling story' crazy. I mean `how the heck can these crazy nuts tie their shoe laces together' sort of crazy.7. Does the story keep its pacing? I would say that the story kept its focus for about sixty percent of the book, according to kindle. I enjoyed the manner the book began. We're thrust into the middle of the story with a bang. It was great. I loved the aerial combat descriptions and the mentality behind them.I lost significant reader immersion when I realized what the whole big conspiracy was all about. The execution lacked the most basic appeal to me.8. Do you have to suspend disbelief? With regards to the events involved, yes.Two scenes felt slipshod and farfetched in the first sixty percent of the book. Those were mere irritants that added some spice to the story, even when they felt forced upon it. There are, at least, three different logic errors that stress my disbelief as they would affect story resolution.The main conspiracy in the tale is so farfetched, so insane and so out of proportion to logical thought that it may break reader immersion. Considering how crazy humans can be, I don't doubt people may believe the craziest things. I simply cannot believe the scope and reach of this particular conspiracy. Though some nations might have leaders whose political and popular ideals support twisted insanities, those leaders in question have dedicated secular and religious mechanisms that uphold those illusions (North Korea's god ruler comes to mind). The antagonists in this book do not have such mechanisms and have regardless been able to build a powerful network of cult fanatics that's similar to the Scientology infiltration (Operation Snow White) of the U.S. government in the 1970s.9. Is the book worth the asking price? I had a lot of fun for about sixty percent of the book and the volume costs around $4. Give it a shot. At worst you'd be out a movie popcorn bag.In conclusion: This book is a roaring military sci-fi story with thrusters that sputter before reaching the end. The main conflict point lacks the necessary background to make the conflict both compelling and believable. The lack of background builds a frivolous base for the fun military action. As the story progresses, the action become increasingly convenient, evolves faulty logic and incredulous coincidences. The main protagonists are `ok' but merely `ok'. The antagonists are severely underwhelming. The price of the book is good at $4. The proofreading is well above average. Well done on this. The book, regardless of all its faults, still manages to build a somewhat interesting weave that makes it impossible to completely dismiss it. To me, it was a slightly below average experience that almost, but not quite, pulled it off. I will consider reading the next installment, but will definitely have to think about it. Nevertheless, this author really does have a ton of potential.2.8 Stars

Since this is a rather well established book, with a lot of reviews, I'm going to forgo my usual point by point review format for the sake of brevity.Zero Sight is written with an interesting prose and verse. It feels both artistic and humorous. The young adult main character has a compelling sense of wit, perspective and wryness that charms and exasperates in equal measure.The book doesn't really 'DO' much. You won't find an epic struggle for the fate of the world. In fact, a good portion of the story is taken up with detailed peculiarities of magical perception, wonderfully excessive verbosity and wry commentary. It is one of the few reads where most of the verbosity is entertaining enough to forgive its detraction from the story pace.The story itself revolves around the main protagonist acclimatizing to the new world he's in. It's a book of learning and understanding. There won't be a lot of 'exploration' but certainly a good quantity of 'adaptation'.There are a few spelling errors from both kindle glitches and simple editing mistakes, but these are minor.This is a good book.3.8 Stars

What I like about this game.Its easy to get into with simple screen touch controls. The tanks look funny and non-threatening. That makes it a nice kids game because it all looks like cute ping-pong balls bouncing around. Even the sound reinforces that perception. The game, IMO, is rather short but has a lot of re-play value. It doesn't take any time to start blasting away, and the game doesn't require extensive training to get going.What I don't like about this game:There are a few odd bugs. Exploding enemy tanks, in the middle of their explosion cinematic, can sometimes send 1 ball your way. Found that odd.  Towers can be shot at range without any retaliation. Makes them too easy. No color selection for your tank. You're green.Wished the levels were more complex and difficult with extensive combat areas.Off the top of my head, this is all I remember about this game.  IMO, it is worth the effort of a download. :)

My observations on this package.1. The item came stamped from China. That was a bit of a surprise as I thought I was purchasing from USA.  Live and learn.2. I verified the quality of the roll brushes and have found some differences to the OEM ones. The metal grooves on the support rod of the smaller brush remove a larger amount of metal. The rod seem to be slightly thinner. The machining is cruder. That means the brush is weaker. The black plastic fans on the smaller brush are less sturdy then the OEM ones, more malleable.3.The side brushes were a pleasant surprise. They are much better made than all the replacement brushes I have seen. Instead of seeing a cut on the plastic and knitted brush strands, there was no cut and the strands seem inserted into a support inside the white plastic blades. VERY nice.As you can see, there are some good points, some bad points and a surprise.  I still think this was a good purchase, but the differences did provide me with some worry.

What I would have liked to know before I bought this book. (no spoilers)1. What type of book is it: adventure, action, drama, etc? This is an epic fantasy with a lot of military action and some small group adventures. It also has a lot of soap opera.2. What is the story about, in general? The story is about the 2nd Rebellion/War. Previous protagonists are now woven into a larger web. The story is not about -them- in the war, but about the war and them in it.3. What/Who is the target audience? Teenagers, young adults and high fantasy aficionados.4. How is the proofreading? There are some spelling errors, but not many. Was able to notice about three.5. Is there character development? With one singularly powerful exception, not really. The evolution of the main protagonists doesn't evolve in this installment. In this book, they use their learned lessons to push forward the epic fantasy. Most of the characters overcome difficult obstacles, but their emotional and personal sacrifices are minimal. I still cannot consistently keep in mind Miro's face or features. His description perpetually slips away. That's not good. It makes him generic. Killian has very little page time and matching character evolution. He's delegated to a secondary or tertiary role.The single powerful exception is Amber, of all people! Though her role is limited, Amber suffers through hell and comes out stronger in the end. Sadly, Amber is the 'defacto' archetype that needs to be rescued a few times. It gets repetitive.6. Are the characters likable? Yes and no. The story implements the 'virgin' pure archetype with most of the female protagonists. Almost none of them arrive in the story experienced with men. They are virgins until they bed the man, or one of the men, they love. Culture doesn't seem to be a factor. The men, of course, aren't so limited. They all exude the experience of ... well ... experience. I didn't understand why have that dichotomy.Last, in this installment the protagonists have evolved complexity but become unbalanced towards merits. Their flaws fail to resurface, as if they are forgotten.7. Does the story keep its pacing? There are a lot of clichs and HUGE jumps in time. I did not find those pleasing, but the book does keep focused on what it wants to deliver. There are enough epic battles and high adventures to keep me coming back for more.8. Do you have to suspend disbelief? I'm sorry to say, yes. There are clichs upon cliches and coincidences upon coincidences. Certain characters, no matter what distance apart they are, what si1tuation or what improbable adverse situations they find themselves in, WILL conveniently meet for the maximum theatrical and drama effect. That means that characters will meet, not only improbably, but at the precise window of convenient opportunity necessary for the most. The author doesn't take time to build a successive series of events that would lead to such meetings. They simply happen. Deal with the coincidence.9. Is the book worth the asking price? $4 isn't bad at all and giving the book a try won't break your bank.In conclusion: This is an epic fantasy story that is marred only by time jump pacing issues, massive amounts of clichs and awfully predictable or convenient scenes. To balance such, the reader is also presented with fast engrossing action scenes and moments of heroism. Epic battles will feed our need for affirmative heroic action. The light of hope shines bright in a dark world even as new threats crop up to engage our protagonists. Sadly, the attractiveness of the characters spans the whole gamut of levels; from the very compelling to the forgettable and bland. The antagonists continue to be singularly one dimensional in their rapaciousness, if clever in their goals. The price for this installment is $4 and is still within the modicum range. The proofreading is pretty good with almost no jarring spelling errors. I think the readers might enjoy this book, if they can successfully deal with the predictability of seriously telegraphed events, the cliches, and the coincidences.3.0 Stars

What I would have liked to know before I bought this EROTICA/PORN book. (no spoilers)THIS BOOK IS ABSOLUTELY NOT FOR CHILDREN1. What type of book is it: adventure, action, drama, etc? This is an urban fantasy erotic supernatural thriller.  Wow, that's a mouthful of adjectives.2. What is the story about, in general? The story is about Ceridwen Brent, a brilliant thaumatology graduate researcher and her changing relationship with Lily, her half-succubus boarder.3. What/Who is the target audience? Adults who enjoy stories with a lot of lesbian, bisexual and kinky sex.4. What are the erotic genres seen or hinted at within this story? Predominantly: sexual tension (the hint of sex, but no sex), non-human (half-demon), lesbian, bisexual.  Minor:  MILF, sharing, older male/younger female, heterosexual.5. How is the proofreading? I think there are many sentence structures that could have been written better. On the first few pages you will notice tense errors (past mixed with present and such).6. Are the characters likable? Most character's are enjoyable in a superficial manner and sexy in their own way. They provide a general basic story among the raunchy sex innuendo or plain sex. Some are pillar characters for divergent branches of erotic naughtiness.There is character evolution but the changes are sometimes abrupt, chaotic, and ultimately resolved by (drum roll) sex, kinky sex or sexual related innuendo. Its pretty darn shallow. Then again, it's an erotica book. Enjoy it for what it is and you'll do fine.7. Does the story keep its pacing?  It all depends. The book targets particular kinky delights. If you happen to like supernatural non-human(Lily is half demon) lesbian sex, you might not be disappointed.One thing that is interesting about this story is that the sex is never very detailed. Instead of long drawn out sexual escapades, the author focuses more in the innuendo leading to it, brief descriptions and after the fact conversations. There are a lot of small scenes that `salt and pepper' the story with sex, but they are all small. It takes a little getting used to.A lot of the book focuses on what people are wearing. Some people will find it tiring, but I find it somewhat understandable. It's a book about erotica and what people wear influences reader naughty desires.The book does not completely abandon a plot. The reader will go through an investigation and some dangers. The investigation is very predictable, but at least it is an effort at some story within the porn.On a personal note, I find the world building very interesting, if a little dry. This is a pretty complex universe that has a lot to be discovered.8. Do you have to suspend disbelief? Considering this is a high magic urban fantasy sexual exploration book, I didn't take it seriously from the start. I read it as mindless hedonistic escapism.9. Is the book worth the asking price? As erotica is something that's very personal, you'll have to decide if you're willing to pay $3 to explore your own naughtiness.In conclusion: A shallow tale that does not completely abandon a story plot. The book is written to tickle the naughty sides of adult readers. The world building is interesting because of its vast untapped complexities. The antagonists are one dimensional and superfluous. The story is really not about confronting said antagonists. It is about Ceridwen's sexual awakening, personal awakening, magical awakening and the changing relationship with Lily. The price is modicum at $3. The proofreading needs some work, but isn't a deal breaker. I was entertained by this book, but I read it understanding I was not going to read a literary masterpiece and that not all the sexual escapades would be to my liking.3.0 Stars

After reading a fascinating article about the role 5-HTP in balancing your mood and regulating stress levels I immediately ordered a supply.  Since your body cant get 5-HTP from food its really essential to supplement and these capsules are incredibly easy to take.  They are easy to swallow and have no aftertaste.These have been an amazing help during a very busy season.  Ive felt less stressed in general and have slept like a baby ever since I added these to my regimen.  Ive also noticed that because Im getting more sleep and feeling less stressed Im calmer overall and that helps keep things on an even keel in my family as well.I have been very pleased with the results and cannot recommend them enough!

This scale pretty and that's pretty much all it has going for it.  It's slim and easy to store as well but it is very small and is really too small to be used as either a kitchen or postal scale.  Also the buttons are quite difficult to use as they are actually below the glass and must be pressed rather hard to actually work.  The weight limit is nice, but it's not enough to make up for the other obvious failings.  I really cannot recommend this.

I love Philosophy's shower gels but this is not among my absolute favorites.  It's good and does smell vaguely of a Krispy Kreme glazed donut, but it isn't the best scent the brand has offered.  It's by no means bad, but just not as awesome as I've come to expect from Philosophy.  It foams up beautifully and leaves hair and skin smelling nice - as do all their shower gels - but there's nothing particularly spectacular about it.  It would be a good, rather neutral starter scent for someone new to the brand who does not want a strongly scented gel.

I am a huge fan of Dr. Perricone who recommends a daily dose of Acetyl L-Carnitine as part of a healthy weight management program.  L-Carnitine works as an anti-inflammatory and helps increase fat burning while also decreasing blood sugar levels.  Its really an amazing supplement that does an incredible number of things.I take my daily dose every morning with breakfast.  You dont really need to take it with food as it does not cause any stomach upset but I do just out of habit.  The capsules are incredibly easy to swallow and have absolutely no aftertaste.Since Ive been taking these Ive noticed that my blood sugar levels do not drop during the afternoon and I finish the day with much more energy than usual.  My scale is also reporting a drop of 2% drop in my body fat so far so Im very impressed with that as well.  I am so glad that I added these to my regimen and look forward to future results.  I definitely highly, highly recommend them.

After reading about the immune system boosting and stress reducing benefits of Ashwagandha in an article from the Chopra Center I had to try some and Im so pleased that I did.Ive noticed a definite decrease in my stress levels since I started taking this and I no longer feel snappish when Im under a deadline. It helps me relax and fall asleep quickly and effortlessly.I definitely highly recommend this to others who want an all natural, healthy supplement to reduce stress and maintain a healthy immune system.

Ive been trying to wean myself off of coffee for a while now since it always leaves me feeling rather jittery and stains my teeth so I was thrilled to come across this healthy alternative!Since Ive been taking these Ive noticed that I get the same boost I normally get from caffeine but it is a steady level and there are no drops during the day.  It has helped me to focus on tasks - especially studying.  The retention of knowledge after studying has increased as well.  These also do not affect my sleep as caffeine would.  I am efficient and focused during the day and sleep well at night, waking refreshed.I definitely highly recommend these - especially to fellow students.

I love my coffee and I want to be Earth friendly at the same time so these reusable filters are the perfect solution for my Chemex 6 cup coffeemaker.  They allow me to get a great tasting cup of coffee while saving money and saving paper filters from the waste stream.The best part is that there are no more broken paper filters.  These are incredibly sturdy so they keep all the grounds where they are supposed to be - in the filter and not in my cup - even fine grounds.I love that these provide a wonderful, pure tasting, smooth cup of coffee since there are no freaky bleaching agents or other chemicals used.There is a tiny bit of maintenance since these are reusable - boiling the filters before the first use and every month or so after that - but its super fast and they dry so quickly that its almost a non issue.I definitely highly, highly recommend these versatile and eco-friendly filters.  My coffee has been the best it has ever been since I started using them and Ill never go back to paper again!

I purchased these to cover a frankly ugly small concrete patio area and they are simply perfect!  I love the warm brown wood tone which makes the entire area look very sleek and modern.  They were super easy to install and I did it by myself in no time.What I like most about these is the drainage.  They are slightly elevated which means the water just goes through instead of puddling like it used to on the concrete so the area stays clean and dry, even after a heavy rain.Overall, between the ease of installation and their versatility I have been very, very pleased with these and highly recommend them.

With my increased amount of travel during the summer months I wanted to make sure I was protected if I did have battery issues with my car so I purchased this convenient device.I love that it not only provides peace of mind in case I ever have to jump start my car it also provides power to the various iPhones, iPads, and iPods that my family inevitably travels with.This is also so small and slim that it is easy to pack and carry around.  There is no need for a giant power pack or anything that requires an extension cord.This is a great little item to have while traveling and Im so glad I came across it!  I certainly recommend it!

My little one absolutely adores aliens so as soon as I saw this I knew it would be a hit and it has been!The aliens are completely adorable and their bright colors and animation make them irresistible.  My little one loves tracing all the letters, numbers, and shapes and spends ages engrossed in the games.  Landing and feeding aliens have quickly become favorites in my house!I definitely highly recommend this!

This is a lovely blend of fantasy and dark reality with a cast of interesting characters.  Alison, Taron, Jeff, and all the others, while not entirely likable, were well written.The story does take a bit of getting used to as it switches around quite a bit but once you get used it you settle down and begin to enjoy the (quite crazy) ride.  Its certainly not your usual story and Alison doesnt seem to move the action along any but is sort of an observer of it all which makes this very different from most books.This is also a witty social commentary from the very first chapter.  The perspective is just slightly off so you really get to view events in a way that you may not have before and that forces revelations that you most certainly would not have had before.Overall this is an intelligent, well written book with a pleasant dreamworld feel that is sure to entertain.

I know selenium is a necessary part of the diet but Im not a huge fan of Brazil nuts or the various seeds (sunflower, sesame, flax, etc.) that are its best sources so I need to take a supplement.  This was the perfect choice for me.  It contains exactly the amount I need in an easy to swallow pill.Since Ive been taking these supplements I havent had so much as a sniffle and I feel much healthier in general so it is definitely supporting my immune system.I highly recommend this excellent product!

I really loved this audiobook edition.  It was the perfect pairing of a wonderful story with a truly talented reader.Biancas experiences with Jean-Claude were fascinating and I simply could not wait to continue listening every time I was forced to put this down.I definitely highly recommend this for erotica fans and I am eagerly awaiting the authors next release!

I eat a healthy diet and exercise but I just couldn't get my body fat percentage down to where I really wanted it to be so I started taking these and after a few weeks I noticed a real difference. My jeans started fitting better, and I have lost a few inches around my midsection. I absolutely love this Garcinia Cambogia!  It was super easy to incorporate into my routine since I just take a pill while I'm preparing each meal of the day - breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  So easy to remember!Since I've been using this I've noticed a definite decrease in my appetite so I'm no longer snacking between meals or staring at the vending machine mid-afternoon. This is my honest and unbiased review.*

I have been taking these Alpha Lipoic Acid supplements for a while now after reading about its beneficial effects for skin and body in one of Dr. Perricones books and they have made such a difference!  I take mine with breakfast and dinner and its an effortless way to improve my skin.My skin looks fresher and firmer and Ive noticed a significant improvement in skin tone evenness.  The skin looks and feels softer, smoother, and is definitely much clearer.  My skin also no longer has that dull look that it can sometimes get during the winter months.Dr. Perricone recommends this as his number one supplement for healthy skin and I wholeheartedly agree!

I was unable to limp through Eat, Pray, Love and had zero desire to see the movie so I was unsure how enjoyable of a read this would be but turned out to be reasonably good.The main problem was that I just did not care for the characters.  Alma was supposed to be interesting but she just seemed rather bland and just like the other five zillion other female characters set in the 1800s.  There was nothing compelling about her story and she wasn't particularly likable as a person either.  I just felt no emotional connection with her at all.  I frankly spent the entire book not caring one way or the other what happened to her. And her relationship with her husband was just too predictable that it was laughable, if I'd been able to laugh at that point.The writing was good but some sections went on and on and on.  There were just large chunks of the book that simply would not end.  Then, inexplicably, the story made a sudden time jump.  Sometimes it was months, sometimes it was years.  It was incredibly frustrating.Overall this was a decent read if not particularly wonderful.  If you've enjoyed the author's previous works I'm sure you will enjoy this as well however this is perhaps not the best book to introduce you to the author's work if you haven't read her before.

I thoroughly enjoyed the author's first book The Expats so I knew this would be equally good and it was everything I'd hoped for and more.The story was immediately engaging and left me wondering until the ultimate reveal about the identity of the mysterious author.  The revelation was brilliant, absolutely brilliant and left me actually saying "Wow!" out loud. It was that good.It was interesting to follow the story from the various character perspectives and see how things developed for each of them.  While I never really liked Isabel as a person she was a brilliant character and very well written.The level of suspense was consistent and had me hardly blinking as I read.  I felt every bit of the mysterious author's anxiety as events unfolded and it made the story that much more intense.  The manuscript tidbits sprinkled throughout were delicious little bread crumbs to follow as the story progressed and I couldn't wait until the next one appeared so I could learn more of the story.Overall, this was brilliant and a must read for those who enjoy suspense.  Fans of Steve Berry will thoroughly enjoy this.  I highly, highly recommend it.

I wanted to dislike this from the start since Mary was such a miserable human being but I just couldn't which is a testament to the quality of the author's writing.  She made even such a disgusting person as Mary not quite sympathetic, but at least tolerable enough to finish the book.  I did have many times when I wished I could smack the woman though.  I realize this is set in the 1600s but she's just such a horrible person even for the wacko Puritans that I was truly shocked.  Her behavior was simply unacceptable in many instances and I actually found myself hoping that she'd get sick and die.  I, of course, didn't want the Native Americans to kill her because I didn't want them to be punished but I held out hope that she would be shunned by her Puritan community upon her return and starve or freeze to death.  No, really, she was that despicable of a human being.  She had simply no redeeming qualities whatsoever.  What is possibly even more disturbing is that this was a kinder, gentler representation of her and in real life she was actually, if possible, even worse.If you can manage to get past your disgust for Mary the story is actually quite informative and interesting.  The interactions between the natives and the invading Puritans were well illustrated and clearly had a strong level of historical accuracy.  I've never been a big fan of the Puritans and this book made my dislike for them even more intense.Overall this is a solid read and I certainly recommend it but be prepared for some intense emotions as you accompany Mary on her journey.

I am absolutely in love with these headphones!First, they are very lightweight, which makes them incredibly comfortable to wear even for long study periods or while watching movies.  The padding is super soft and I really, really appreciate the padding at the top of the band which makes them even more comfortable.  The ear cups are just the right size so your ears are covered to provide the best sound.  The sound quality is great for music, movies, and phone calls and its so nice to be able to go cord free!These were super easy to pair with both my iPad (iOS 8) and Mac (Yosemite).  They were recognized within seconds and I was listening to music within a minute of taking them from the box.  I love that the volume can be controlled directly from my keyboard when I'm using them with my Mac.Charging is ultra simple with the enclosed USB charger.  It takes just a couple hours for a full charge which gets you over six hours of listening/talking time.These are hands down the best bluetooth headphones Ive owned!

Ive just recently discovered the Obsession series and zipped right through the first book so I snapped up this second book right away and couldnt put it down either.I really liked how this switches back and forth between Elena and Alexanders viewpoints so you can really get inside their heads and explore the motivations for their actions and just how much each enjoys their role in the relationship.This is a well written, wonderfully dark, erotic adventure that Fifty Shades of Grey readers should thoroughly enjoy.  I highly recommend it and cant wait to see what transpires in the next installment!

I used to get horribly dry, itchy, and cracked hands in the winter  that would actually bleed and really hurt but nothing really solved the problem until a friend recommended this wonderful oil!A daily application of Tamanu Oil has kept my hands soft and smooth all winter.  Im so relieved to have finally found something that really works!  My hands and cuticles are soft and silky now and look incredibly healthy.  They look much younger too!I love that this oil is all natural and completely additive free which makes me feel even more confident about it.I definitely highly recommend this for anyone suffering from dry, itchy skin!

My Chihuahua has runny eyes due to seasonal allergies and has the accompanying tear stains. Using this is now a regular part of his bath time routine.I also really like that you dont need to use a lot at a time so the bottle is really quite economical.I definitely highly recommend this safe and effective tear stain remover!

I use my iPad all the time and prefer a larger keyboard for typing longer e-mails and documents so I was thrilled to discover this!I really like the black color which blends beautifully with my Space Gray iPad which has a black front.  The keys are nicely sized for typing and the layout is nearly identical to the Apple wireless keyboard I use with my Mac.This was incredibly easy to set up.  I just popped in two AAA batteries, turned it on, and hit the connect button.  My iPad recognized it immediately and I was typing away in a matter of about a minute.This is ultra lightweight and very easy to pack in a bag along with my iPad so I can use it wherever I need to.  The keys are very quiet so I feel comfortable using it even in the library without disturbing anyone.I definitely highly recommend this very well made, sturdy, and attractive keyboard.  Its really a must have if you do a lot of typing on your tablet.

This was an interesting read full of mermaids and other mystical creatures, elements of the Tarot, and plenty of strange magical events.The characters of Karl and Eve were quite likable and I enjoyed reading their story.  Their experiences were as one might imagine from a normal couple thrown into extraordinary circumstances.  The story is intricately woven and it was clear that the author put quite a bit of thought into it.The book is very nice look at just what is truly important in life.  I look forward to reading future books in this promising series.

I love my iPad and use it all the time but typing long e-mails and documents can be a problem so I was thrilled to discover this keyboard!I love that this was super easy to set up.  It connected to my iPad in a matter of seconds and I was typing right away.This is just the same size as my Apple keyboard that I use with my Mac and has the same silver and white look that coordinates perfectly with my iPad.  I really like the lightweight yet sturdy construction that makes it easy to carry and very pleasant to type on.  They keys are full sized and are super silent so I can use it in the library and not have to worry about bothering patrons.I definitely highly recommend this excellent quality keyboard.  Its the next best thing to Apples keyboard!

My sisters dog had a horrible barking problem and it was driving me crazy when I visited her so I purchased this for her Lab.  We put it on him right away and after just a few hours he got the point that excessive barking (at leaves, birds, the television, etc.) was unnecessary.  He only rarely has to wear it now.  The collar perfectly fit the 90 or so pound Lab so its definitely sized well for medium sized dogs.

I was recently introduced to this series through the first book and enjoyed it so much that I simply had to read the second book right away.This concludes the events of the first book in such a way that its thoroughly satisfying for readers.I really enjoyed Savannah and Coopers intense relationship and the author did a great job of fully exploring all the complicated elements of it, from Savannahs family to Coopers career.  It all felt very real and emotional, especially since it was told from both Savannah and Coopers viewpoints so you could really see how each felt.This is a wonderful, fast paced, suspenseful story full of romance and passion and I definitely recommend it!  I also look forward to future releases from the author!

Continuing the tradition of Percy Jackson is this entertaining read about Jack Templar.  This isnt a happy, peaceful story, but rather a darker, grittier one which makes for quite engrossing reading.  Jacks life is not easy and his story has elements of Grimm in it in that he is descended from a long line of monster hunters.I was drawn into the story from the very first page.  Its an entertaining, fast paced read full of adventure and friendship with an excellent message for younger readers.I certainly recommend this and look forward to the next volume in what I hope is a long series.

I absolutely love this perfect keyboard for my iPad Mini!  Its super slim and fits snuggly closed against my iPad to protect against potential scratches.The little clips that hold the iPad to the keyboard are small but very strong so they hold the iPad securely whether Im typing or watching a video.  It really makes my iPad look and function like a mini laptop!I use this all the time for typing everything from documents to e-mails and it works perfectly.  There is no delay when typing and the keys are nicely sized.This was super easy to set up.  It connected quickly and I was typing away in a matter of moments.This sleek, functional, multitasking keyboard is a must have for the iPad Mini.

Ive noticed some cellulite on my legs lately and while it wasnt horrible I felt like I needed to do something right away so it wouldnt get any worse so I ordered this cream and Im so glad I did!I love the subtle scent and the nice, silky texture of the cream.  It goes on beautifully and absorbs quickly leaving my skin very soft.After using this every morning and evening for a couple weeks my thighs and even my butt have been looking firmer and smoother.  Every day the skin looks better and better.  I almost cant wait for bathing suit season to roll around now!I definitely recommend this excellent quality cream!

These are such cheap twist ties.  I purchased them to tie up bags of cookies during the holidays and I was disappointed in their quality.  They are very thin and cheaply made with very thin wires inside which make them incredibly difficult to twist.If you're desperate and really need silver twist ties then these are a good enough option, but be prepared to spend about twice as long trying to tie up each bag because of their poor quality.

I can never have too many umbrellas so when I saw this beautiful cloud design I simply had to have it!This is the perfect design for nasty, rainy weather.  Not only is it pretty (I got the model with the clouds on the outside and black on the inside) it is well made and very sturdy.  Its easy to open and close and stores nicely back in its pretty cloud patterned slipcover.  It also is quite slim and fits well in my tote bag.Every time I see my new umbrella it makes me smile.  I definitely recommend this well made and cheery umbrella.

This is such a gorgeous piece!  The yellow is such a pretty, rich color and looks wonderful with so many outfits.The fabric is very luxurious feeling and the entire piece is beautifully made and sturdy but not overly stiff.  Its incredibly comfortable to wear, even for an entire night out.Its a great addition to my wardrobe!

I love 22Learns apps and own many of them so when I discovered this newest app I knew it would be amazing and it was!The games are great for learning not only language skills but fine motor skills as well since they require kids to tap and drag pictures.  Theyre also fun with bright and engaging graphics and upbeat and pleasant music.  Our favorite game so far is the sorting game with the matching and find it games a close second.Games can be played alone or with an adult.  I play along often since the app offers not only English but Spanish and French too so we can learn another language together!I also love that so many categories are covered from foods to shapes to colors to weather.  Its such a wonderful value!I definitely highly recommend this excellent addition to the 22Learn collection!

This is such a cute umbrella!  The skull pattern is quite subtle and just enough to be interesting but not overpowering so I can use this for work and pleasure.  I also really like the bronze interior.  Its such a nice, classy looking touch and makes using the umbrella feel quite luxurious.The handle is cute and shaped very nicely so it is easy to hold and the one touch opening and closing feature is a huge benefit, especially when getting in and out of the car.  This is also a nice size to keep myself and my bag or purse dry.I definitely recommend this well made and unique umbrella!

When I saw this color changing lightbulb I knew I had to have it and Im so glad I purchased it!What I love the most is that it is remote controlled!  I can sit on the sofa and change the color of the light bulb across the room!  I can go with a pretty yellow or green during the day and switch to a nice purple or blue at night.  Ive tried each and every color and as soon as I try each new color Im sure its my favorite - until I try the next one!The remote also controls the brightness and frequency so I can have it bright and yellow and then use the remote to change it to a dim purple when I want to watch a movie.  The LED bulb is beautifully bright on maximum brightness and also lowers to a nice, warm glow on lower settings.  I can also have it flash or strobe which will be fun during parties.This is so fun and easy to use that I look forward to purchasing more for other rooms in my home!

It is always so difficult to pack shoes for travel, especially sneakers, so Im so glad I found this awesome bag!First, I love the color!  I ordered the green and its such a bright, happy color.Shoes and sneakers fit beautifully in this sturdy bag.  I can fit my bulky New Balance sneakers or my slimmer work wear high heels nicely in the bag.  I love that I no longer have to worry about dirt or sand from my shoes getting on my clothes in my suitcase.I also love the clear top so I can keep my shoes in the bag and just quickly glance in to see which one I need to grab without having to unzip and look in.I definitely highly recommend this to anyone who travels often.  I really dont know how I traveled without it!

After having a Misfit Shine and then losing it due to the poor wrist band construction I decided to give their Flash model a try in the interim until I can order an Apple Watch.  It's plastic so it does feel and look inexpensive but not outright cheap.  The plastic band is remarkably comfortable and fits snuggly.  There are also no sharp edges that stick out and catch on sweaters or coats anything.Setup was easy, you just pop the little circle in the band FROM BELOW.  I think a lot of people are having it pop out or having the band break because they force it in from the top.  It fits quite snuggly in the band and it's almost impossible to lose it since your wrist keeps it in place from below and the band does not stretch like the Shine's band does.Syncing with my iPhone running iOS 8 was super easy and took maybe two minutes the first time.  After that it takes maybe 30 seconds to sync when I want to see my updated stats throughout the day.  While this does not sync sleep data with HealthKit it does sync steps which is nice.  I would like to have it sync the sleep data, but I'm assuming that will come with the next app update.Step and sleep tracking is effortless.  There is no tagging, no nothing.  You just put it on and go.  It tracks sleep and steps automatically and is remarkably accurate.  If you do read or watch television in bed before you go to sleep it may think that you've already gone to sleep and add that to your sleep time though, which has happened once or twice to me but it's not a huge deal for me.I like that this is water resistant and can be worn in the shower, while washing dishes, etc.The only issue I have with this is the battery life.  It's supposed to last six months before changing the battery.  I've had mine for just under a month and have had to change the battery three times already which is incredibly annoying especially since I've lost entire days of information because I didn't know that the battery had died.  It may be that my unit just has a defect.Overall, this is a good quality device.  Due to the lower cost I'm not particularly worried about losing it and the water resistant feature is very nice.  If you're looking for an interim device to get you through until the Apple Watch is released this is it.

Id noticed lately that my knife set was becoming quite dull and that I needed to sharpen them so I purchased this great sharpener.Its quite small so it fits easily in a drawer when not in use.It is super easy to use and I sharpened my entire set of knives in a matter of a few minutes.  The non-slip feet keep everything sturdy and safe and the handle was very easy to hold.My knives now slice everything from carrots to apples to meat perfectly!  I really cannot recommend this enough!

I love this little cellphone holder!  It fits my iPhone perfectly and keeps it safe and secure while Im driving.  Its great that I dont have to remove the case when Im using the holder and I can charge as well without getting the cable tangled in the holder.This fits perfectly on my horizontal air vents and feels nice and snug.  I leave it on all the time so its ready for me to pop my phone in as soon as I get in the car.  When I dont have my phone in it its so slim and sleek that it just blends right into the vent and I barely even notice it.I just love this handy little device and cant imagine driving without it now!

I have very sensitive skin and have never been able to find an effective yet gentle makeup remover until I discovered this.This is gentle yet very effective.  It removes all of my makeup (everything from foundation to eyeshadow and mascara) without leaving behind a greasy residue and leaves my skin feeling soft and clean.Ive also noticed that since Ive been using it as a makeup remover my skin has seemed smoother and less irritated.  I also have far fewer breakouts.This also smells lovely.  Its always so calming to breathe in its delicate scent while Im using it.I definitely recommend this for all skin types, and especially those with sensitive skin.

My television is an older model with only one HDMI port so I need a switch to control all the devices hooked up to it.  This is the perfect solution.This is very slim and small and was tucked behind my television so there are no cords or anything visible.Connection was ultra easy.  It was just a matter of plugging the HDMI cables into the switcher and the switcher into the television.  It took all of two minutes.Everything works seamlessly.  Switching is automatic and effortless.  I have my Apple TV hooked up to the second port so when I want to watch it I just turn it on and the device knows immediately that it has been turned on and switches over to it automatically.  When Im done watching I turn off the Apple TV and it switches back to the regular input.Video and audio quality are excellent and you would never know that the line doesnt run directly into the television.I definitely highly recommend this handy little switcher.

I just love this case!  It works perfectly as stand on my desk while at work so I have easy access to my iPhone all day, and when its time for lunch or a coffee run I can just grab it and go knowing that my credit cards and money are all right there as well.The case is very slim and sleek and fits easily in a pocket.  The leather is very soft and looks and feels luxurious.I love this new little case and definitely recommend it!

This is hands down the most terrifying psychological thriller that Ive read since Flowers in the Attic!  The author did a brilliant job of drawing you into Beths world and really making you feel her emotions both during her imprisonment and afterwards.It was a bit disorienting at first to have the point of view switch between Beth and Dominic and then Beth and her mother, but once I got used to it it really added a nice dimension to the story and provided room for Beths experiences to be fully explored from all angles.The author kept the tension high throughout and I found myself flipping the pages as fast as I could read them, wanting to find out what happened next and yet cringing at what I discovered.I definitely highly recommend this beautifully written and complex thriller!

I purchased this as a gift for my boyfriend and we both love it!  He says it is very comfortable and fits nicely.  I think it looks great on him (very Magic Mike)!  I'm definitely ordering this in other colors as well!

I bought this as a gift for my father and it is absolutely gorgeous!The color is a rich, deep brown and the brushed gold accents coordinately perfectly.  The leather is soft and supple and luxurious.The interior has plenty of space for everything, including a laptop and its various cords and accessories.  There are tons of pockets to keep your phone, tablet, books, glasses, etc.  It is really a complete solution for carrying everything you need.The padded handle makes carrying incredibly easy and the removable shoulder strap is a great addition for travel.My father has had this for a while now and despite daily use it still looks just as good as the day he received it.

Ive used Poo-Pourri sprays several times since they were recommended to me and when I saw that they now have wipes I had to give them a try.I really like the packaging.  Its very cute and the box is small enough to store easily.  The individually packaged wipes are great to throw in a purse or suitcase and are very inconspicuous.  The packets also ensure that each wipe remains moist and ready to use as opposed to larger multi-wipe packages that tend to dry out quickly.The smell is a light, citrus scent which is very pleasant and not at all overpowering.I definitely recommend these fun and functional wipes!

I was recently introduced to Argan Oil and I love it!  It can be expensive though so I was excited to come across this giant four ounce bottle for half the price of other options.With colder weather approaching my hair gets quite dry so I love that I can smooth a drop or two of Argan Oil on my hair and any flyaway hairs are tamed instantly.Ive also been using it on my hands and they look smoother and healthier already.  And my cuticles are so much easier to deal with since Ive started using this oil!I will definitely continue to use this daily and I highly recommend it!

I absolutely love this bikini!  It's adorable and it fits beautifully!The color is absolutely gorgeous and I love the lingerie type lace accents.  The ruching on the back of the bottoms is a lovely detail.Both the top and bottom fit perfectly.  The top is nicely padded so it keeps its shape and doesn't allow any show through.This is my new favorite bikini and I can't wait to order it in other colors!

My wife is completely pleased, in every regard, with this wrist watch. (Yes, I know that that's redundant - but please read on.)I find it sometimes difficult to buy her presents. She is very critical, in terms of quality and style, of her possessions and she has a much better sense of style than I do.However, every day I check Amazon's "Deals of the Day" and I saw this wrist watch as well as others by this manufacturer listed at a very good price. Though I did not know if she would like it, wanting to buy her a gift, I took a chance.I initially ordered the Johan Eric Women's JE2200-09-001.9 Herlev Rose Gold Case and Peach Leather Watch with Diamond Accents which is very pretty but, immediately after placing the order, I took a look again and saw this one (Johan Eric Women's JE2200-09-001 Herlev Rose Gold Case and White Leather Watch with Diamond Accents) which I felt was even more elegant.So I canceled the first order and placed the order for this white one.I'm glad I did.When I gave it to my wife, she was immediately struck by its exceptional design. She has now been wearing it for several days and she notes that it keeps excellent time, the white color goes with everything, and it is very comfortable on her wrist. She also says that, in her opinion, the rose gold case is much nicer looking than 'plain' yellow gold or silver.The Johan Eric company makes a number of variants on this watch. Peoples' tastes vary and the choice of a particular style is, of course, a personal decision.But when I showed my wife all of the variants, she said that I had picked the 'right' one. It's not often that she is as pleased with a gift that I buy for her as she is with this one.I cannot comment at this time as to the longevity of the watch but it does seem to be made with a great deal of integrity plus it carries a two-year warranty. The leather watch band is first-rate and, as I stated, its time-keeping is excellent.Even at Amazon's regular price, in my opinion, it represents superb value for money.Therefore I can give this wrist watch an enthusiastic recommendation.Thank you for reading this. I hope it has been of some help to you.Lawrence H. Bulk

In my opinion, there were only two conductors who never made a single bad record.One was Arthur Fiedler. But, due to the extremely large number of records he made, I doubt that we will ever see a "Complete Arthur Fiedler" box set. (Who could afford it?)The other conductor in this exalted group was Fritz Reiner.The Reiner box set under discussion here is an absolute treasure. I shall not discuss the music, performance, and sound quality themselves about which there have been many, many reviews and articles written over the years; these are easy enough to find if you are interested. And anyone reading this review (or who is interested in this set) almost certainly already knows the quality of the music, the quality of the performances, and the quality of the sound recording. (If you are new to Fritz Reiner and are going to hear his performances for the first time, well, I envy you: you are in store for a real treat! You'll hardly believe your own ears!)Suffice it to say that all of the above characteristics are nothing short of superb, even transcendental. There may be some recorded performances of the included works which equal Reiner's but, at least in my experience, none - NONE - which surpasses them.You will need the included book (well-printed and very informative) to see what is on the individual discs; the back of the sleeves (cardboard reproductions of the original LPs complete with original notes in minuscule-sized - yet easily readable - print) and even the face of the CD itself may not be complete (the labels on the fronts of the CDs show only Side 1 of the LPs from which the CDs derive).The box which contains the CDs itself is made of heavyweight cardboard, beautifully printed in color, and is very space-efficient. It will look nice anywhere you choose to put it.At a person's request, I have placed the list of the recordings in Amazon's Classical Music Forums section within the thread entitled "New Fritz Reiner Box."There will be some who will quibble about "faults" in the notes, "faults" in the remasterings, or "faults" in this or that. In my opinion, any "faults" in this set are trivial and really unimportant. (And when you hear the magnificence of the performance of the 'Eroica" you won't give a d--- whether it is mono or stereo!)Several of the same performances/recordings of works are repeated on two discs because they originally appeared on two separate LPs (the 1812 Overture, for example) but to my mind this is of no consequence. Also Reiner/Chicago recorded several works on two different occasions; both are included in this set. [See the fourth Comment appended to this review for more details.]The CD sides are short; one is even less than 30 minutes (as was the original LP). Again, this is of no consequence, at least to me.My only "quibble" is that I wish this set had been released in hybrid SACD/CD format (or, even better, as 24-bit 192kHz downloads). But even that is a minor point to me as I already own the 17 Reiner discs issued as SACDs (and, if you have SACD playback capability, I recommend that you buy them too even though the sound quality on the discs in this set are superior to any earlier 'Redbook' CDs of the same recordings which I myself have heard previously).I could also mention that it might have been nice had Sony included the "Carmen" which Reiner conducted in 1951 with the RCA Victor Orchestra (Ris Stevens, Jan Peerce, Licia Albanese, Robert Merrill, a "dream" cast if there ever was one!). I believe that it was his only complete opera recording.All that being said, I'll recommend that you just don't worry about any minor "quibbles."I believe that you should just sit back and enjoy the music.I STRONGLY recommend that anyone interested in classical music BUY THIS SET. I believe that it will indeed become the one of the most important sets in your collection.A Personal Note: my parents gave an "RCA Victor New Orthophonic High Fidelity Record Player" (a blonde mahogany consolette on four legs) to me in the summer of 1956. It was my first record player which could play 33 1/3 and 45, as well as 78 RPM records. I can't tell you how happy I was. I thought it was the be-all and end-all of hi-fi!Though I had little money (being only 13 years old), I started buying records when I could. And I soon discovered that I had to "sneak" them in, something at which I became quite proficient (how about you?).On Sunday, February 17, 1957, my parents had some friends over and they all went out for the afternoon, leaving me home alone.Naturally, as soon as they left, I got onto my bicycle and rode across town to Dee's Appliances of Audubon, NJ to look at their records. (They sold records at 20% off list, in other words, $3.19 for a $3.98 record, a price irresistible to me.)An album cover caught my eye. It was RCA Victor LM-1999 Red Seal (SLP-13) and it was, of course, Fritz Reiner's recording of the 1812 Overture and other works. At that time I knew very little about classical music (I had never heard the 1812 Overture) but, because of that cover, I bought it. (Over the years I bought many albums because of the cover, almost always with similar luck! This cover is reproduced on two of the CDs in this set though it loses something of its impact in the small size.)With no one else being home, I was able to easily bring it into the house and play it.I loved it.I still have it.(Plus, over the years, I have acquired several stereo issues of it, now including the one in this set. That 1812 Overture performance, without cannon-fire and slightly abridged, is still the best performance of the work I have ever heard.)That's how I was introduced to Fritz Reiner. (Actually I had heard Fritz Reiner conduct before - I had the complete "The World's Greatest Music" on 78s and he conducted several of the works included - but, as the performers were not listed anywhere, I did not know this at the time.) So this one was my first "official" Fritz Reiner record - but by no means the last!There are other important record sets out there; the Arturo Toscanini: The Complete RCA Collection is one of them and there are many, many others. You wouldn't want to have just one classical set in your collection. Of course, you will also have a great many individual discs in a good collection but these sets are a convenient way to have music with some common thread (conductor, performer, composer, etc.) available to you in one place and at a relatively low price (and who cares if we have a few duplicates? Not me!).This Fritz Reiner-The Complete RCA Recordings one is certainly the new cornerstone of my own collection and, if you have read this far, I am quite certain it will become yours too. So I'll repeat: BUY THIS SET!Thank you for reading this. I hope it has been informative to you.

I bought a Garmin nvi 4.3-Inch Portable GPS Navigator-250W on December 4, 2007. Last year, 2012, I noticed that the internal battery would not charge completely. Recently the unit, though it worked when plugged in, would not work at all on the internal battery power (and, as I like to use this in 'walking' mode, battery power is necessary).Though I own three other Garmin units (all newer), I like this one and I called Garmin to inquire about them replacing the battery.I was told that Garmin no longer supports this model and will not work on it.Frankly, I think that this is disgraceful; my unit is less than 6 years old. This, in my opinion, bodes ill for my having confidence in Garmin. I do not know if the other major manufacturers, TomTom and Magellan, support their units longer. But I am unhappy with Garmin. (I certainly will NEVER buy one of their really expensive units if they do not support their own products for a reasonable length of time - and I feel that less than six years is NOT reasonable!)Fortunately, Amazon offers this Battery Replacement Kit for Garmin Nuvi 250W with Installation Video, Tools, and Extended Life Battery.. There are other replacement batteries for the 250W offered on Amazon but this one comes complete with all necessary tools and accessories (and believe me you'll need them, especially the small Torx screwdriver!). It also comes with an instruction CD; the video included on it is also available to view on YouTube if you want to see the steps before ordering.I do have to say that any resemblance of the internal parts of the unit shown in the instructional video and what I saw in my own unit is strictly coincidental.But, using a bit of common sense, it was fairly easy to replace the battery. Based on what I had seen on the video, most of what was in my unit was self-explanatory.But I did have some problems. Innovate88, the company which supplies this battery, includes a bit of double-sided tape to hold the new battery in place. Unfortunately, even with much 'language,' I was unable to pry off the backing on one side of the piece so I went upstairs and found some Velcro tape (two sections which hook together) I had bought and I used that in place of the supplied double-sided tape. It was easy to remove the plastic backing from that and both sides, when pressed together (one piece glued to the case and the other to the battery), are joined 'permanently.' (Of course, you may have more luck than I did in removing the backing from both sides of the piece of tape.)And naturally, at the very end of reassembling the unit, I dropped one of the tiny screws which hold the case together. More 'language' ensued, a flashlight was employed, and after about ten minutes or so, I found the screw. (This was my own fault of course, not Innovate88's.)Because of all that frustration (the double-sided tape and the dropped screw), it took me much longer to replace the battery than it should have. I can't even tell you how much time it actually took nor can I tell you how much time it would take someone less of a 'klutz' than I am to do it.But really it shouldn't take long. If your unit looks similar to the one in the video, I would say ten minutes tops. If not, then maybe fifteen minutes. (Just don't drop any screws!)Now, of course, the big question: Did it work?Well, if it hadn't, I wouldn't have given this replacement battery five stars. Since I did, you can pretty much figure out that it did indeed work, and it works perfectly.When I turned on the nvi, the indicator showed that the battery was fully charged. Even though the unit had no power connected at all while I was changing the battery, all of my Favorites were retained in memory. The only things lost were the time and time-zone settings. I manually set the time-zone to Eastern Time and the clock itself was set as soon as the Garmin located the satellites.I am extremely pleased with my purchase.
