Wow,With so many power sources to use with this lantern....you literally have NO excuse to ever be without light.This solar lantern has 5 power sources that can be used: Solar Powered, Crank Dynamo, Car Adapter,AC Adapter or 3 AA BatteriesWhere we live...in tornado alley... power outages happen.... and with 2 small children candles aren't my preferred first choice.This lantern is perfect not only to use in the storm shelter but to use in the house in those times we lose power.With 2 lighting modes...you can cater your light preference depending on your need. You have the option of low mode where 18 of the LED's are illuminated or full power which powers all 36 LED's.So far I've had no issues with it. The lighting is good and it seems to pretty durable. It's a plastic housing so we'll see how well it lasts over the long term usage.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my ow

My boys LOVE this!This is one of the best xylophone toys that we have ever owned.Not only is it colorful which is key when dealing with toddlers but it's also small enough to be portable. It's just under 8 inches long... and believe me the fact that it's portable has saved us from having to leave this at home when headed out because it's too big of a toy.Granted...my twins fight over it...my only regret so far is having just one.... although my hubby might argue that the "noise" aspect isn't enjoyable but he doesn't have much an ear for music anyway.Anywho, the sound is great...each key is color coded according to it's note as well as labeled so even though it's play...it's also learning.We love music in our house and this was a great addition!I definitely recommend this toy... it's high quality item that is built to last.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

0:55 MinsI have twin boys who LOVE playing on my kindle with the apps that I've downloaded for them but they aren't too keen on sharingThis tablet is a great price point... I would call this a great starter tablet. Not too pricey and breaking the bank but not so cheap that the quality and functionality suffer.For my kids this is perfect. I comes preinstalled with a children's world app which allows you to really safeguard what your child has access to when using the tablet.Personally, I wasn't too fond of using it and neither were my children but that's just a personal preference.I love that it's an android based tablet as that is what we are all comfortable in using. Installing apps was easy peasy. I downloaded over 15 apps from amazon for my children to use and still have over half of the internal memory still free.It's awesome that it has an sd card slot so you can expand the memory even further.So far, I haven't had any complaints. I will say this though...the cover on the tablet is simply a silicone style slip on cover so it's not going to provide drop protection or anything of that sort.For a starter tablet it's great and for children it's not too pricey if accidents happen and need to be replacedI received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

I have to say... I'm IMPRESSED..nore than I ever expected to be especially when it comes to kitchen towels.I had no idea how awesome flour sack towels are.They can handle ANY job in the kitchen, drying is what they will be utilized for the most in my household.The only dishwasher we have are my two hands...haha and when the dishes get washed sometimes the drying rack gets over flowing so these are perfect for the overflow.They absorb so well and don't leave any streaks or lint of any kind at all.Very pleased with the quality and especially the functionality of there. These towels aren't just towels.... I'm amazed at all the usesI received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

Such a cute bundle!I've been a fan of the Elf on the Shelf for a long while....watched my nephews enjoy this yearly and now get to share that experience with my own family!The dress for the Elf comes as a separate attachment so you really can customize it if you decide you would prefer to stick with the male Elf.This would be the perfect gift for anyone with a small child !Such a great way to get into the holiday spiritI received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

Wow!This neck wallet has a spot for EVERYTHING!I love that it's RFID protected so you can feel safe while carrying your credit/debit cards without worrying about someone trying to scan and steal your information while you are traveling about.I've never traveled out of the country and I don't carry a purse so if what I'm carrying doesn't fit in my pocket...well, in the past I'd have just left it at home but now I don't have to since this organizer is small enough and comfortable enough to be used daily. It's not limited to those that only travel abroad. I feel better knowing that my cash and cards are secured in this as opposed to just being in my pocket!Not only that but as a mom of twins... I need both my hands free and this helps keep both hands free while we are out and about!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

Talk about a compact umbrella.This measures around 11 inches long when closed and not in useIt's small enough it would fit in some purses!The center pole is made out of aluminum with stainless steel ribs and fiberglass tips. All in all it seems to be a well made umbrella. I haven't used in a windy environment to test how it upholds in that setting.I have tested it in the rain and it kept me dry so it passed on that note!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

I have mixed feelings about this mug.The mug itself...where you keep your drink is AWESOME!It keeps hot drinks hot and cold drinks cold. And regardless of which one you're drinking... the mug itself stays comfortable to hold.It doesn't sweat so you can literally set this cup down anywhere!I HATE the handle on this mug...it is not comfy to hold...it's way to narrow at least it feels that way to me.It works EXACTLY as expected! I just wish the handle was different.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

WOW, this smells AMAZING!A lil bit placed in my diffuser and boy oh boy is my house smelling good.I think I may be adding this into my rotation of oils to use on my wool dryer balls when I dry clothes! I would love to smell this on towels!As with any essential oil, a little goes a long way!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

0:39 MinsThis is a nice tactical defense pen.Not only is it a workin pen to write with but it can be used as a defense weapon if the need were to arise.The material it's made out of is aviation aluminum so you know that it's tough and won't bend or break easily.When the cap is closed...there is a tip exposed that can either be used as an engraving pen or can be used as a line of defense to stab with. It can also be used as a glass breaker as well.The pen itself is refillable if the writing ink runs out so that's nice.It's a well made pen with other attributes in place so it'd be a great gift for a prepper or anyone that loves self defense items.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This is just AWESOME~This towel was PERFECT for our trip to the state fair this past weekend!It was the perfect size ..not to big and bulky that it got heavy wearing it around my neck.Once you get it wet and snap the towel to get the excess water out and wrap it around your neck... it feels wet..it feels cool...but it doesn't leave you wet. I have no idea how that aspect works but I LOVE that aspect!No more wet stains down the back of the shirt!Don't freak out though when it dries... it gets stiff...and I mean stiff...if it's not folded or rolled up when it dries it literally looks like that old staying "my shirt is so dirty it stands up on it's own in the corner" and to use it again, you simply wet the towel again... be sure it is wet before you bend it or anything.... if you bend it when it's dry...it will breakI highly recommend this for anyone that is out in the heat or just needs to stay cool!I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

Information overload....that's this book in a nutshell.Don't get me wrong, I don't mind learn I mg of world's the that author's create....but this was NOT written in a way that flows.The entire book feels forced and broken. It doesn't flow at allThe storyline had great potential...it just falls flatCharacter development really wasn't there at all. When this book ended....I felt no closer to any of the characters than I did at the beginningI thunk the author is still trying to find her style. This would be one of t h e few books that if made into a movie....I think I would like the movie betterThankfully I read this with my kindle unlimited subscription....if the 2ndbook were free....I'd read it just to see if any loose ends got tied up but I wouldn't waste my money paying for either book

0:39 MinsYEAH BUDDY!I can't tell you how much I love this chopper!To be honest, I had my doubts about it. A manual chopper operated by a pull cord is gonna really chop up my onions and other veggies??? Yes, yes it does...and much better than I ever imagined.I've got an electric chopper that is big and bulky that I hardly ever use it because it's just cumbersome to drag out just to chop some veggies. I prefer knife work than dragging that one out.This chopper is the perfect size for daily use!Cup wise it has a 25oz capacity.I think what makes the difference in this chopper compared to others is the 2 plastic arms that keep whatever it is you're chopping lifted up off the bottom of the bowl and pushed down from the top... it helps ensure that everything ...every piece gets in front of those blades.They aren't kidding when they say 5 pulls and you have chopped veggies for a pico... I chopped up some onions and broccoli and I am so impressed with the size that came out!It's easy to use... cleanup is a breeze... the only thing I wish was different was that there was a way to secure the lid when it was in use...when you were chopping. The lid doesn't lock to the bowl in any way... the only way it stays on in use is if you hold it with your free hand... no biggie but it just seems that a locking lid would have been a good safety feature to haveI received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions--positive or otherwise--and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own

This has a crisp clean peppermint smell which I love.My husbands shoes can knock you on your back! He is in his shoes from 5 am till close 11 pm every day. So believe me when I say he can get some odor going up in those shoes! Especially when you factor in he's out walking in the pasture with the cows and the dogs and chickens etc etcHe has 2 pairs that he wears regularly and I have sprayed this in both pairs. To be honest, it hasn't eliminated the odor completely BUT considering the shoes have had that odor for quite some time.... I wouldn't expect if too. It has though made it much better. I think it helps alot from allowing new odors to develop but doesn't eliminate long standing smells from the past.Best thing I like about this is it works great helping to keep my sheets that won't fit in my cedar chest smelling nice and fresh! With other sprayers we have used...you're not to overfill them...well, I saw nothing on this container to indicate where the maximum fill line is.It's nice that this comes with a pressure relief valve. It always makes me anxious to open up a box and the first thing I notice is the rampant smell of chemical laden fumes drifting towards my face.I don't know what causes that smell to permeate the air and what is in the compressor to smell that way.It is such a strong smell..it's so off putting. This thing is gonna have to sit outside overnight just to air out.While it's airing out I'm looking over the information on the box and on the included instruction sheet and I'm even more leary now. Rampant misspelled words on the box and on the instructions.I don't know about you but errors like that...make me wonder about errors internally on the device that I can't see.Here's some of the spelling errors just on the box alone:dirctlylaboursdisconnectlthat coupled with the questionable information on the box in reference to trouble shooting....sometimes it was hard to determine what the meaning was the instruction was for.The nylon bag for storage is cheaply made..the stitching holding the handle on is already starting to thread and become loose.Overall it just looks and feels like an overpriced air compressor that I could get not only cheaper locally but a better quality.Taking all the above into consideration before I even turned it on... let me say my expectations were low but apparently even those were too high.This is complete and utter crap. After sitting outside overnight...this thing still wreaks of fumes...there is NO way that I would ever store this in my vehicle in case of an emergency... and especially after having my hubby give it a whirl to see how it performed....he said it's worse compressor he has ever used. In this legal thriller, a witness is murdered, and Jake becomes the prime suspect!  He's also suspected of killing his client and friend, Blinky Baroso. His nephew Kip, 11 years old, becomes a new and future character in this series.  He's a wise-cracking delinquent, and travels with Jake to an abandoned silver mine beneath the Aspen ski slopes.  There is much humor along the way generated by Kip, along with Doc Charlie Riggs, a retired coroner, and Granny, who raised Jake and who has great common sense.  This novel is very moving, a powerful thriller I could not put down.  The drama overtakes the reader to pursue the outcome!  Wow, a great read!  Author Paul Levine knows how to satisfy his readers!  Highly recommend.

I finished reading this book the day after the 11-13-15 attack by ISIS on several Paris locations.  The story line in this novel is how these attacks are planned and initiated.  It's a gripping story about terrorism out to destroy England. The scourge of Islamic fundamentalism and madness is starting to consume England.  Faisal Aslam, the Master, is there in England to guide and counsel the recruits in the bombings.  His goal is to establish the Islamic State of England.  This novel is definitely an eye-opener.  Author Phillip Strang has seen the troubled world during his telecommunications careers which took him to many countries in the middle-east.  This novel has several sub-plots disclosing Islamic terrorist organizations and how they plan their terrorist attacks, murder, investigations, and dirty politics.  It reads like the true events which has shocked the current assault on Paris.  The novel is very well written, and the story is one we all must read.  Highly recommend.

In this very exciting novel, TJ Peacock, Private Investigator, and Lisa Rayburn, Psychologist, are hired by an older  woman whose niece has disappeared mysteriously.  Though she's found alive, she may have been harmed.  There is a serial killer at large which a blogger speaks of the progress the killer is making.  He begins to get some threatening e-mails which requires he join others, also at risk, at the residence of Lisa Rayburn and her partner.  TJ feels the niece who was missing may be the connecting link to this serial killer.  She's hoping she can find enough information before the killer strikes again. There are many puzzling mysteries here, the characters are numerous, so keep reading so you can identify how/where they fit into the story line(s).  Marla Madison writes really good, twisty suspense thrillers.  The ending will surprise you!

This is another fabulous children's rhyming story by Ayala Saar.  It's about 4-year old Tommy who is big, bold, strong, and brave.  He's big enough to dress himself, walk to Kindergarten, and thinks he's the bravest boy in the land!  But ... when he goes to bed, he often has bad scary dreams.  He doesn't scream or cry, 'cause he's a strong, big boy!  But, climbing in with Mom and Dad just won't do!  Funny Pally brings to Tommy sweet dreams.  This is a fun book to read to children which may help other children who may similar scary dreams.  Highly recommend.

In this wonderful sequel to "Dinosaurs and Cherry Stems," Cindy Layton and Jay De Matteo continue their serious bonding relationship.  In fact, they take the plunge and get married.  They've both been married twice before, going through two divorces each.  Often their reactions come from the 'graveyard' as Cindy calls bad memories.  Unfortunately, she gets a little out of line, in extreme, with her new husband.  They are both in their 50's and have a true love for each other.  But sometimes their actions flare, as those bad memories rise from the graveyard.  Cindy and Jay are two dinosaurs who are really mid-life adolescents.  Manners ... it comes down to manners, to thoroughly enjoy their new lives together.  Another great story by Susan Jean Ricci, written with much humor, but also some great hints as to how to compromise, when to speak, and when not to speak.  As a senior myself, I can relate to such challenges.  The third time around for Cindy and Jay is an adventure!  Highly recommend.

This is a very humorous story of Cindy Layton.  She's been twice divorced, the last one leaving her to buy another home (more like a cottage) and having to face her ex-husband, an attorney, also her boss.  Needless to say, she'll not work there long!  She feels like a relic and doubts she can ever establish a new relationship, even on her terms.  This is an hilarious journey taking her to blind dates, as well as internet dating sites.  Nothing offers her hope.  She'd rather stay home in her cave with her dog, Shirley.  But ... one day she receives an e-mail from Jay DeMatteo.  Can she be swayed to take the risk of starting a new relationship at her age?  One reason people like to read is to be entertained.  Susan Jean Ricci knows how to entertain with lots of hilarious scenes, which will make you laugh out loud.  Also, her story contains many thoughts of wisdom.  Highly recommend.

This book is truly a treasure!  Twenty-one bestselling authors have written these short fairy tales to accompany Jonathan's Diaz's wonderful photographs of children who are battling cancer.  These stories support the on-going fight against pediatric cancer.  The stories remind kids that they are strong, powerful, hopeful, and full of happiness.  The stories fulfill the dreams of youngsters, and parents will look forward to sharing these dreams with their own children.  This book makes a very worthy and wonderful gift to young families.  I bought the print copy and I also read this on my Kindle.  Yes, a true treasure!

In this novel, Pam Courage has had a bad day.  She's driving numerous rounds between Sacramento and Davis, California.  She's under so much distress but decides to settle the argument she and her husband had that early morning.  She is killed in an auto accident before arriving home, by a huge truck; her car bursts into flames and she is incinerated within.  Thirteen years later, her husband Ray Courage, an ex-college professor, is now a private investigator, primarily for insurance companies.  A friend, Rubia, had once been a former gang leader in West Sacramento until she now is founder of "It's My Life," a non-profit organization to help kids stay away from gangs by offering more productive activities.  Ray has volunteered a few hours every week to lend a hand to her, though he doesn't feel confident to do much good.  He lacks the capabilities Rubia has by living such a life on the streets.  It's November 11, the day Pam had died.  It always brings back memories.  A message pops up on his I-phone, from address PAM1111, proclaiming she is Pam and is alive. She's going to seek revenge on his attempted murder of her. Will this open the case file where Ray could be arrested for murder?  Detective Carla Thurber suspects he is a murderer, and that he's also murdered a friend of Pam's. This is a complex, non-stop action thriller which will intrigue and amaze you.  Excellently written and a fast read.

Bravo, Bravo!  This author has worked on this story for over 30 years.  Being dyslectic all his life, Author Grant Spradling has had the courage and help to bring this story to fruition.  This story is about racism, homophobia, romantic obsession, and murder. The story opens in 1962, seven years before Stonewall and decades before same-sex marriages have become more recognized as equality.  David Ward and Paul Adams live on the back side of Beacon Hill, in Boston for eight years.  David is a reverend at the Congressional Church.  Coming in late to his office, his secretary tells him Mrs. August Northrup and a police detective are waiting in his office.  Fear seizes him as he wonders if his being gay has been discovered.  Growing up gay always planted fear in his heart as he had frequently been threatened by those who wished to do harm to gays.  But that's not the issue.  Mrs. Northrop's home had been burglarized by a young black boy, Forest Washington.  She wishes David to attend his arraignment and wants to employ the boy.  She reminds the detective after he mutters a derogatory racial remark, "Bigotry is far greater sin than theft."  After a while both David and Paul think the other is having relations with another man.  David feels so guilty, but they still love each other. But Dave has been troubled more frequently with frightening dreams which he has shared with Paul. He thus decides to go back to his home town to find out if he can bring closure to these frightening dreams.  He also is on a mission to find out who had killed the town sheriff 25 years ago, which hopefully will bring an end to his nightmares.  This is a fast-paced novel, the characters compelling, and the story is spellbinding.  Highly recommend.

This intense, investigative thriller by renowned author Carolyn Arnold is spellbinding, packed with many surprises.  Detective Madison Knight had been kidnapped previously by the Russian Mafia and daily is plagued with horrible memories.  She's back on the job with partner Terry Grant, who's married and expecting his first child...any day.  In a short amount of time, there have been three murders of women.  Her boss and her past ex-fiance, Toby Sovereign, also a detective in the Stiles PD, believe the murders were done by a serial killer.  But Madison believes there is a link between these three killings and in spite of her dwindling reputation within the PD and a lose of mutual respect with the forensic doctor, Cole Richards, she is determined to find hard-core proof.  Her relationship with men since her experience with Sovereign is the least of her problems, except there is one man who respects her, supports her, and is working his way into her heart:  Troy Matthews, head of the Stiles PD SWAT team.  This is an intense thriller, one I could not put down and was not ready for the surprising ending.  The characters are well defined, there is a well established story line, and this novel is wonderfully written.  Carolyn Arnold is one of my favorite authors.  She never fails to thrill me, scare me, and keeps me entertained better than any movie.

As this fourth story of Monica and Beast Hugo moves to New York City, Hugo follows her to meet her father who has taken a turn in his cancer fight.  Hugo is offering his last ultimatum when they meet at his hotel.  He is cold, determined to win the game.  Monica knows Hugo can change into a monster, but her Hugo is a good man inside, but she feels like she's being blackmailed into marrying him ... and she must also consummate that marriage for her to have the full benefits as his wife, and promises of more freedom, and continued care for her father..  She's concerned how others may think she's an evil gold-digger; or that her friends are convinced he is a monster and she and her dad need to run away to Australia.  She has agreed to marry him, so why does she feel unwelcome at the hotel?  He's made arrangements for their wedding to take place on Saturday, but why doesn't he reflect joy, happiness and love?  She's becoming more and more fearful.  The story line in this fourth story is much more on target and is a more compelling story so far in this series.

This is a well written, interesting introduction to this new series by R. Scott Mackey.  Doctor Ray Courage had been a professor at Sacramento State University and retired after 22 years at the age of 52.  He's starting a new career as a private investigator, entering into an internship with California Farmers Insurance.  With his background, he jumps right into a case which had cost the insurance company $1.5 million.  It was ruled an accidental death but there are some circumstances which suggest it might be homicide.  Ray Courage has the skills, abilities, and even a sense of humor ... but this time his humor could dissolve when his life is threatened and nearly lost.  This is one of the most entertaining mysteries I've read in a long time.  It's well written and a quick read.  Highly recommend.

I really was glued to this well written thriller which reflects the power of some women.  It drew me in, and I couldn't set it down for long.  Christian and Angelique are just married; it's their happiest day ever and a perfect day.  People are gathered outside  the Riverside Church, rice is flying.  The perfect day comes to an abrupt end when a shot is fired and blasts apart Angelique's head. Could it had been done by a sniper serial killer who has now taken three lives in seven days?  Tess Williams is watching the news at a coffee shop in NYC.  She hangs her head realizing her work is never done.  She heads to the crime scene to gather any information she can.  She's ready to take on a new mission as hunter of a devious serial killer, known as Pool Cleaner.  This is an amazing, fast page turner.  I do believe Author Steve N. Lee has trapped me into being mesmerized by his well written thrillers.  Highly recommend.

As the village people seek revenge on Hugo, they kidnap Monica.  She wakes to find she has not been tied up or locked in an empty dark room.  She's in the living room of a small house sitting in a comfortable recliner.  Monica has learned her father's condition has taken a turn for the worse.  She has to return home to be at his side.  The villagers mean her no harm but want to protect her from the Beast as they believe he killed his previous wife and unborn child.  They tell Monica she looks so much like the deceased wife.  This story does not possess the fire of the previous episodes.  There is way too much filler descriptions rather than dialogue and action.

In this sequel Book 2 of the Beastly Beauty Series, Monica is questioning her own values of acceptance and decides to stay with Hugo at the mansion.  The British villagers plan a primitive witch hunt against Hugo.  Yes, he had been cursed, but inside he's a good man.  Will Monica be able to adapt to living his hermitage life style and will he tell her about his curse?  Can she trust him? If she leaves there will be no more money sent to the states for the care of her father.  Hugo loves her, but ... can he continue showing her his best side of warmth and affection?  He has a lot on his plate now with the uprising of the villagers.

This is a short paranormal story, Book One of the series (Beastly Beauty).  Monica's father is diagnosed with cancer.  She has to find a way to make more money to pay for his treatment.  She meets a man, Hugo Sommer, who is seeking a bride.  She was raised by her father and she'll do anything to help him.  He is her only family.  She flies to Britain and assesses Hugo, finding him a strange man, who never goes out at night, and he never goes to the British village by himself.  The dialog of this story is in the words of the main character, Monica.  She is well described by the author as an innocent young 20-year old.  This is an easy-to-read story which will captivate and lure you into the Beast's mansion with Monica.  I'm looking forward to the next book in the series.

This is a fantastic, fast-paced thriller.  It's a well-written story about Samuel Kazdoy, who once owned Corrugated Container Corp., founded in the 1920s. He's old but he still a workaholic.  Violet Belfrey, a busty woman of undetermined age poses nude for Samuel as he has now a new camera.  She had once been a stripper in Jacksonville, Florida.  For her little performance, the old man gifts her the contents of one locked drawer of a file cabinet.  It consists of bundles of legal papers and 'coupons,' redeemable the first of every month at any bank.  Violet wonders what the heck she stuffed into her bag.  It's a lot of money and she guesses there are more coupons in the other cabinet drawers.  She and a friend plan to find out.  Jake Lassiter is Sam Kazdoy's attorney, and he suspects Violet is up to some tricks involving Sam.  He's right, and soon Lassiter will be tracking a killer from Miami to Bimini, then on to Maui.  This is another thriller which is gripping and captivating.  No one can entertain you better than Paul Levine's famous ... no, infamous character, Jake Lassiter.  Highly recommend.

Ghosts, gremlins, witches ... it's that time of year to get the spooky stories out to read in a dark, quiet spot.  Some of these stories will make your body tingle, the hair on your head stand up.  There are 13 such stories here to liven you up in preparation for Halloween.  Enjoy them ... they're great!  I especially enjoyed "Ghosts" by Mala Rheston, and "Bunnies" by Rich Meyer.  Which will be your favorites?  Write a review and let the authors know!

In this suspenseful young children's story, Lee's left ear has ballooned to a size bigger than Lee's head!  Could it be that it was caused while he struggled with his mom during his bath time?  He was being mean, while mama wants him clean!  She finally walks away, tired of getting sopping wet and her son being belligerent.  Lee goes to bed without a goodnight kiss and his unwashed ear begins to itch.  There's nothing better than having an itch to scratch, right?  Wrong!!  This is a funny, delightful rhyming story with very cute simple expressive illustrations.  Cute, cute story.  Kids, wash your ears!

Kids really enjoy all the stories of Oliver, the handsome black and white cat, and Jumpy, his friend the kangaroo mom and boy, Joey. "Letter In A Bottle," is about Foxy being naughty and getting into trouble with his mom.  Today he brushes his crumbs under the carpet rather than putting the crumbs in the trash.  This is really funny!  Once in trouble, always in trouble!  The next story is how "Oliver Meets Jumpy" for the first time.  It is in the outback and Jumpy is found crying with a broken leg.  We are so happy that Oliver saves her for all the fun adventures they share together.  In "The Enchanted Forest, " which is over the hill and across the lake, stands an old castle, crumbly and spooky.  But Oliver, Jumpy, and little Joey have no fear.  They enter the castle, and then go through another door which opens to a big forest with mean looking trees.  The trees share their stories of the witch who turned soldiers into these trees.  Spooky? Yes!  It's a good thing Oliver has his magic wand!  These are the best stories ever, always getting more fun for kids to enjoy the adventures.  Highly recommend these well-crafted tales.

Lisa Shea's romantic stories are very short, and very enjoyable.  But I get the impression that the author rushed to get this published as there are some needed corrections to be made.  Is the man in Emily's quiet life Rich or Ryan?  Does Emily drive a car or a truck?  These overlooked mistakes aside, the story is about Emily and her previous husband meeting up after 10 years of separation, and their two daughters away at college, seeking their own independent lives.  They do not question their last 10 years away from each other and just resume in a close relationship as husband, wife, and parents.  It's a tender story of how tension raising children can sometimes lead to friction, friction to divorce.  But when the nest is empty, a binding relationship still can exist.  It's short, read it.

This is a story suitable for young adults, one which all should read, as well as adults.  It is set in 19th Century Europe and the author's writing is styled to that time frame.  Anders Christiansen is four years old when his father, a fisherman, returns from the sea on a day in 1816.  He loves his father who thrills him with stories which he loves to hear.  He soon begins sharing his own tales delighting other classmates and teachers as he grows older.  When he is 14 years old, his creative stories become more about people rather than animals and objects.  He starts to observe more people and listening to them as they gather in markets and business places.  Soon he is chosen to attend a university away from home. The professors at the university recognize his valued gift as high quality and seek to promote and guide him to be very successful.  After a year at school, a message is hand-delivered to him which states his father has been lost at sea and his mother is gravely ill.  He's to return home immediately.  Soon his mother dies, and as he returns to college, it's difficult for him to find a rooming house. Very soon, his life changes dramatically, but he has one faithful friend who wishes to help him:  a large white dog.  This is a remarkable tale of survival, compassion, and the struggles in making the most of one's life. This story is written mostly as from a story teller, with little dialog, but it's a remarkable tale for young readers if they are encouraged to take the time to engulf themselves into this meaningful story.  Highly recommend.

Author Tracy Brogan writes wonderful stories which embrace readers with romance, love, humor, and reality.  In this story, celebrity Delaney Masterson is trapped in a scandal when an old boyfriend releases a private video to the news media.  She's become comedian's punching bag and is embarrassed and humiliated.  From California, Delaney seeks some privacy, peace, and solitude in Bell Harbor, Michigan, in the bitter cold, snowy winter.  Her little house she's leased is about 800 sq. ft.,a  tottering old Victorian house with a crooked roof.  A perfect place to hide out, especially when it seems she'll be buried in snow ... the worst winter storm in 50 years.  As she gets settled in her shack, as she calls it, adventure-show cameraman, Grant Connelly, is on his way home to Bell Harbor from Peru to attend the wedding of his his brother, Tyler.  He's heading home for good, quitting his job, and will seek a more fulfilling life.  Well, the fun begins as they surprise each other as they first meet.  This is a captivating, well written  story which I loved, you will, too.

I really enjoyed this short story which takes place at Hampton Beach in New Hampshire.  Summer is just about over, colleges are in session, and Molly strolls along the boardwalk.  She is working as a bartender at a rowdy night club.  She runs into Martin sitting at a cafe patio, reading a book.  He's waiting for his sister, Emily, who's an artist and whose birthday is today.  She's a little delayed wanting to finish an oil painting.  So, Molly and Martin decide to go to Plum Island to check out some birds.  This part of the coast is popular for wildlife, including migrating whales.  It's certainly much more peaceful than Boston.  Molly and Martin seem to make a perfect pair; they met three years ago to the day of his sister's birthday celebration.  .As they stroll, a truck parks, a man gets out with a shotgun, and Martin's hackles flare as he recognizes someone who will break the law of this protected nature preserve.  This is a very short story, but very moving and exciting.  This is a series I've enjoyed immensely as Lisa Shea's stories go right to the heart.  Highly recommend.

This is the first story I've read by Steve N. Lee.  It's a strongly written story, It's a scorching story of a female vigilante who tries to improve the world by eliminating the criminals, one at a time.  She also is one to help those who are suffering at the hands of organized crime.  Catalina is 27 years old and is looking for a job in Krakow, Poland.  Her mother is extremely ill and her goal is to get them to England so her mother can have good medical attention.  Her mother, Elena Petrescu, and Catalina are homeless, their money stolen from them.  Cat is trying to find any kind of work to earn money to complete the travel to England.  She does finally find a cleaning job at a recovery home for alcohol/drug addicts.  However, she finds herself in a locked room, she is mauled, assaulted, and raped.  Tess Williams is a vigilante, trained to handle a gun and is physically strong to confront the strongest of men.  She has suspicions of a young couple leaving a bar, and she follows them in the late, dark night to a park.  The couple is approached by four threatening men.  Tess attacks the men as they ascend on the couple.  They lose...they scamper away in pain.  Tess may be a slight woman but she's destined to take down the thugs and the city's underworld.  She meets up with Elena and is determined to find Catalina.  This is a story which has deep tension; however, Tess is a cunning villain, very resourceful and strong regardless of her petite size.  This is a page turner, one I could not put down.

This is a historical novel, very compelling.  In 1935, a young 16-year-old Lena Bentheim flees from Nazi Germany for Chicago.  She is alone, leaving behind her family and boyfriend, Joseph Meyer.  Her aunt in Chicago has agreed to sponsor her.  After about one year of learning English and typing, she becomes the secretary of the physics department at the University of Chicago.  Here she meets Karl Stern from Munich.  They marry in 1937 at an Israeli synagogue.  Their son Max is born in September 1939.  During this time the physics department is preparing to develop nuclear energy which will help develop the bomb of all bombs.  She promises Karl she will not reveal their work to anyone.  But tragedy comes to her life and then she is coerced into being a spy.  How?  Who is threatening her?  This is an excellently written, suspenseful story, a fast read to be enjoyed and to ponder.

I love the novels of this series written by very creative Paul Levine.  He's an excellent writer, sweeping readers deep into the action, mysteries, and vulnerabilities of Jake Lassiter.  In this potent story, Jake seeks redemption and revenge as years ago had failed to help a runaway girl, Krista Larkin.  He's guilt-driven to punish those who had harmed her. Lassiter was the last to see her after a bar party 18 years ago.  Did Krista just run away to a new life, or was she murdered.  His client is Amy Larkin, older sister to Krista. She winds up in jail charged with First Degree Murder.  Jake's investigation takes him into dangerous webs of prostitution and pornography profiteers such as Charlie Ziegler.  Why does Alex Castiel, the State Attorney, fear his background will be revealed to the public by Jack?  A very compelling story, many twists and turns.

In the author's own words, "This is a selection of metaphyictional short stories."  These stories were written to entertain, but one finds they are very thought provoking as to  how we face and live life.  Our minds are constantly spinning like our universe, fully loaded with occasional asteroids. It's like we open our mouth to speak and we just don't know where our comments came from!  Our brains are constantly spinning.  The first story, "A Day At The Beach" reminds me of the old TV series, "The Twilight Zone," where one travels through time, then back to boring reality.  A couple of these stories abruptly end as the author lets you devise your own ending.  There is not much to some of these stories, but they do grasp you and are like puzzles you're trying to put together.  Weird? Yes.  Imaginative?  Yes.  Thought provoking? Yes.  Read these stories and let the author know what you think by writing a review.

This very interesting and remarkably written historic event happened back on November 4, 1791 in the then Northwest Territory which now are the states of Ohio, Indiana, Wisconsin, and Michigan.  This battle took place during the presidency of George Washington, who was respectful of Native Americans.  Led by Chief Little Turtle of the Miami tribe and Blue Jackett of the Shawnees, they rebelled against General Arthur St. Clair's 1,200 soldiers of which over 900 were killed.  The Native American warriors were encouraged by the British still somewhat officiating in the Northwest Territory.  This was the very first  time the U.S. Army had been defeated which lead to the first congressional investigation in U.S. History.  The defeat of St. Clair was a dress rehearsal for American forces for the War of 1812, the war between U.S. of America against England, Ireland, North American Colonies, and it's Native American allies.  This well written documentary takes you into the time period of 1785-1795 and includes the history of some of the major players who took part in this battle.  It's a chronological account of how and why this battle came to be and the tragic defeat for the U.S. Army.  The author provides an extensive bibliography to reflect the in-depth research of this little known historical event. This is a good reflection of how the Native Americans came together as a confederation, while the U.S. government fumbled for three years after the Revolution.

This book is perfect for young readers.  There is lots of fun, a ghost house, but also historical facts about slavery, the Underground Railroad, and some Connecticut history.  In this exemplary, youthful story, Rusty Larson and his family move into a very old house in Connecticut.  It's called the Barstow House built in 1854 before the Civil War.  There is already an occupant in the old house, who only Rusty will discover.  It's not easy for Rusty to make friends especially having a pet pig called 'Muddles,' and living with a ghost in the house.  This story is mesmerizing, a fantastic read for young readers with a few illustrations/pictures.  It is easy to read, has short chapters, and provides an interesting concept of combining a fun read with learning facts.  It has a few errors not caught by the proofreader/editor, but it's a story to encourage youngsters to read more books.  Highly recommend.

Once again, Francois Bissonnette's stories have captured my interest as I enjoy reading them to children, who also enjoy the stories.  The first story, "The Musician And The Princess," is how Albert, the King's musician falls deeply in love with the King's daughter, Sarah.  The King likes Albert but feels he is not skilled enough to protect his daughter from the King's enemies.  So, he challenges Albert by testing him.  He must fight with one of his knights.  Albert accepts the challenge only if the fight is in the forest, at night.  The next story, "Alicia And The Unicorn," Princess Alicia is the daughter of the King of The Rickward Kingdom.  Alicia is a beautiful, happy little girl whose birth is arriving and she'll be seven years old.  She tells her father she wants a queen crown, full of precious gems.  But her father denies her request.  Her second wish is for a unicorn, but where will one be found?  And who will find the unicorn for Alicia?  These are truly wonderful stories, with wonderful photos, which make me smile and the unicorn actually warmed my heart.  Great stories, easy to read, easy to please!

This is a very riveting short story which has a very engaging story line.  It's a very moving, heartfelt story of love ... and how it never dies.  Newly wed Emma Lohan lies in hospital, brain dead, with only the life sustaining equipment keeping her alive.  Emma is only 20 years old, and in only an instant, her future is gone.  Cody White, her young husband, is devastated, but he refuses to allow her to die.  His love is too strong, he cannot go on living without her.  This leads him back to memories of how they met for the first time.  Emma had been no ordinary girl... she was beautiful in Cody's eyes, strong-willed, mischievous, and deserved respect.  He instantly fell in love with her and in his heart and soul knew he'd never walk away from her.  She was a jewel to be treasured.  But hard times come, he wasn't giving his band the support they needed to become famous, but regardless, Emma meant more to him than becoming famous.  I loved this story, the romance took me back to thoughts of my past love ... the one who got away.  But Cody is not going to let Emma get away.  This is a very potent story of true love which the reader will never forget.  Highly recommend for those who seek forever love.

Found:  Eleven rooms in a tunnel, ten bodies, and only one empty grave.  Brandon Fisher has just become an FBI Special Agent working in the Behavioral Analysis Unit.  This is his first investigation under the leadership of experienced supervisor, Jack Harper.  The team of four head to the small town of Salt Lick, Kentucky to examine the burial site.  They believe the empty grave is waiting to be filled by the psychotic serial killer.  The bodies date back in time, two to three decades, except for the last one.  Also, in a hidden basement room, they determined this room is where the killer did his cutting, and mutilation of the victims before death.  The owner of the property, Lance Bingham, has been in jail for a few years for killing two cows (which in Kentucky is a serious crime), and assaulting a man.  The last body found was killed during the time Lance was incarcerated, thus the team surmises that there is another person involved.  Also, FBI research reveals there were 11 more similar killings in Sarasota, Florida.  So far, the evidence links Bingham, but there is the killer's apprentice ... still out there.  Carolyn Arnold is an awesome writer with the characters well defined.  It's very apparent her fantastic alluring novels have been well researched and developed into realistic investigative procedures. Highly recommend.
Too short.
Only showed the hour, not the minutes.  Slow to upload.  Guess my Kindle is HD.
Only showed to clock in the vertical position on my Kindle. I prefer it would be workable on the horizontal position of Kindle.

Very thin, not a comforter.  Pillow cases were square, European popular shape, but not U.S.  It was too big to fit my queen-size mattress, it hung on the floor.  Fabric was thready not the common cotton cloth used.  Something I've never seen before.  It wound up at Good Will.

From popular author J.A. Jance comes another well written story of mystery, loss and heartbreak, military duty and honor.  Seattle investigator J.P. Beaumont is taking some time off to get both his knee joints replaced.  He's dreading this procedure, as his wife Mel Soames is driving in emergency mode to get him there faster than limits allow.  The surgery goes well and he wakes with no pain courtesy of the pain medication.  But he is a bit confused.  His thoughts go back to 1973, his very first detective murder case of Monica Wellington, a young college student found dead and her body dumped into a kitchen oil waste barrel.  Two young boys had found her and the investigation continued for a couple of years without much evidence to identify the murderer.  It's been a cold case for nearly forty years.  He also has thoughts while in recovery of being in the Vietnam War where his life had been saved by a fellow soldier who had lost his life.  Beaumont has some doors still open which he feels must be closed, and he's determined to do it.  A very interesting story, smoothly written with some heart-wrenching and emotional overtones.  It's a very compelling read, and I highly recommend to others.

This is the second children's story about Nancie ... a stubborn girl at times which most Nancie's exhibit in real life!  She'll do anything to get out of going to bed when her parents ask her.  She'd much rather play or even help Mom with her chores.  But at four years of age, she still has a lot to learn about handling fragile dishes.  It takes a good mom to set the rules, a lesson which sometimes can be adjusted just by saying, 'Please.'  Illustrations are really cute and children will really relate to this story.  Set the rules, Mom!

This is the first novel I've read by this author. In this very suspenseful crime drama, Jack Lassiter, a former NFL line-backer, is now a defense attorney in Miami.  He's contacted by Victoria Lord, of another law firm, Solomon and Lord, about her partner, Steve Solomon.  He needs a defense attorney as he's been arrested for murder of Nicolai Gorev, a suspect of wire fraud and money laundering, as well as racketeering.  Jack Lassiter may have been an attorney for 20 years, but he's more like a sleuth seeking out the answers.  This novel is exceptionally written with twists and turns, lots of action, and I could not put it down.  Author Paul Levine has me hooked and I'll be reading more of his novels, starting with the first book of this series.

This is another wonderful children's book which is educational about the sense of touch.  As Shelly, mother rabbit, and her sweet little daughter, Anna, play in the strawberry field, Anna asks her mom, "How do we use the sense of touch?"  Remember, rabbits have four feet, and each foot can detect feeling, such as wet ground, thorns among plants, and the tasty touch of a ripe strawberry!  Also, one feels a hug, the sun's warmth, the bristles on a toothbrush.  I know mothers can show their children many things to make children aware of the sense of touch, and how one must be very careful with their fingers.  A very simple book to read with very cute illustrations.  Mothers can have a lot of fun with their young children by turning this short story into a game.  A game of touch!  Look for Sagit Cohen's other books about the five senses.

The illustrations in this children's story are exceptionally inviting, and the stories are great fun to read to children.  Willomena, mostly known as Willa, is a prima-donna type of girl with big dreams.  She wants to be a star ballerina, but her feet are too big and she slips and slides!  She knocks all the beautiful swans down like they were bowling pins.  She's not wanted with that dance group; she runs away in tears into the woods.  While there, she gets some good advice from Tommy Toad, who basically says, "Don't cry, there's no need to be shy." The second story,  This story is so sweetly written in rhyming words which help grab attention of children.  It has great messages as to how to get along with others and how to reject those who are mean.  Great book for children.

This story is the sequel to "Fallen Palm."  It's been four months since Jesse McDermitt was married...for one day as his wife had been kidnapped, brutally raped and murdered on that day.  Since then Jesse has been in retreat on his small island in the Florida Keys.  Lieutenant Commander Russell "Deuce" Livingston Jr. is team leader for a Caribbean terrorist assault team with the Department of Homeland Security. He had previously asked for Jesse's assistance to scatter his father's ashes, but now, he's asking Jesse to join the task force to bring down a major smuggler, Carlos Santiago...the same man who has threatened Carl Trent, a shrimp fisherman, who made one trip for Santiago carrying drugs into the USA.  It's not for him, and now he's put his family in danger.  Jesse will provide sanctuary for Trent's family, and also join the task force to bring down Santiago.  Wayne Stinnett is a prolific author and his stories get better and better.  This story is well written, has strong defined characters, well edited, easy to read, and one I could not set down for very long.  Highly recommend.

Having the opportunity to read this book prior to publication, I jumped at the chance as I love the suspenseful mystery stories by Douglas Wickard.  However, this is a totally different story of two people straying from the normal ways of life, wandering through life not knowing who they are.  His dedication, "ABERRANT is dedicated to all those aberrant souls who felt different, disconnected, unloved or misunderstood because of their sexual preference, With Heartfelt Love, Douglas Wickard." This story is so very timely with our nation recognizing same sex marriages.  There are yet so many people who don't believe in equality, and that's one of the battles that will continue for a long time in America.  This is an awesome story examining the lives of two males, an old man, Ellery "Will" Flynn, and one young man, Chance, who have similar experiences in their childhood. The format is told in both the present and flashes back to the past.  Wickard's story is provocative and written realistically with so much passion and insightfulness.  The dialog is what I have to say is raw, but having read several wonderful books by gay authors it did not sway me from reading this story enthusiastically. I like the generosity of Chance, not thinking of himself but gifting to Will the wonderful feelings of love which he has never incurred until his last days.  I liked the counseling  offered to Chance since they endured the same hardships in their youth.  The premise of the story reveals the difficulty of gay men finding love, long lasting, true love.  Included in this novel is the history of the Stonewall Inn attack by law enforcers on LGBT people in Greenwich Village, New York City, 1969. This set the course of these people to seek equality.  I believe Author Doug Wickard wrote this story with much flamboyance, but also with his heart.  It's a strong, skillful story one that will remain in hearts and minds of those who are not judgmental. This emotional story is spellbinding, very moving, and heart wrenching. It contains erotic scenes and dialog, For Adults Only.

This is a very exciting and captivating story of Sarah Baker who struggles with PTSD due to events which happened to her 12 years earlier.  She changes her life, her name, and feels safe working on the Broken Bar Ranch.  Gage Burton, retired police detective, believes the serial killer, from whom Sarah Baker escaped from, was not the man found guilty and was given the death penalty.  He and his daughter, Tori, take a little vacation to the ranch where he suspects Sarah is located.  Cole McDonough is the son of Myron McDonough, terminally ill owner of the large ranch.  He is not close to Cole, believing he caused the death of his wife and younger son. The real serial killer is back on the hunt for Sarah.  This novel has very well developed characters, and a fantastic, finely honed story line.  The story is mesmerizing, I could not put it down.  Highly recommend.

This is an adorable story about Lily the Goat and her goat friends who are searching for a delightful choir to join.  Do you know what a choir is?  It's a group of people, in this case, animals and birds, who like to sing together to an audience.  But as Lily and her friends sing and dance through the woods, they are unable to be accepted by many choir groups, such as birds, cats, and frogs.  They are shunned and not wanted in their groups.  But, never say never because if one keeps searching, one's goal will be reached.  This is a wonderful, learning story for kids which reflects discrimination and how it can make Lily and her friends sad.  But, because they kept moving forward to their goal, they find acceptance by many species in a stunning choir group.  This rhyming story is well written and the illustrations charming.  Author Ayala Saar and illustrator Abira Das put out wonderful books for children.  They always have an important lesson in life to share.  Highly recommend.

These are great adventure stories for young children, and the illustrations are gorgeous.  Remember Oliver, the handsome and arrogant black and white cat?  Remember his best friend the kangaroo lady, Jumpy, and her little boy Joey?  Well, they are back!  Three more adventures are told here which kids will thoroughly enjoy.  First story, "The Incredible Train Journey," is filled with excitement, and simulates a scary roller coaster ride through tunnels and under the sea.  The second story is "Hiccup" which Oliver can't stop... Hiccup, Hiccup!  He has to climb a tall mountain where he's learned a certain bird secretes through feeding her babies a certain nectar to stop and prevent future hiccups.  I wonder if this works on humans!  The third story is "Fishing," which is really fun to do. Oliver takes Joey on a fishing trip. Oliver catches a really big fish which draws their fishing boat around the lake.  Who will win, Oliver or the fish? As always, author Werner Stejskal presents excellently written stories to excite children.  I recommend this story highly as well as all of Werner's other fun stories.

This is an amazing story of two people finding their love again after 25 years. It's a story of true love, and true love is never lost.  Sam Tatum, divorced for over a year, having two adult children living their lives in England, returns to Smith Mountain Lake with a dark secret he's revealed to no one.  Gabby Hayden, his first love at age 16, still lives there managing the marina and restaurant with her 10-year old adopted daughter.  This remarkable story reveals their hardships, memories, and hard decision making for each major character in this compelling, well written romance.  Inglath Cooper is certainly a master of romance and suspense. When one is drawn into such a story, it's hard not to shed tears, but that is also an indication of the engaging story line.  I highly recommend this heart warming and, also heart wrenching, story.
Sewage sticks are delightful, happy with this product.
Love these bookmarks. They are strong and I never give a book gift without including this bookmark.

The story starts off relatively simple with a girl torn between two worlds; one being ours and the other that of the human-like trolls. Wendys character makes this all complicated quickly and the story remains interesting as her actions are not easy to predict.That said, Wendy was not an easily likable character for me, I think because of her decision making, whether its concerning her family or her troll-family. Wendy aside, I did take a liking to Finn and Rhys. Both seemed to be less emotionally complicated and easier to like.'Switched' keeps to a quick pace and is an entertaining lighter read. It leaves off with a lot of room for interesting things to happen in the future, so I will likely snag the second book and continue on with this series.

Set right after the Civil War, Redemptions Edge follows Dax and Rachel to where their paths come together in Montana. Dax is a man who knows what he wants for his future, including not wanting any distractions from women for the time being. Luke compliments his brother with his own charisma, and often with an opposite way of thinking and looking at things. At the end of the war, there are still gunfights to be fought and the two of them together make an effective team. When the ranch they inherit unexpectedly comes with its own battle to keep, plus one that follows them, they quickly find their hands full.I found Rachel to be a very likeable character, as she is a strong and independent woman with talents of her own as a nurse. Like Dax, she wants to find and carve her own path in life, without falling back on the support of her family. Fortunately, finding love changes things for the better for her.Shirleen Davies captures the heart of her characters and presents them in an uplifting and satisfying story in this first book to her new historical western series. I look forward to the next book and seeing what happens next!

Assuming Names is one of those books that effortlessly propel you forward through an incredible story by means of masterful writing, all the while keeping a firm hold on your attention. Given that this is a true story, to say that it is a truly remarkable one would be a great understatement.Tanya tells of her life at fifteen, and her adventures as a highly intelligent thrill seeker/con artist. With high-speed chases, close encounters with criminals and the law, and scenarios that will set you on the edge of your seat, there is never a dull moment. There is also a fair share of irony to be had between it all that often blurs the lines between good morals and corruption in our society.This is a story that would make a great movie, as it's smart, filled with action, thrills, and just the right recipe of elements to appeal to just about anyone, whether youre a saint at heart or the more mischievously-inclined. A very worthwhile and enjoyable read that will stay in my collection to read again and an author to watch!

In American, Die, Philip finds himself caught between his conscience and what turns out to be a not-so-crazy story when a man claiming to be pursued by the NSA comes into his office. What starts off as just another job for the private detective, soon becomes a tangled web of cover-ups, spies, and government agents who wont stop till they have Philips newest friend, Sam.Falko Rademachers realistic and complex characters never fail to entertain, and thriller enthusiasts will not be disappointed. There is also a good amount of humor and twists that will keep you turning the pages and guessing what happens next. I found the conflicts between German and American norms that Philip faces to be highly entertaining as well, as the author brings a humorous light to the many differences between the two. Rademachers 'Philip Eckstein' series is one that is proving to get better with each installment, and I look forward to reading the next book!

In `One More Day,' Cameron Sinclair and Lainey are easily one of the most romantic couples I've read so far from Shirleen Davies. There is an intense and strong energy between them that just electrifies the pages. As they try to sort through their feelings for each other, there is plenty of other things going on that comes with both of them being a part of the Search and Rescue team. Along with that, Lainey has her own obstacles from her past to conquer.There is lots of suspense to be had as well, only starting with the threats that Lainey soon finds herself getting after relocating to northern Arizona. Even with her handsome hero to help her out, Lainey is independent and determined to hold her ground and protect what's important to her to the best of her own abilities.This was a really enjoyable read from start to finish, and I look forward to reading more from the MacLarens of Fire Mountain!

In this story of the MacLarens of Fire Mountain series, we get to follow Mollie and Pierce as they are assigned a case to help uncover a dangerous conspiracy. Their uncertain feelings for each other creates a great deal of tension between them, and more fights than their job alone can bring their way.Mollie was a strong woman who could hold her own, which is what I liked best about her, and Pierce complimented her character well by not trying to change who she was, while still staying close by to help her out. The ending had a cute and unexpected twist that I didnt expect too.I was happy to see some of my other favorite characters from previous books as well, and Shirleen Davies writing is entertaining and keeps you turning the pages to find out what happens next. This is a wonderful Western series and set of characters to invest in, and I look forward to reading more from her in the future!

Crown of Betrayal is a beautifully imagined, mesmerizing fantasy story about the Siren, Verona. She is princess to the throne in an underwater world where mermaids and magic exist. But with power comes those who want it for themselves, and danger and deceit explodes around her when the queen goes missing.I found Verona to be a very strong heroine, and one who adapts quickly when her friends and family have to rely on her. There was much to uncover that had been hidden from her all her life, and she rises well to the challenge.With just the right amount of intrigue, action, and a complex storyline, Marie F Crows characters will quickly pull you into their world, and you will not want to leave. This is a wonderful book for fantasy and mermaid enthusiasts to pick up!

'The Mixtape' is a heart-wrenching play of one woman's triumph over the negative impact of her childhood. This immersive script pulls you quickly into an unforgettable story of finding one's true self, and escaping the negativities that tie us to our past sins by bringing them into the light.Paula Stinson's characters inspire those in similar situations to break free of the negative cycle that haunts them, and to find hope and happiness starting from within themselves. This is a hard play to put down once you start reading it, and a great gift for yourself or anyone who is depressed and in need of some positive reinforcement.
This has become my newest favorite perfume that comes packaged as beautifully as it smells. A wonderful gift to give to someone you care about, or to keep for yourself.
I've been a fan of this band for years, and can listen to them endlessly without tiring. None of their albums disappoint.

Both the manga and DVDs for this series are just the right balance of romance, action, and suspense that makes this a must-have for avid gamers and anime fans alike. 'Sword Art Online' is an amazing story that will rekindle your love for anime, and one to enjoy reading and watching more than once.

This was an interesting book that takes on the huge topic of what goes behind the things we use everyday, and how to recreate the fundamental essentials of what we take for granted in modern society. A must-have book for Apocalyptic writers, survivalists, and the research types who enjoy a good dose of useful knowledge, whether humanity hits the end of the world, or not.

Shirleen Davies has done it again with her MacLarens of Fire Mountain series with a powerful and touching story of the importance of family. It follows Trey and Jesse as they grow closer in their relationship, which seems to be going well until an unexpected turn hits.Trey and Jesse are a loving couple, and the tension between them proves that when two people really love each other, it takes a great deal to tear them apart. I finished this book in one sitting as I really fell in love with the characters and refused to put them down until I reached the end. If you havent read any of this series yet, Hard Landing quickly brings you into the loop of the series and wont leave you stranded. I cant wait for the next book!

Abigail and Her Pet Zombie: Spring is a wonderful new childrens story from Marie Crow, and just in time for spring! Abigail and her pet zombie are excited to see that spring has arrived and they head outdoors. Abigail finds that she has to conquer her fear of riding a bike, and her pet zombie and friends are just the help she needs.The illustrations are funny and cute, and like its predecessors, this story offers a wonderful life lesson for kids about facing your fears. This is an adorable childrens series to pick up for your youngsters or gift for a special child in your life.

I was browsing my local health store when the shopkeeper introduced me to this product. I've been on the lookout for alternatives to the caffeine energy drinks I used to buy to keep me going as a self-employed busy mom. I first tried this with just water, but while the taste is a genuine tasty vanilla, the somewhat-sandy texture wasn't very high up my alley. I tried next to mix it with my morning coffee and later with milk, and it was much nicer. It also gives a strong and quick energy kick, particularly in the morning where I used to slug around for hours before becoming awake enough to get things done. I'm too early into using it to comment on whether it helps weight loss as well, but with its ingredients and how it helps curb hunger cravings by giving your body a good dose of the nutrients it needs to run, I can foresee this product helping out a bit there as well. I will have to try out the chocolate flavor next time time I shop.

I wasn't sure I would enjoy this book when I picked it up, but I was in for a wonderful surprise. What starts off as an interesting premise, the life of a young girl during WWII who loves books enough to go out of her way to obtain them, quickly becomes a story that you can't put down. All of the characters are charming and put through heart-wrenching circumstances that accurately reflect how life was in Germany during the war, and I was in tears more often than once. That said, there are certainly some funny and thoroughly memorable things that happen as well, and enough action to keep the story intense and in high-gear. After I finished the book I watched the movie and it too was worth every moment of my attention. This is a keeper for my own kids and grandchildren to read and watch.

I wanted to go back to read and enjoy this book again, and with the release of the anniversary edition, the author offers the best chance to do such with brand new scenes not included in the original release.Marie Crow weaves together a detailed and brutal world with her masterful storytelling that makes you feel as if you are there and experiencing every terrifying moment. With both living and dead enemies everywhere, Helena proves to be a strong heroine who has to fight to stay alive and it's a hard fight at that. This is a must-have book for zombie and horror novel enthusiasts, and for fans of The Walking Dead series.

7 Steps to Success Dog Obedience Training is a detailed and easy to follow guide on how to train your dog some of the basic commands while using positive reinforcement. Whether you are just starting out training your puppy or an older dog, or have already started, David Christopher has some great tips that will help you maximize your time and results.Some of the things included are how to teach your dog how to sit, stay and come, the importance of consistency, avoiding distractions at the beginning of training and using treats as a reward before moving on to using just praise later on. The only thing I felt was missing was housebreaking your puppy, but overall this is a great book for yourself or a new dog owner in your life.

"Second Summer" is a charming addition to the MacLarens of Fire Mountain series. It follows Heath and Annie as they find themselves wanting a meaningful and lasting relationship, but are unsure if they truly want to take a step away from their current circumstances into a more romantically promising direction.Shirleen Davies characters are all intriguing, and the ones in this book are no exception. She leaves no emotion unturned with complex characters who come to life off of the page, intertwined into a realistic and fulfilling story that will have you guessing what happens next to the last page. Overall a wonderful read!

Greg Sandora has created an enthralling story where one man finds himself teamed up with an unlikely angel companion. Still grieving from the loss of his wife, Bo has to figure out where his feelings lie, while Gabby helps him along the way. These two find themselves faced off again demons and evils that will put their faith to the ultimate test, as well as their friendship when the use of supernatural powers used on others gets discovered. This was an emotional, believable and witty story that I recommend for paranormal and angel enthusiasts!

Had there been less Harry Potter inspired ideas throughout, I think that I would have liked this book a lot more. Not to say that I don't like the Harry Potter series, it's just the way it was implemented into 'Knights' was not in a way that worked for me. Perhaps a younger reader could enjoy this story a lot more than I did. The characters and general story were okay, but not enough for me to pursue this series further.

Kamil Kowalski has assembled an essential and easy to follow book for anyone who wants to improve their lifestyle, work output and energy with over 115 thoughts and ideas to practice, many on a daily basis. 'Get Things Done and Feel Great' is a book packed with some great advice and tips on how to get yourself organized, and quotes that will help to inspire you and get you motivated for the better, and help you to reduce stress. This is a great book for anyone wanting to improve their quality of life in a simple and effective manner.

'The Romanticks' is a fun and lovable story about Emma, who is a witch responsible for helping to bring soulmates together, and in the case of the more strongly connected ones, prevent catastrophic environmental effects from happening should they fall apart. They are guided by their dreams to the people in need of a hand, until Emma's hometown gets hit with dangerous weather and there is no dream to lead them in the right direction. Emma and her family, who are also Romaquars, must then pull together all of their resources to figure out which soulmates are being pulled apart from each other. On top of that, things aren't as easy for Emma's romantic life, leading her to doubt herself and whether she will ever find her happiness by finding her own soulmate.With lots of teen angst and gripping tension as the story progresses, Joanna Gray has created an enjoyable romantic story for the young adult audience (or the YA at heart) with memorable characters, and I look forward to reading more of this trilogy!

'Alfred Wellers' is a beautifully written, heart-warming story of a young boy who takes his future into his own hands when he leaves on a ship set to sail for the new world. Along the way he has to endure the terrifying storms and the incompetent crew of the ship. He later runs from it and makes his home with nature and near the natives, taking on a whole new set of challenges.Jerry Beller makes you feel as if you are right there alongside Alfred Weller, with detailed world building in tune to the year 1609, and memorable characters who come to life right off of the page. This is easily one of my favorite historical fiction novels of the year.

I use this to juice everything from apples to spinach, and it works really well. The plastic parts are really easy to wash, but the filter feels a bit weak and is harder to get clean. It takes less than a minute to put together and take apart, and it fits into my small cupboard. It's loud, but not unbearably. A decent machine if you're looking to make two glasses of juice at a time.

`Super Guide To Self Publishing' is a comprehensive book of everything you need to know about self-publishing your own book and making it for sale with major retailers such as Amazon and Smashwords.Michael Hetherington shows you how to make a continuous stream of income starting from how to get your inspiration, to how to market your book so that it will sell. He also covers how to format your book in Word and make your book available in print, everything about copyrights, how to make picture books and finding the best keywords. This is a great guide to have for anyone just starting out on the self-publishing road, or for those who have already started and are looking for extra tips and sites where they can learn how to further expand the potential of their books.

Amy and Nick are married for five years, but there is not much harmony left. All of a sudden, Amy is missing. And from there, a more and more surprising and devious plot develops, cleverly and elegantly put together by a very talented writer.It is difficult to talk about the plot without risking spoilers. So let's say this: It is not a conventional thriller. There are twists and totally surprising developments, we are getting manipulated and are lied to by both protagonists. It's not only a thriller, the book is also about unconventional truths about love and marriage. Sadly, the ending is a disappointment. Best not to expect too much from it and just enjoy the reading of the novel as such.The book is always straightforward and readable, but maybe there are a few digressions too many. I can't help but feeling that nowadays thriller writers feel the need to expand their books to 600 pages when 400 would have done just as well. That's stupid, because it automatically weakens the suspense.Gillian Flynn really deconstructed love and marriage here a lot, so I have a suggestion for readers who would like to read a (shorter) crime novel which is thrilling, full of dark humor and lets you believe in love again: Heads Off (A Lisa Becker Mystery).

'The New Green Juicing Diet' was an absolute treat to come across when I was browsing for recipes for my juicer. There is a recipe in here for your every particular need, whether you want skin that glows and/or lasting energy for your day--and of course to lose weight!All of the recipes in here are broken down to their particular benefits, which takes out the guesswork of finding and combining the right fruits and vegetables for the results you want. There is even a chapter that explains the different juicers out there and what they do and don't do right down to their parts and price, and a weekly shopping list for your fruits and vegetables for added simplicity. This is an unmatched book that covers everything you can want out of your juicer for improving your health.

'Make Money to Write About Your Kids' is the perfect book to help you get started with writing for magazines. Kerrie McLoughlin has compiled a wealth of information that is useful for both those starting out, and for experienced writers looking for a publisher with over two hundred paying markets.I found the general submission guidelines to be a great help, especially as not every magazine lists its own, and the mistakes to avoid, many of which I didn't know of before.
