Also included are all the terms used in the publishing industry, which really helped me to get an understanding of what they all mean in detail. This is an essential book to have for writers wanting to work from home and make an income from it.

'Secrets of a Real-Life Female Private Eye' has everything about being a private eye covered, from the history of them to the modern technology used by them now.Colleen Collins uses her real life experiences and knowledge to give an informative first-hand look into the life of female P.I.s in an entertaining manner. I found the part about ghost hunters, pet detectives and the pole dancing assignment to be particularly interesting.Collins also lays out in detail how to protect your identity, deal with cyber trolls and what not to do as a P.I. This is a must-have book for anyone writing about private detectives, or curious to how they are outside of fiction.

'Killgrace and the Faithless' is an intriguing time travel sci-fi that takes Susan into the past with her accompanying alien, to a once-technologically advanced world that mysteriously evacuated the planet on a wide scale.Susan gets labelled as a 'Faithless' and imprisoned by the local primitives who remain, and it has the effect of slowing down her search for answers, while she wonders just where the alien scientist, Cet, vanished to. She befriends fellow 'Faithless' shortly after and strives to help them, but it's a difficult struggle with only pre-technology  resources available. The mystery of the missing inhabitants of the planet kept me glued in suspense till the end. Although a hard science fiction, 'Killgrace' will still touch you on an emotional level with Susan's struggles and who she befriends.This book reminded me in some ways of the movie 'Outlander' which I enjoyed a lot as well, and is equally as unpredictable and entertaining. Though a short read, I still felt connected to the characters and their situations, and I couldn't put this story down till I finished it. I look forward to reading more of the Killgrace series!

Happening a year after 'Tougher Than the Rest', we follow Jamie and his conflicts of the heart when he rescues an old flame who left him once for a man with money. Things quickly get more complicated than that and soon nothing is as it seems, or safe.As one of the four brothers of the 'MacLarens of Fire Mountain' series, Jamie gains a great deal of discipline in becoming a U.S. Marshal after becoming troubled for a while after his heart is broken. When the law comes after Victoria, this creates a lot of conflict. He was a great character to see on his own, and is now my favourite of the brothers. Victoria was a really strong heroine as well, likely from her past experiences that are nothing short of cruel and cold. Despite being the lady in distress, she keeps her head high and her focus on dealing with and moving past her troubles.'Faster Than the Rest' is a great western romance read for those who enjoy realistic and complex characters, whether you're continuing from the previous book or reading it as a standalone.

I applied this product right after using Inebrya to bleach my hair, and the results came out really pretty. I had majorly stubborn orange/red tones haunting my hair (my grandmother had orange-red hair and I started with dark brown hair). I mixed it with my shampoo and left in on for a couple minutes, and the carrotness was gone and a near-platinum blond and light purple streaks remained (which I was aiming for).It is a rather small jar for the price and for how long it lasts, but the result is soft and shiny hair. I will have to try different colors in the future after I give my hair its needed 2nd round of bleaching in a few weeks.

I just demolished this book, was a really great read. If anyone is looking to have less stress in your work life, while still having some time to do the things you enjoy, `25 Tips to Balance Everyday Work & Play' is a great book to help get you on the right track. All of the tips in here are easy to follow, and can be easily incorporated into everyday life.Ginel Love explains bit by bit on how to set and achieve realistic goals, finding your calming place of sanctuary, and keeping your social and emotional needs in check. This book has helped me a great deal, and it is a must-have for those who have careers or students who are feeling overwhelmed and are looking for help. I definitely recommend picking this one up!

'Creative Mindshaping' is a book filled with inspiring stories and motivation to improve your life. Dan Best also goes the extra mile to show you the things you can do on an everyday basis that will help you not only achieve your short-term goals, but your long-term ones as well by creating effective habits. By using the Paralympians as an excellent example, Best shows how you can achieve anything you set your mind to.What I found the most interesting part of this book was how Best shows you how to meditate to access the subconscious of your mind where your beliefs dwell. I tried these methods and they are very relaxing and seem to be benefitting me as well. The tested and tried approaches, backed by years of the author's experiences, are worth the small price of this book alone.

'Cryonic' is a zombie novel with a new twist. Royce dies of a heart attack, and is awakened in 2050 from cryogenic freezing. When they try to unfreeze others like him, hoping to be able to revive their dead soldiers, something goes horribly wrong and a zombie virus is unleashed on America--that China has already taken over much of. Royce and his friends must fight to survive as the world around them dies and tries to kill them.Travis Bradberry has written a real page turner with realistic characters, and a futuristic world where even though we are technologically advanced, everything that we currently take for granted is taken away. This is a great book for all zombie enthusiasts and horror fans to pick up. I can't wait for the next one!

As a new juicer I found the recipes in this book to be tasty and super-easy to make. Tori Anderson explains in detailed, step-by-step instructions, how to make the perfect juice with various easy-to-find fruits and vegetables, as well as how to garnish them. She also explains their specific health benefits and they are all tailored to help you lose weight.With lots of juicing recipes that will boost your energy and your health, 'Juicing Recipes for Weight Loss' has saved me hours and hours of researching and trial and error. This book is a well-used, great addition to my recipe collection.

This book was scary enough to give me nightmares! I found Zed to be a great example of a well done anti-hero, well, at least in the beginning, as his character then evolves more into a hero. As the world around him falls apart by a zombie disease, he keeps his focus on saving himself and doing what he can for only his friends who have stuck their necks out for him. His character growth from nothing in life to expert in taking on a world of death was believable and engrossing. Zed and his surviving friends are 'slow burners' who have the smell and look of zombies, but still have their minds that are not overtaken by madness and primal urges.The world building is so well done that it soon becomes easy to get the shivers from this book. While most zombie books are fantasy-like and easy to distinguish from our reality, Bobby Adair goes the extra mile to pull you into his terrifyingly created one. I can't wait for the next book!

'Tougher Than the Rest' is a memorable western romance set in Arizona in the 1800's. After four kids suffer the tragic loss of their parents, we're taken twelve years into the future where they are grown up and trying to find love and what they want to do for the rest of their lives.Niall came off as really cold most of the time, as he was still recovering from the loss of his wife, Camille, and has the responsibility of keeping his family afloat. Although attracted to Kate, he sees her as an obstacle to putting his life on the financially stable track he intended by marrying a wealthy widow. There is a lot of attraction and tension between these two, as Kate wants Niall close, but he's hard-headed and refuses to change his mind.Shirleen Davies really pulls you into Kate's and Niall's world with these strong main characters and secondary characters. I felt like I was in their world throughout the whole story as well, which is a testimony to great writing. I can't wait for the next book!

I was laughing out loud for a good majority of the time while reading 'Broken Headbone', as what the women go through in this book was both crazy and all around funny.Although a short read, the stories that Ginny Mcmath has assembled together in this book are unforgettable ones of self-reflection after marriage collapses and woes. I found 'Clown Porn' to be the funniest and my favourite of them all in here. Can something good be made out of bad luck? This book will make you believe it can, and since part of the proceeds go to Breast Cancer research, it's a great book to pick up.

Lee Wilson has created a captivating world where angels are amongst us, as are their fallen dark counterparts who are known as vampires.Daniel and Hannah were a really hot couple, and although their attraction was quick, it is held together by their strong feelings. Their relationship grows on a believable level as Hannah then finds out his secret and herself in the middle of a struggle for power between two supernatural forces.With suspense, romance, new adult angst and a gripping plot, 'The Last Hybrid: Bloodline of Angels' is a great book for paranormal fans and anyone who enjoyed the 'Twilight' series. I look forward to reading the sequel!

Snow is a Canadian on the other side of the world in Russian vodka country, content to be depressed and miserable for the rest of his life, until an accident puts him into a coma.We're then taken into the past and what has happened to him up to that point with the help of the woman, Magda, who won't give up on him. There is also a danger that is making the workers sick, and as a keeper of the documents for the company, he may be the deciding factor in exposing the threat before it continues on its dangerous course.Magda was an interesting character, and her determination to not give up on Snow and pull him out of his darkness defines her complex character even more. I felt a lot of sympathy for Snow as well, and his past that helped put him where he is now. The conditions that they have to endure are harsh and in many ways unforgiving. This is a great read for anyone who enjoys unconventional thrillers that have something to offer other than the usual.

If you have ever found yourself stuck in writer's block or self-doubt, this book is a must read. Rebecca Dickson lays it out raw on the table on how to get back on track with your writing and how to throw your insecurities out a window. Though I picked up this book for my Kindle when it was free, I would have happily paid money on it.

'Of Hearts and Stars' is an emotional and fast-paced coming of age story. Reading like a classic set in the future where we have space travel, Edward West has brought together a memorable set of characters set against harsh odds in the midst of a war.Having lost his parents at a young age, Leoric Swift faces one brutal challenge after the other, starting with escaping an abusive orphanage. When he reaches the Arbalest Solar Academy, he makes friends with Reveille and Gin and together they may be what turns the tides to victory.Anyone who is a fan of 'Ender's Game' and endearing sci-fi stories of friendship will greatly enjoy this one. I can't wait for the next book!

`Real Estate Investor's Guide to Flipping Bank-Owned Properties' is an unmatched wealth of information for anyone in the business of real estate and flipping properties for profit, or for anyone who is just starting out.Matt Andrews explains how to get you making money fast from his personal experiences in a straight to the point manner. He also covers everything about contracts, legalities, the lingo, banks and lending, and hedge funds, that is all up-to-date for 2013. Also included are websites to utilize and lots of insider tips, all which makes this an essential book to have.

When I was looking around for an air conditioner for my place, I was disheartened to find that none of the window units would fit in my tiny windows. This one fits comfortably inside and cools down my large rooms fast. It's really easy to maintain with no water leaking from it (like window units) and the filters are easy to take out and wash.My only complaint would be that the exhaust and power cord are really short and I had to move my room around a bit to accommodate for that. But overall this is a powerful, easy to use, and easily portable air conditioner that anyone can handle.

Even though I skipped three of the seven chapters (didn't need them for class), the book turned out to be a great help. The explanations are good and there are a lot of examples from easy to hard, including some more exotic ones. Certainly a good pick if you struggle with statistics. Plus, you can't argue with the price.However, in my opinion a few of the examples were "too much" for a beginner's book, they can make it a tough read. And the illustrations could be better. But that's something I can live with, I'd still recommend the book.

'The Ultimate Guide to Men's Style' is an essential book to have for every man wanting to dress to impress.Marshall Alexander covers everything from what clothes to have to fit any occasion, colors that work, different suit cuts, and assembling your wardrobe within means of your budget. He explains how to dress from head to foot, in a simple to understand, straight to the point manner that is easy to follow.This guide also takes the guessing out of accessorizing, what is appropriate to wear for every occasion, and existing trends that will die fast and are better to ignore. The pictures that are included are a great help as well. Thanks to this book, I will never be lost in the men's department again when shopping for my husband's clothes.

Mya gets a lot more than she fishes for when she pulls a gorgeous boy out of the water and saves his life. As a next to invisible and socially awkward teenager, her life flips over entirely when Daniel sets the majority of his focus on her, while trying to recover from his amnesia.Mya and Daniel were really cute together, as well as an effective team, rising to meet all of the challenges put before them. Mya was loyal, smart and open-minded, while Daniel was a supportive and strengthening match for her. Charlie was really cute and I found myself liking him a lot.With a seamless mix of star-crossed romance, teenage angst and mermaids, 'Silver Tides' is an engrossing story that is both fun and emotional from start to finish.

'Soul Cage' is set in a futuristic world after a terrorist assault on our ozone that killed billions, bringing the human race together to save it, and after a brutal intergalactic war known as the 'Yarv War'.Now people live beyond a hundred in a technologically advanced society, and a scientist has created possibly the greatest breakthrough in history. With the cost of space travel exponential, Jiro Yamamoto has constructed a human teleporter that can take apart and reconstruct humans in another location, using death row inmates as test subjects.When the machine is near perfection, Jiro is brutally killed, and inspector/military veteran, Burt Campbell, is put on the case to uncover his murderer and piece together all of Jiro's research. Following him with great interest is the military and Jiro's former lover, Penelope.'Soul Cage' is a futuristic crime thriller with a paranormal touch that challenges where and just how the human soul fits into scientific achievement. This is a book that will appeal to science fiction fans who enjoy complex world building, realistic characters, and the thrill of uncovering a chilling mystery.

I love the color and quality of this cord! The blue is nice bright teal! it PERFECTLY matches the blue Unicorn Beetle case I have on my iPod mini2. The cord/cable is strongly welded on each end with reinforcement  collars for additional strength.This is the six inch version of the cord. Six inches is NOT the most practical length. I plan on using this with my charging brick.I need a short cord because I charge my iPad using the brick in my purse. I use a much longer (10 foot version ) for home use.I have quite a few Belkin charging cables and all have been great. They last a long time! My apple provided or purchased cords all fray and break open prematurely.Perfect product! Well built, colorful, and handy size!

I have pets and I'm a clean freak. I love this type of cloth for cleaning because it' s very effective without using harsh chemicals. This set is 6 big cloths! The blue  color is nice bright blue...not drab. The cloths are very soft and absorbent.  Just toss these in the wash and dryer and their ready to go again. You will find a hundred uses around the home for this type of cloth.Overall,this is great set of microfiber cloths.

This is a basic no frills bath mat! It fits the length and width of my standard tub perfectly. It stays in place perfectly ( after following the tips from the top reviewer of this product "PHOTOGRAPHIC"  This mat has plenty of drain holes to prevent pooling of water atop the mat. The cut away for the drain area is subtle but perfectly placed. I love the thinness of this mat... it practically melds to the bottom of the tub.  I feel this mat really helps to keep my family safe while bathing.This is the old school mat... Perfectly utilitarian! I selected the teal color. It's a true teal, colorful and cheerful. It currently sells for $10.99 and I feel that is a fair price.Overall, if your looking for a basic mat ( no extra unneeded frills ) this is perfect!  They mention massaging bubbles in the description...Not really thats just the rounded areas above each suction cup.

I feel this top runs slightly small.The tag reads " Wear this piece effortlessly from the studio to the street" Im not sure about that statement. The built in bra only provides light support. I don't have a large chest but I felt this flattened  rather than flattered. I really like the black blouse overlay. It disguises my tummy well . However it makes the top a bit shapeless. Only because it's a tank I would only wear it on the street if I had a very light jacket or cardigan sweater for coverage. Here are a few other things I have noticed about this garment :* There are 4 layers of fabric in the cup area (5 if you include the removable pads)  They include1) The black mesh overlay 2) The blue fabric liner 3) The front fabric  of the bra 4) The bra liner/ pad holder /pocket / and if you include the removable pad you have # 5 !  Even though this is a tank  I felt extra warm in the garment.* The blue is more of a bright blue rather than a navy. The blue fabric lines the entire top and peaks out on each side of the keyhole racerback.* The blue fabric band at the bottom holds the top in place very well. The blue fabric band has ruching/gathering in three places... Each side and sadly DIRECTLY IN THE MIDDLE on the back.Maybe i'm reaching but it the seam seems to line up with my crack...I don't like even the suggestion of a seam in that spot.* The garment is sewn well. It looks and feels like a quality item.* The small grey Gaiam logo is subtly placed on the back lower left corner ( on the black fabric)Overall, the good out ways the bad !

Like most women I love what a day at the beach does to my hair ! I have tried almost every beach wave spray on the market. NONE exactly produces the oceans effect at home. Suave's attempt  is really good though. I got to try Tresemme's version at the same time and I give a slight edge to the Suave version. Suave's version produced a less tangled look , less frizzy and made my hair less dry.  Suave's products are always priced well so its super easy on the wallet to try a new product. Overall , I really like the effect this product produced. My hair is crispy,dry and frizzy. I applied this to towel dried hair , finger combed and air dried. I had a bit of fuzziness and my hair shrunk up a bit but overall it looked beachy!

I first want to explain that I got this printer for F R E E as a reviewer for the Amazon Vine program. I love this printer it works great and the Eco tank feature is amazing. I am not going to lie set up was a  B i T C h and a half. I had to drag out the laptop and use the INCLUDED disc to set this up. If you only have a phone,tablet or a Chromebook you MAY HAVE ISSUES getting this up and running. Adding the ink is a messy job and you will get it on you ...You have been warned ! Once set up it works great ! It produces excellent prints! I love that I can print as much as I want without having to worry about running out of ink. I wish it had screen . Without a screen this is a very basic machine. Even with limited features this is still an excellent printer and the Eco Tank feature is game changing !* If I were spending MY OWN MONEY I would spend the extra cash ( currently only $20.00 extra) to get the next model up ...The  ET-2550 ! The better model has CRUCIAL features that this model is missing!This MODEL THE ET-2500 does NOT :* Does not have a screen.This model is buttons only!* No slot to for your SD card .YOU cannot print pictures from an SD card with this model.* WiFi or USB only ! NO iPrint , NO AirPrint ! Epson has an app that you can download to your android or Apple product. You MUST go into that app to print from a tablet or phone.* No support for CHROMEBOOKS that I could find! I save my work to my google drive then pull it up the Epson app on my iPad and print from there. Yes it works but if you buy the NEXT model up it supports AirPrint and iPrint out the box.There are probably other features that it's missing read ALL of the other reviews and you will see that many mention getting the better model.I also want to mention just in case your new to the EPSON brand of printers that the brand is excellent! This is my third Epson printer and all have been great.My other two are still working great after a few years of use. I only upgraded because I was provided this one for review.

This is handheld game with the Scrabble name. You don't really play Scrabble with it. You are issued  five letters and given a time period to make as many 5 letter or less words that you can in the allotted time. You can play solo or party style with friends. In party mode you pass the game to each player.The game is really easy to figure out. You will easily be able to figure out how to set up the different modes without have to look at the directions.I am kind of lazy and i got tired of "twisting" rather quickly.I feel a modern child (used to tablets) would quickly tire of this. However an adult that loves to practice their short scrabble words this might be perfect.

I am not fan of the tube packaging. I wash my hair in the shower and I find it to be too slippery. This shampoo is just ok ...nothing special for my hair type. I have super dry,frizzy,curly hair. I have used the entire line and it does nothing special for my hair type. Also , I do not like the scent of the QUENCH line of products. The scent is DIRTY perfume like , I prefer a fresher,cleaner scent.

I wanted to love this line from Dove but sadly they really have not delivered for my hair. I had high hopes in particular for this mask because they say "intense" It's just OK for me. I have super dry,frizzy,curly hair. I need products that add moister to my hair. This product was OK nothing special. I have tried the ENTIRE line. I also do not like the scent of this line. The products in this QUENCH line have a funky ( almost dirty) perfume scent to them.

Like many other reviewers have mentioned I can't see how this a "pet" version! Anyhow this Is a lovely steamer. While have had better floor steamers ( I feel this one needs to produce more steam and I feel it leaves the floor too wet ) I love the LIFT  OFF feature ! That ONE feature alone is worth the price of admission! Here is what I love about this product !* The build quality is excellent.* The cord is super long.* The provide lots of accessories! I love do-hickeys and this one comes with tons! They provide duplicates in red and black so that you can designate one of the colors to bathroom duty! They include TWO mop heads/cover thingies.* The hand held steamer is a clean freaks dream come true ..Once you get used to the power of being able to easily and quickly get rid any funky stuck on crap you will invent new uses to whip this baby out !*  Simply A M A Z I NG on my grout...I did my entire kitchen floor one weekend with the handheld unit.* I love having two products/tools in one piece. Cuts down on the price of two separate items. I also save space with a 2 in 1 product.* The handheld is nice and lightweight...You can use it for a long time without getting tired.Here is what could be better!*The instructions could be better!  Maybe I'm stupid but I just could not figure out how the plug worked.* The floor steamer part needs to be a bit "steamy-er" I want more steam!* I find it leaves just a TINY bit too much water on my tile floor.* I wish it had a triangle head option to get in corners better.* Why do they provide a cup that holds WAY more water than the unit can handle?Overall , this is great product ! The handheld steamer is the star of the show. It elevates the entire product!

I ordered the Totes Peggy boots after trying ( and loving ) my mothers pair of Totes boots. I read the reviews here on Amazon and on S H O E B U Y dot com. Many reviews suggested going up a size. They also mentioned that the boots were narrow. I usually wear a size 6 but I ordered a size 7 wide width.  Well, they are too big for me! I should have only went up a half size and stuck with the regular width. I am keeping them because I have no other boots and it's snowing here almost daily. I kindly suggest start by going up only a half size. Maybe order two sizes and keep only the better fitting boot.Quality wise these are just OK. The Totes Peggy is a fully synthetic boot. To my eye they look a little cheap. The style is very basic. The shaft length is perfect for all but the highest of snowfall. These have the zipper down the front making them super easy to get on and off.I have wide calves and I'm still able to tuck in my pants with ease. Warmth wise they are pretty good. Only on the coldest days and when I have walked through snow have I  felt a chill in the toe area. In regular daily wear these are warm, light weight,waterproof ( so far )  and comfortable. The sole is very "grippy" on ice.Overall, these are good snow boots.

This product promises 7 days of volume. It's super easy to use. You apply it in shower after washing and conditioning. They suggest 3- 4 pumps and that you leave it on for 3 to 4 minutes then rinse. The directions state to blow dry and style as desired. When I ordered this product I was NOT aware that it required or suggested blow drying. I don't blow dry my hair as it makes my hair too brittle.I used the product as suggested on the box except I just towel dried my hair. My results have been good. I have thick hair but it's limp and dry. This product gives my hair a fuller,softer look and feel with more movement...Dare I say it has more bounce? I am pretty sure my results would be even better if I were to blow dry.Overall,this is a product worth trying.* It's reasonably priced !* It's non permanent !* It's non damaging !* Safe for color treated hair !

I just recently was given the opportunity to try this chopper. I love it ! Its well made,powerful and  super easy to operate. I live alone so the smaller capacity is perfect for me. This unit cleans up quickly and easily.Black + Decker includes a nice manual with a few great recipes. So far I have made the rotisserie chicken salad. The salad was really easy to prepare and delicious.Overall, I love the unit and I feel it would be perfect for people that do NOT need a large food processor.

I have been using this coffeemaker for about a month. I feel I can offer a review of it's performance and features.First and foremost this coffeemaker makes hot delicious coffee!The Black & Decker CM2035B 12 cup Thermal Carafe coffee maker is a large and attractive coffeemaker. This coffeemaker features brushed stainless steel on the operating panel and a brushed stainless steel insulated carafe. It also features chrome trim around the carafe plate. The rest of the coffeemaker is shiny black plastic. This coffeemaker would look especially nice in a kitchen that has stainless steel appliances.I feel this a slightly larger than average coffeemaker. The measurements are as follows:* About 13 inches tall.* About 8  inches wide across front.* Depth is about 9 inches (without accounting for the handle sticking out) because it has a "fishtail" piece at the bottom back of the machine.* The cord is about 30 inches long including the plug.***For logo conscious buyers: The Black+Decker ( yes, they use a + ) logo appears 3 times on this machine. Its imprinted in dark grey on the operating panel. It also appears in dark grey on each side of carafe. The logo imprinting is subtle and unobtrusive.Here are some of the best features of this coffeemaker:* Fresh brew timer. The machine displays the time since brewed up to 120 minutes.* The brew basket has a neat little handle that makes it super easy to remove.I also like that the brew basket can only fit in one way.* Sneak a cup feature lets you grab a cup while its still brewing. As long as you replace the carafe before 20 seconds the brew basket will not overflow.* Auto shut off ! Once the brew cycle ends the machines turns off automatically. This is great for forgetful types. I am sure you are already aware but I still want to mention this coffeemaker does NOT have  a hotplate.* The display panel is nice and big and very easy to program. The power button glows bright blue when the machine is operating.* Brew strength selector allows you to customize the flavor of your coffee with 3 different brew strengths regular, Strong and bold. I have only tried the regular but I love having the other options.* The carafe is the standout feature of this machine. Its double walled vacuumed sealed stainless steel. It looks lovely and keeps the coffee hot for a long time. It also features a great spout that does NOT drip. It also has a very wide opening for super easy and efficient cleaning.My only minor quibble is the lid to the carafe is quite finicky. I have carpel tunnel and I find it a bit hard to open. Also, the carafe lid must be perfectly aligned or coffee may run over the lid. The carafe lid is imprinted with a white graphic arrow to help with alignment. The carafe is also imprinted with white locked and unlocked graphics to assist with alignment. I just mention my difficulty with the lid in case others have dexterity issues too.Overall, i'm happy with this coffeemaker. It has an upscale look,exciting features and makes delicious coffee.

Oh my! This is a S T R O N G air freshener scent! I like the "FRESH" scent,I would describe the scent as fabric softener with a sweet perfumey undertone. I placed this near my F I V E jumbo cat litter boxes!  I am OK ( my five cats seem not to notice )with the strong scent in that area.I would suggest NOT placing this item in a bedroom. Many times in the past I have purchased similar products only to find them to be too weak. Well I got my wish ! Febreze scented oil air freshener is super strong! They promise up to 60 days of freshness...I will update!The unit comes packaged in a teal colored cardboard cradle with a peel back label. I liked how easy it was to open. Upon opening the package you can already smell the scent. When I uncapped the oils to place them in the unit the product dripped on my hands. This is a S T R O N G scent not a bad scent. The unit is larger but appears well made. I was able to plug it into my upper outlet. It does not block my lower outlet. There is a slider switch on the unit to lower or higher the scent intensity. However its poorly placed. You must unplug the unit to access the switch.I give it four stars. My only minor issues was the dripping of the oil onto my hands.

Oh those pigs! My brother is porcine lover. This book was a gift to him. We enjoyed it together. This book features beautiful pictures of rare breed. The information and stories about the pigs make this a fascinating book! I highly recommend this book if you have pig lover in your life.

I just got to try the new Unstopables scents line from Febreze. This line features stronger longer lasting scents. I selected the Shimmer scent.  The Shimmer scent is lovely. I would describe it as a feminine,sweet perfumey scent. It's not overwhelming but lingers much longer than traditional Febreze scents.  When the sprayed item or area dries the scent does soften some. I used it on a pair of sequined loafers that can't be washed but needed refreshing. It worked perfectly ! I can see this being great for refreshing coats in between dry cleanings or drapes. Febreze promises 7 days of freshness...I will update.I like the packaging ( i'm a pink lover) but the bottle is black and you can't eyeball how much is left in the container. I like the sprayer but I  do wish it dispensed less product with each squeeze.Overall, I love this new line and the Shimmer scent is fantastic !
Serving size is good but this tastes watery and bland. For the calorie and carb hit I would try something else.

I suffer with heavy periods so I take my feminine protection seriously! Stayfree is my favorite brand because they have the S O F T E S T covers. This was my first time trying their Ultra Thin Overnight with wing pads. I love them ! They are super long (11.5 inches) and wide  with TWO sets of wings <----Brilliant for night time movement! These are super thin but highly absorbent. I use two side by side for excellent overnight protection.Being so thin they work great for day time use too. If your a bigger gal these offer extra coverage.I see that a few reviews have said these have "No SCENT" The package states the pads have an odor neutralizer applied. The scent is light and fresh. It does NOT smell like a feminine hygiene product.Overall, this is a great product ! It definitely helps with heavy night time flow.

This was a gift for my porcine loving brother. He collects another brand ( one that begins with a S  ) of animal figurines. He loves it and said it's well made and highly detailed. We plan on getting more PAPO brand models.

I have two of these nozzles. I was so pleased with mine we bought Mom one. It is the best I have ever used. I use mine primarily to water my garden, including fragile plants. We bought Mom's to knock down pine needles off the roof. Sadly, her city water pressure keeps it from being successful for her roof, based on my house, it would work for that. The quality is excellent and the spray patterns are great. There are sprays for flat horizontal and for vertical. I can use these features to water underneath or between my plants so I don't get the leaves wet.

Nice shoes.Classic Clarks. I have a high arch and had would like more arch support but they are still OK. I can wear them for the day without negative effect. The toe box is roomy. I very much like that the toe is closed and yet they are still airy and sandals. I have washed them in the washing machine and dried them on VERY low heat with good success.

This is a great product. Below I have made comments on using it and on putting it down. Here is my synopsis: I have bought time, have non-herbicide weed control, a good walking surface, help amending my soil, and most impotently, I can let my perennial plants grow in without it looking yucky.  I had a 30' x 60' area that is a future cutting garden that I did not have time to cultivate well this year and was watching dreadful weeds overcome the plot. After feedback from posting a question I purchased the cloth. I smoothed out the ground (sloping) as well as I could with a 4 hp tiller and put down a couple of inches of peat. Wow. It is nice to walk on, even though the area is pretty sloped. The peat gives it a cushy feel and the cloth will help the peat lower my very high pH. I was able to plant quite a few seedlings this year and they are thriving. I did cut holes in the cloth that were about 3 to 5 times the size of the plants (most plants about 3-5 inches diameter). This allows the water to seep in and keeps it from being too hot on the plants. I LOVE the brown color. Since the plants I raised from seeds this year are still small, a lot of the cloth shows. It is not offensive. I did discover that you need good, strong ground stakes to keep it down because the fabric is so sturdy. I used Easy Gardener 815 (from Amazon). While I used a 2 pound hammer gently applied, any hammer would do. If start the stake in at an angle so that one side penetrates first it makes it a lot easier. One of the nicest things about it is that once you start your cut with scissors, you can just slide the scissors against the fabric and it cuts. Also, there is a good grain so that it cuts true without wrestling with it to get a straight cut. I was able to put the fabric down, alone, in 20 ft strips at a time in a light wind on a slope. I would not recommend this method but I was able to do it by myself.

This could be a plus or a minus depending on your soil. If your plants need an increase in alkalinity, it could be great, if you need acid, not so much. I was very excited to have all these useful trace minerals in my organic garden. Twice I used a drench method, following the directions on the package. Unfortunately, what I did not know until it happened the second time, was that it can raise the pH of your soil. A little research showed that sea water is pH 8.0-8.4. My cucumber and tomatoes, which were at pH 4.5 to 5.2  went to pH 7+ minutes after applying. It was my second application and after figuring out what happened, I realized that it had happened after the first application. I have new soil for raised beds so am monitoring and testing every day. For weeks my pH was 7.0 in nearly every bed and I was confused since I had mixed different nutrition and pH for different beds. I watered a lot and waited to see if the pH would go back down. My logic was because I have a lot of peat in the mix which should have had an effect if I could wash the salt out. After my acid loving plants started to look bad I took drastic measures to lower the pH (vinegar for immediate action with bone meal for slower release). Of course, I added $20 cost to my soil amendment. After the pHs were all in their proper ranges, my garden zoomed back off. I thought, great! It is time to add the second application of SEA-90 and wham, in just a few minutes the pH was back up. I assume my vegetables have benefited from the SEA-90, and I will too since it is probably healthier food, but it has been a battle for me since we need more acid in our soil.

This is one of the few books written though a teen-age eyes that does not sound like a "dumbed down" adult. The writing style was consistent across the characters. The historical setting was interesting and was historically accurate.

My "yard" is almost 300 feet long and 200 feet wide. We generally use xeric methods but when we have dry periods or are trying to start new plants, we use irrigation. I have these hoses in series of 2 100's plus a 50' or 75' and never have any problems with them. They were emptied but stored outside last winter and were just great this spring. One of them got cut by a snow plow but I was able to repair it in a snap using the Gardena hose repair kit. The most important thing to say about these hoses is that they are so no-kink I had forgotten what a pain hoses were. I recently purchased some for potable water (these are not) and by golly, hoses kink! These don't.

I have given this product 3 stars but wish there was a way to give it 1 star for some people and 5 stars for others. My rational follows a characteristic other reviewers have noted. If you have your square foot garden sectioned off, this stamp won't fit. If you use it to designate your squares, it is perfect. The product is sturdy and attractive. The handle is large and should be easy for both little hands (children) and older, less steady hands. I returned the stamp because it would not fit in my sectioned beds which are about 11 1/2" x 11 1/2" due to the section markers and to my irrigation system (Which I love, see The Garden Grid - 4x4).

Ah, being able to get water where you actually need it. I love these distributors. I have multiple raised beds in my vegetable garden and was having trouble with water distribution across the beds. I had the perennially present problem of a lot of water in the first bed and no water in the last. Using this products valves I have adjusted each hose so that the right amount of water goes to each bed. I can even keep some beds wetter and some dryer. My well has good water pressure so I am irrigating 7 beds at a time. At my bib I have an Orbit timer that has one timed outlet and one for "regular use." Below the timer I have a Gardena Y splitter (see Gardena 36938 Garden Hose Y-Valve With Quick Connector) with one 5/8 inch hose going to the center of each cluster of beds. That is the location of this four channel water distributor. From this distributor I have a 1/2" hose running to each bed. I use the valves to control the amount of water into each bed. Because it is distributed by the device rather than gravity, water gets to all of the beds. As a side comment, the Y splitter gives me the same benefits. The left side of my garden has smaller beds than the right. I send 2/3 of the water to the right four channel distributor and 1/3 to the left. Total control!

These are my very, very favorite plant labels. I have used the slender ones and even the expensive metal ones. These are easy to write on because they are a larger size. This year I used an electric label maker and they looked extra-tidy. I use them to mark sections of vegetables in my raised bed garden and, silly me, when I see them all standing there it makes me feel happy that my garden is so tidy. Because they do show so nicely, they are not the labels for no-show tucking into plants so you don't forget what you have. I don't use them in some of my flower gardens as they detract from the natural look of the flowers.

I like these pots immensely. Because of their shape I can get 3-5 more pots into a flat than I can round ones. Their plastic is very thin. Usually a pot this thin would be considered disposable but since I am growing seedlings for my own garden, I take care and they are not disposable. I assume they will make it two seasons. I have re-used many of them at this point and they are doing just great. I can squeeze the lower end of the pot to help keep roots in tact for transplant but they are strong enough around the rim that they don't collapse. They are well priced and the thin plastic, reused, makes me feel more ecologically aware. They are just right for me.

I think more than I should about "where my soil has been". Consequently, I always wonder when I buy "organic" animal compost if the original animals were fed antibiotics. It is pretty easy for me to assume that a company who produces organic compost would not use GMO methods, it is still pretty common for animal producers to use antibiotics like ivermectin. I am grateful for antibiotics, their usefulness in treating illnesses is unmeasurable in my opinion. However, to me, adding them (or their byproduct) to our diet when they are not indicated for sickness seems inappropriate. Hence, I was tickled pink to find Charlie's Compost. They actually thought about whether or not their customers cared to know. I added it to my raised bed soil and while I cannot claim huge production increases, I can say I am very happy with the fertilizers that will go into my family's tummies!

I was very excited to use these in my garden. I found that they are OK but not as exciting as I expected. Their diameter is somewhat stronger than the clip will bear weight-wise. I am training vegetables to grow vertically and these are too big in diameter for early season use when plants are smaller. They will fit stronger stems well but I am concerned that they will be too light-weight for crops if you have strong production. As a side note that applies to those who, like me, don't have strong finger control anymore, I found that they tend to slip sideways in my fingers when I try to use the clip handle side to them.

I planted these in my raised garden bed with 60 degree soil temperature. They emerged in seedling stage in just a couple of days. I have a very high germination rate. I don't yet know how they will grow to maturity but I expect they will be vigorous plants. I will return with an update as the summer progresses.

If you like predictable "will they ever get together" love stories you might like this. There are a couple of extremely written pages but overall it is a standard romance. I did like that the characters interacted with each other without it being a bodice ripper. Chaste is too strong a word but this is one you could give your grandmother to read without being embarrassed!

I recently did a whole lot of DIY work on my house and guarded my oft-used #2 bits since buying them individually or in packages is expensive. When I found this package, at a really reasonable price, I popped one in each of my drills and drilled with abandon. I have them in Bosch and Porter Cable drill-drivers and the bits work well in each.

This is an interesting read with an interesting concept but it falls flat on its face at the end. I actually looked to see if I had lost some pages. It is not a cliff-hanger but more a fall on your face ending. The descriptions of the Scottish areas where the story takes place are evocative and reminded me of my travels in the area without rousing any "what!?" responses.

I wear a large to extra large hat (7 1/4) and this fits snugly. It is not too snug but close. I really enjoy the ease with which I can pop it on. I used to use bandanas when I was working in the garden but this works well and is easier

A fun book for looking at flowers and history together. We have used it for family reading and it is interesting to have the vignettes of how the flowers were identified and cataloged by Lewis and Clark. The book is organized by sections of the route. There are introductions to each section that tell important parts of the expedition story. Each flower has a 2 -5 sentence discussion of how the Expedition perceived the plant.

I have had several of these and they are all dependable. It is important to note with this particular 3 outlet model you have a timer on only two of the outlets. The third is for manual watering. There is a small lever on the left side that allows you to open the outlet and use it like a regular spigot. I like the feature a lot. The models that have timers on each spigot are baffling to use for a regular hose. I used to solve this problem by putting a Y splitter with shut off valves. What is nice about this one is that you don't end up with the spaghetti of valves and hoses just to get your garden hose to give you water on command. The down side is that you have a trio size with just two timers on it. If I needed two timers, I would definitely get this model over a two outlet timer. The difference in cost is about the same as adding a Y splitter.

Like others, I purchased this system primary for the mats. The trays have cracked but I have done three rounds of seedlings this year. The condensation in the top builds as it should but to get the top off without the water running down the sides onto the floor or table you have to wisk it off at an angle. I got good at it but would have preferred not to have to. It was a good set-up for one year but I am not sure it would hold up for several seasons. The mats will.

Such a lovely venerable book! The paper is heavy and glossy with gorgeous color printing. It is heavy and I am reminded turning its pages why e-readers are wonderful but will never actually replace books. The information is very useful and straightforward. Hamilton presents multiple planting methods and sidebars with useful information. I am glad I found this book and took the chance of ordering a used copy. Even if it is not your gardening Bible (but it could be) it is a heartening book.

I have small pieces rebar holding up part of a retaining wall where no one is likely ever to actually be but I still did not like it being bare. This is not OSHA approved to prevent puncture wounds but it does provide a cap that I think could slow down a problem. An added benefit I had not expected is that I can tell if my wall is sagging by the angle of the caps. Thankfully I only had that happen once. Now I look at them and am reassured that all is well if all is level.

What can I say. The venerable tenax deer fence fenced out my deer just as it is supposed to and does successfully for so many people. I had a lighter weight similar fence before but I knew Bambi would not stay on the other side of it once my garden produce appeared. I bought this for the 600 lb test. It is not as "invisible" as I would desire but it really is not visible at a distance. I have mine anchored to trees and an arbor that is the entrance to my garden so it fits into the environment without tall poles. When I look at it from the road you cannot see the fence. When I am inside of the garden I can see that I am in a fence. Still, the view is nice. We have bear as well as deer and I joke that the tenax is strong enough to keep the deer out and strong enough that I would have just enough time to holler really loud if a bear wanted in.

These are nifty. I like that one side is flat. I use them in raised garden beds and they fit snugly up against the wall of the bed. I also found that they were perfectly sized to hold down in-bed irrigation hoses. The one thing to note is that they are not terribly long. Even though I knew they were 5" it did not really sink in that they were 5". If you have a fluffy/less dense soil in your raised bed they might not be long enough to hold. I have a lot of peat in my soil and they are barely long enough.

A decent intro to companion planting. This book does a good job introducing the topic and is appropriate for many hobby gardeners. For more in depth information see the venerable "Carrots Love Tomatoes" by Louise Riotte.

I like that this soil is OMRI (officially listed as approved for organic gardening). It has a nice fine texture and holds moisture extremely well. It is also very nice that it is on Prime. It arrives quickly and is less expensive than I can find it locally.

This story is set in 1676 immediately following King Phillip's War in which the Native Americans of what the English called New England nearly routed the English. While ultimately defeated, King Philip and his army of Native warriors nearly routed the English from the "New World". A key part of the story is a captivity narrative written by the character Prudence Cotton. I am married to an historian of this period and he was able to confirm for me the historical accuracy of the story. While the names are changed around, many of the descriptions of the places and encounters between the Native and English people are well described. The historical details are merged from the time frame up to the early 1700s, the book does give a good picture of the time and of the types of events and interactions that might have occurred within a "Good" Puritan family. I did not give the book five stars because, while well written, it is not as compelling written as it might be, for example, as compared to "The Historian" by Elizabeth Kostova. There are some similarities in one writing characteristic in that both authors select interesting words that are historically correct to the time of the book and not in current common use. Kostova's ability to weave the meaning of the words into the story exceeds Wallace's. Nonetheless, you won't be left wondering what the author meant by the word. All in all a good read but not a high-literature one.

If you are looking for what I think of as a "point and pick" field guide, one where you match a photo to a plant, this is not it. However, if you already know or if you are willing to use the information in the book to learn some basic plant morphology (eg leaf shapes, types of roots, petals, etc.) then you can find your way though without truly getting lost. The book depends on the reader's knowledge of the plants to navigate to the correct family of plants and start to narrow down to the specific plant. There are many useful sketches and some photographs but not every entry has a sketch or photo.. It is not a professional-level guide but if you are not interested in taking time to learn about plants and how to use the book you might want to pick a different book. The reason that selected this book is because it includes trees and shrubs, not just flowers as so many books do. I find it is a good companion to the "point and pick" plant photo guides. Once you have your basic identification of the plant you can read about it in this book.

I bought these because I needed a lot of 4 inch pots to transplant my seedlings sooner than I expected. This was available and was reasonably cheap. They have been satisfactory. They are middle-thick plastic, not flexible but also not a pot for long-term use. I expect I can use these for transplant pots for several seasons before they wear out. The reason I don't give them more stars is the number and size of the holes in the pot. On the one hand it is nice to have a lot of holes, and ones that go up the side of the pot, to allow water to penetrate from a drip pan below. However, they are also sufficiently large that the germination matter seeps out of the pot leaving a dirty mess on my seed trays. I can clean it up but when I look at the expensive dirt floating in my tray I cannot help but think "That is enough to germinate more seeds in!" This is not enough to keep me from being happy with the pots but it is enough to make me consider other models.

This is far nicer than I expected for the price. I was hesitant to order it expecting it would be wobbly and frail based on the price but based on the reviews I took a chance. I am glad I did. It was very easy to set up. Not possible to get things put in the wrong place as long as the poles lengths are sorted. There is only one type of brace and it can only go in one direction. There are three types of poles, short ones that go up, long ones that go across and arched ones that go on the top.  Each pair of braces gets three long poles horizontally and 4 short poles going up to the next level (shelf). The wire shelves have about a 60 degree bend on each side making it sit more securely on the shelf. It was sturdy for my seedlings could be strengthened, as one reviewer suggested, by using zip ties to secure the shelves to the braces. The plastic cover is sturdy. The zipper is well sewn and the ties to attach the plastic tent to the frame are long enough to tie without a struggle. I was able to put the entire shelf, with cover, together in under 15 minutes. My seedlings seem to be happier inside where the temperature has risen to 70 in just two hours from my chilly Springtime-in-the-Rockies 63 degrees house. I plan to put this greenhouse outside on my South facing deck but can tell already it could get very warm inside so I will plan to stay attentive.

I used this for a temporary closet during a building project. It holds a lot more weight than it first appears. After 6 months of hard use it is retired but could have continued for longer. Under normal use I think it would last a long time.

I cannot believe that I am happy to wear this respirator. I never thought I would reach with a positive feeling for a mask like this. However, it works so well and fits so nicely that I am glad to use it. I have used other respirators because I *needed* to use them but always dreaded puting them on. This one I use with ease and don't dread putting on. Because it is so easy to use and fits well I think I have been better at using it when I need compared to other masks. I have done a lot of work in the past 6 months and this has been a good companion.

This is an amazing screen for the price. I needed a screen for short term use and did not want to spend a lot of money on it. This screen filled the bill. I still use it for different purposes. It makes a great curtain for large hard-to-cover windows. I also have used it to shield the kitchen from view in my open concept house when I did not want my guests to eat at my dining table and look at my dirty pots at the same time.

This is one of those things you can live a lifetime without but when you have you wondered why you did not have it before. I have always heated my lids for canning by putting them in a pot and then fishing them out with a magnet. I still use my magnet but plucking them out of this rack is much easier, faster and safer. It is a luxury item when considered from the perspective of what you need to can but it is a luxury I like very much.

My family enjoyed this game and got a lot of laughter from its prompts. Some games like this have uncomfortable questions or ones that can put some players in a bad light. The cue card questions for this game are broad and every die toss has at least two questions to pick from. If a question might be uncomfortable because of some players personal history you just chose one of the other questions presented. We played with four people and the game was long enough to be fun but short enough not to become tedious.

My front steps are fir and receive a lot of snow. Shoveling is both difficult because the shovel sticks on the wood and insufficient because of the volume of snow we get. I am not a fan of using snow melts but I wanted to use my stairs during the winter. I have had good success with judicious shoveling and this ice melter. On its first application I used a larger amount than on subsequent applications. I think having the thicker layer is helping subsequent snows and applications of Safe Paw to work better. Of course my dog likes this brand better since it does not get stuck in her paws.

This is a great idea and a great design but the materials fall short. I returned mine because the wood split when I tightened the bolts to hold the stool together. If the materials were just a little higher quality this would be a truly great stool.

This is a pretty cool thermometer. I bought it to keep up with the temperature of the exact place where I was smoking meat rather than getting a generalized reading of my covered grill. It is sturdy and functional. The little wires that sit above the thermometer body stay amazingly cool. It is not a fast changing thermometer. I took it off of the grill to cool it down some and to move it to check the temperature at another location. The air temperature was 34 degrees but after a few minutes it still had not started to drop from the grill temperature (250 degrees). I put it on a few ice cubes to reduce the temperature but even that took a couple of minutes. I was happy with how it worked.

I purchased these at the recommendation of a reviewer to hang lightweight photos on foam backing. They held well but there is almost no margin of error to get the picture to hang straight. The anchor hole comes to a single peak at the top. When placed on a nail it is a pyramid. There is one apex and that is it. If you have the hanger aligned left to right and top to bottom the picture hangs straight. If you are off-centered, the picture hangs crooked. You can make very slight adjustments but not much. Careful measuring is critical to get things to hang straight.

I purchased these boots to put at the back door for taking the dog  out on quick trips, shoveling a short distance and all those other little things one dashes out the door and right back in. I like that they are large because I can just slip my foot in even if they are tied. They are not sturdy enough for serious winter wear. The sole is good but the upper fabric is very flexible offering very little support. When I pull the laces so tight the eyelets meet each other the boot is still loose around my ankle and lower leg. Typically boots are snug in that area on me.
This does what it is designed to do. The grip is better than I expected but the blade is less quality than I had hoped.

I returned these shoes as they were smaller than I expected. The shoe is cute and well made. I wanted to keep them but the drop on the top of the boot from the ankle to the toe was too sharp and caused pressure on the top of my toenails. I think if they fit they would be excellent boots.

Yes, Virginia, you can saw a straight line. I do a lot of DIY projects and rely heavily on a jigsaw. I had sadly come to the conclusion that I just could not cut a straight line and would always have to compensate for going off course in the last could of inches. When I got this saw I found that I could cut a straight line. With my old saw (a highly rated but less expensive one) as I neared the end of the cut the blade bent slightly and the cut curved. With the Makita saw the same pressure does not push the saw off course. I am in love with this saw. It has a variable speed adjustment that goes from full steam ahead to a stroke speed about the same as a fast hand saw. The blade sets well into the housing and it is impossible to get it wrong. It does require a tool to change but the tool is housed on the back of the saw. The clear plastic dust housing works very well. I did have to adjust my technique since you cannot see the saw blade itself with the housing down. The guide mark is very clear and I was successful in learning to use it rather than watching the blade. The case it comes in is extremely sturdy. It slips into narrow spaces and will sit upright on its own. I could not be happier although my sander is a bit sad since it is not always in use smoothing out that last couple of inches of bad cut.

I live in Montana and we have cold, snowy winters. It is hard to find a good pair of boots at a moderate price that are weatherproof and actually function as shoes. These boots are great. They are flexible enough that you can actually walk in them and they are thick and insulated enough to really make a difference in cold weather. The instep might be too high for some but I like the support. The height comes from how the boot wraps around the foot, not just the foot bed. My foot feels secure in the shoe. I don't worry if I step into snow whether or not my foot will wobble in the shoe. It won't. The ribbed tread is good. I would prefer a bit more depth and pattern but these seem to work well enough. I have not encountered the classic situation when the ground is slick and your foot slips sideways. In this tread it all runs one way so it might slip more easily than a different design. That said, I do like these boots very much and am really happy to have them.UPDATE: Used these in show shoes to deal with the aftermath of a 3 ft snowfall and my feet stayed warm and dry through several consecutive days of use. If there were 6 stars I would give them 6, the 6th for my toasty dry feet :-).

We purchased 8 packages of these at a local box store where they were seriously on sale. Every single package of them flickers. I thought I was seeing things but asked other people if they saw it, without prompting them, and most of the people could see the very slight flicker. It is much less obvious but akin to a florescent light when the bulb is not quite sitting right in the connecter. I really liked the design so I was very sad we could not use them where people were like around the Christmas tree. I saw that other reviewers comment on the same problem and that un-bunching them helped. If you have a lot of lights on the tree it is easy for them to get close together and then the flicker is present again. We ended up using them outside since taking them back was not an option. I liked very much the idea of white or colored lights as some in our family like white and others colored and we could change the color without having to change the tree lights.

This is my third Lucid mattress. Between purchasing the first and second I bought a very expensive name mattress. I think it will wear better across time but it certainly is not 10 times better, even though it cost 10 times more. Knowing what I know now I think I would stick to these mattresses! The one thing that makes me a little crazy and seems typical to memory foam is that the cover and the sheets loose their taunt fit after a night or two due to the soft sided structure of the mattresses. Our Lucid mattresses seem a little more resilient. Given the price I cannot say enough good things about these mattresses.

I like the way these feel. I wanted a supportive slipper that was not hard feeling. Even after a couple of months of wear the insole is cushy and not packed down. Sadly, the stitches around the edge where the top and bottom are joined are coming lose on both shoes. I mend them as I can and continue to wear them but I expected a better wear from them.

Yum. I had given up believing that the mythical "decaffeinated black tea" existed. I have found the unicorn. I drink a lot of tea so am clear that different teas have different flavors. Had I not known that Barry's was decaffeinated I would not have guessed. It is a very pleasant black tea that holds up well to the cup before bed even if you put milk in it. I am just thrilled to have found this tea. Kudos again to Amazon reviewers who gave me good information about the type of flavor of this tea and helped me decide to try it.

I have a number of LinenSpa products including mattresses and protectors. I am a fanatical researcher before I make purchases. Whenever I need a product related to bedding I just go look at the LinenSpa products and get what I need. I have come to trust their brand and don't feel the need to do any comparison shopping. The company is great and the products reliable. This cover is a good protector. It is not a "plump" mattress cover that adds to the softness of the bed. I use it with the LinenSpa memory foam beds since they have a good surface of their own that I don't want to subtract from.

After nearly a year of sometimes crippling pain and multiple shoe/orthotic combinations I am pain free. This is my third round with plantar fasciitis in the past 25 years so I understand that one product is not perfect for every person but I do like this one. It is different because the back of the orthotic is solid. At first I did not think I would like it but after wearing it a couple of days it and my feet got adjusted to each other and I like the almost solid support from just before the heel through the back of the orthotic. I used it for sports applications as indicated and was thrilled with not only the reduction of pain but at the healing that was taking place. I decided to use it in some of my other sturdier regular shoes and it has performed admirably there too. It is thick so my heels rise up out of less "sturdy" shoes and sometimes I have to pick a different shoe or use a different orthotic but this one is a lot more versatile than I expected. It is expensive but worth every penny to me. I am ordering a second pair since I have been carrying my one pair to every shoe I wear--from slippers to day shoes to hiking boots to mud boots.

I put this in the cabinet by the stove that holds things like salt and oil and pan spray, etc. I love it there. It saves my rummaging around looking for things and it keeps me from knocking things over. I give it four rather than three stars since the tiers are a little shallower than I would like. It fits neatly in a 12 inch deep over counter cabinet leaving room for one more row in front of its three tiers. I presume that is why the tier depth is as it is. However, for me, I would like a little more depth to make it easier to grab stuff even if I lost the fourth row in the front. Regardless, I am very happy that I have this handy organizer.

I discovered this tea a few years ago on a hiking trip to Scotland. The tea was bracing, delicious and always made a nice clear cup of tea. I brought some home with us and used it guardedly hoping not to run out. I was not sure what made it blended for "Scottish water" but enjoyed it as a reminder of our trips to Scotland. I discovered that it is especially blended for hard water. I was delighted to find that I could buy the tea on Amazon and also found that it is especially blended for hard water. We have exceedingly hard water from our well so it is perfect for us. If you like strong tea that develops robust tannins when steeped longer, this is one for you. If you like a lighter tea, you probably won't like it as much. I experimented with a shorter brewing time and it just does not develop the rich flavor of the stronger tea. If you like tea with milk this is perfect since you get a strong tea that does not disappear with a healthy dose of milk.

Wow. I had no idea there was anything out there like this product. I am looking for stuff to repair now. I purchased it at the recommendation of a bathtub company to repair my new soaker tub that got damaged. The repair is not gorgeous but I am confident that it won't ever leak. It was fun to use too. I am so happy I found it. I was surprised and pleased that it can be used to repair many other materials including wood, stone and concrete.

We purchased this dryer primarily to preserve fruit. It does a good job but is quite loud. I did not measure this with a decibel monitor but based on advertised db for dishwashers I would think this is in the mid to upper 40 db. You can talk to another person while it is going but you can also hear the fan if you are a room away. It is not so loud you would have to raise your voice to be heard but we did avoid turning it on when we were in the kitchen or nearby areas.

Because it was so cheap, I ordered this on a whim to delight a teen age'r who was coming to visit. The quality is about what you would expect for the price. It is very lightweight and made of plastic but is acceptable for low-end shower head quality. However, its function was the most interesting thing. Rather than chromotherapy it turned out be be disco therapy. Since I remember Disco Dancing when it was just released when I installed it (just unscrew the old shower head and screw this one on) it was all I could do to keep from falling in the tub laughing. I sent my spouse in to look at it later that night and he burst out laughing too. While it was fun for a minute, I think the lights change too fast to actually take a shower for most people. I am glad it was very cheap since it turned out to be more like a gag joke rather than a fun shower head.

These are a quick and easy way to attach table legs and an apron (skirt) to the table top. They are not for making fine furniture but they work well for repairing or building a modest table. In the way of tools, a screw driver was all that is absolutely necessary. A drill would make your life a lot easier. I did use a carpenter square and a level but you could get a decent result without them if you were careful. Do note that it does not come with screws or bolts.

I never understood the value of a leader hose until I needed one. This is an excellent quality product that has saved time and effort for me. It has a nice firm but easy to turn seal to the faucet and the hose. The hose material is flexible but sturdy. I use it to link my single water faucet located on my deck to an irrigation timer for my garden. I drilled a hole directly under the spigot on my deck, put a quick connect coupler on the hose and dropped it through and attached the timer. If I need to use the spigot that is located on the deck I just uncouple it. What seems like a simple thing was hard with a lesser quality hose. Now, I don't have to fuss with the hose but I do have to remember to hold on to it when I uncouple it or down the hole into the garden it goes :-)

I have used this topcoat and its 30 year ago predecessor on many pieces of furniture. Even though there are toxic issues to deal with, it simply outperforms any water-based product I have used. Compared to water-based products this is a snap to apply. I rag it on and wipe off the excess behind me. I don't have to worry about streaks, bubbles or any other problems common with top-coats. I recently finished almost a whole house full of used and unfinished furniture and used General Finishes products on almost all of it. I tried several other products available from box stores and one specialty store and was frustrated with imperfections to out right errors in my finishes. I sanded them all down and started over with General Finishes stains and this top coat and cannot be happier with the ease of use or the function of the product in use. I have a nice table in our kitchen that has about 10 coats on it.  No worries if someone deposits a jar of jam on it, a little soap and water on a sponge and it is as if nothing happened. Putting 10 coats on is really not that hard when all you have to do is wipe with one rag and follow behind with a clean cloth to take off the excess. It dries relatively fast, a few hours to a day depending on the weather so you can get 1 to 3 coats on in a day. Its viscosity makes it easy to move from the can to the wood since it does not slop or drip easily.

I have used these in 6 toilets in two different houses with hard water and do think they make a difference. I particularly like that they are unobtrusive (e.g. no blue water) and that they last forever. They don't substitute for cleaning your bowl but they make cleaning easier.

I am giving this three stars because it works OK but it is just a bit wobbly and shorter than I would like. I think if it fits snugly in the space you want to divide into two shelves it would work better than sitting free in a cabinet. I did not pay close enough attention to the height and found that some things like a slightly large mug, won't fit under it. I am using it and expect it to last since it is well made but I would not buy another one.

"Bird Dog, this is Bat-21!" I remember having seen the movie that was based on this book in the 1980's and ran across this book while browsing here on Amazon and bought it. Glad I did.This is the story of the ordeal Iceal Hambleton, a Lt. Colonel in the USAF, who was navigator of an EB-66 electronic warfare aircraft shot down during the 1972 North Vietnam offensive. Hambleton, the lone survivor of his aircraft, parachuted into the midst of the NVA invasion of the south.The Air Force and Hambleton began a physical and mental battle with the NVA who they had a grudging respect for. For twelve days, the US military both kept the communist Vietnamese from capturing Hambleton and planned a method of getting Hambleton out. Men died in the attempt to rescue Hambleton as jets, prop-driven aircraft as well as helicopters were employed to fight to keep Hambleton from the clutches of the NVA and some were lost in the attempt.As a military history reader, I was impressed by the efficiency of USAF SAR (Search and Rescue) methods. "Gravel" was a weapon and technique I had never heard of. The use of "Sandies", jets, helicopters and small observation aircraft flown by FACs, or Forward Air Controllers, - even B-52s - all combined to keep the NVA back on their heels while Hambleton made his escape.As a reader of adventure stories, I enjoyed the blood-and-guts story from Hambleton's point-of-view as he endured thirst, hunger, exhaustion and fear  as he had to not only keep himself alive, but travel in the dead of night in an alien environment, surrounded by enemy territory and hundreds of enemy soldiers. All these enemy soldiers had but one task - capture him!This isn't a long book, but it's a good one! the author explains that he had to alter a number of aspects of the story because many of the USAF's techniques are still classified. But, the author weaves a fine tale while changing only the minimum. This is a five star book that I enjoyed immensely.

These wipes are the acme of paper wipes. I have used them in the garage, the car, the truck, the tractor. They are supremely absorbent for a paper product. They will soak up - and hold - a wide range of fluids. But, at their price, are they really a better product than the old-fashioned "shop towels"? At this point, I'd stick with shop towels from a cleaning service. I know these wipes are made from recycled materials, but a good shop towel will last years. I can see including these in a haz-mat spill kit or for similar applications because they are meant to be discarded. Another place where they could be used would be medical facility cleaning and for the same reason.In short, with the exceptions of a few applications, this is a three-star product in my book.

John McGrath gives us, in "John Barry: An American Hero in the Age of Sail", not only a biography, but insight into times and places long past. Anyone who loves a good story, well written will like this book.The author gives us a lot more than a biography. It begins in poverty in Ireland where evidence of John Barry's life is sketchy at best but gives us the spirit of the times and the circumstances that push a young man to the hard life on the sea. John Barry's life is well chronicled in this book including his public and private life, his battles in war and in peace, his struggles with wind and wave, profit and loss, surly crews, enemy ships and his own often ineffectual government.We are introduced to his world: his wives (one died young), his friends and business partners his relationships with his family and in-laws (some of whom were loyalists). He seemed to have a good relationship with Robert Morris, the "financier of the Revolution". The book shows the personal side of the man who captained merchantmen and ships of war and provides the reader with a complete view of the man.The meat of the action is his service during the American Revolution where the infant Continental Navy was overmatched by the Royal Navy. Barry showed himself a cunning captain and a fighter. Later in life, he learned to be a good administrator and business man. I liked this book not only for the biographical and military history aspects, but also for learning what life was like on the Philadelphia waterfront, what it took to learn the trade of the sailor and captain, what China and the China trade was like.This is a first-rate book about an American hero that may have been forgotten, but gets his due in this volume. I recommend it with five stars.

I think this is a nice set. Whether "his and hers", parent and child or ???, it's a good set of electric toothbrushes.This is not a "batteries not included" product. they are not only included, but already installed - a nice touch. There's a replacement brush for each unit. The box says they should be replaced every three months so I think the two replacement brushes increase the value of this set. The brushes themselves are divided into two parts: a spinning brush at the end with a reciprocating brush directly behind it.
