Lot's of acoustic guitar to accompany Maria's vocals throughout the recognized  songs of Chambao. The difference is that the beats are very much unlike the originals; including the phrasing on the vocals. "Ahi Estas" is an example of how the basic structure of the song is there but it just takes a new form; that form is evolutionary Chambao. The songs never quite heat up to the Flamenco fusion frenzy achieved on their other discs but this is still cool stuff. Their classic song "Poquito a Poquio" showcases Maria at her finest with just the basic instruments in a soft seduction. If you're a fan of Chambao this belongs in your collection of Chambao chill out music. Recommended for those that love the new face of  Flamenco.

What superlatives to say that haven't already been said about this disc. It is spectacular in a word. I love the voice of Concha Buika and feel she is a unique talent; paired with one of giants of Latin jazz,  Cuban pianist, bandleader, composer and arranger Chucho Valdez and you have an instant classic. If you're looking for Buika to be exactly like she was on other solo projects you're going to instead how diverse her talents are. There are so many good songs but an example how the master Chucho Valdez can take a classic  Mexican song , originally by Jose Alfredo Jimenez, 100 Clasicas 1  Las 100 Clasicas Vol. 2 " Las Ciudades"  and transform it into an  outstanding tune hardly recognized  from the original song. It becomes a  jazzy song that sounds like it should be emanating from a dark smoky caf where Concha is belting out the vocals; "El Rey" Jose Alfredo Jimenez would be proud of the metamorphosis of his song. Ditto for " Cruz de Olvido" and the many other Jose Alfredo Jimenez compositions Y Sigo Siendo El Rey : Deluxe Edition 3CD+DVD+LIBRO. I could go on and on but just go out and get this most excellent disc, you will love the pairing of Concha Buika and Chucho Valdez.

I was unsure if I would like this disc as I had a bit of a prejudice remembering her late great father's entry into singing Spanish songs on Cole Espanol. I enjoyed the samples I listened to first I so bought it. I was not disappointed at all. This is not an easy undertaking, especially considering she is not a native speaker and will always be unfairly compared to her father and for that reason and coupled with the music give her 5 stars. Her father, Nat King Cole knocked it out of the park with his smoky, velvety rendition of "Acerca te Mas"  originally on vinyl but on a modern compilation entitled Mis Mejores Canciones - 19 Super Exitos  and when they pair up on this song it is joyful to hear. Through the magic of mixing her father's version and her own the result is not unlike their pairing on the song "Unforgettable" from Unforgettable. Natalie's voice compliments her father's and to my ears defers to her father's greatness and memory. She is subdued as though to not out "Cole" him. By contrast her voice soars on "Manana de Carnaval" as she returns to form highlighting her talents on a song that is part samba part jazz , equal parts soothing vocals by Natalie; it's a very nice entry. "Quizas Quizas Quizas" is flawless in terms of delivering a song that sounds like it is from a different era with it's big band  Cha Cha Cha background laying the path for Natalie Cole. "Oye Como Va" originally by Tito Puente Oye Como Va: Dance Collection but made popular by Santana Abraxas  is a nice entry that is a dance floor song that allows Natalie Cole to improvise her style  to the song; she reminds me of Gloria Esteban on this dance track. A very nice romantic song entitled " Bachata Rosa," a signature song by Jose Luis Guerra is quite amazing as she sounds so relaxed and genuine in her Spanish. All in all it is a very good disc that belongs in your Spanish music collection to be filled under Cole en Espanol. I would recommend this disc to anyone who likes Spanish music with a twist; a Cole family tradition, in  Espanol.

I love Chambao and have been a distant fan for many years. As far as I know they don't come to the United States to play. Considering the health issues the lovely Maria has had to endure it is understandable. I'm just glad she's able to continue giving her gift of music to the world with her passion and lovely voice. I have most everything that has been released stateside and this is a great addition to their wonderful discography. The songs on this disc are a little different from those we have come to expect from Chambao. It is very mellow which is not to say the others discs are not but this is Flamenco chill iced, the subtleties and nuances Chambao fans have come to expect are all there but layered on a lower level which makes for an even more seductive musical experience. If you can't get enough of Chambao and want to hear something slightly different from the previous discs than give this disc a try. It is not a rehash of their previous material or a greatest hits or best of collection it is just fresh music that has been part of their 10 anos evolution. The disc is such that it can be played over and over and you will not get tired of it. Some excellent songs include the "Instinto Humano" that has elements of light rap intertwined with Maria's vocals that draws you in and doesn't let you go until the song is over; then sucks you in again. "Pasta Pa La Costa" is a nice reggae back beat oriented mix that is fusion at it's finest transcending borders and genres. Reall yall the sons are very cool and brin another light to your perception of Chambao; it's a super disc that will not disappoint Chambao fans.  Chambao at it's mellowest with light airy vibes that heat up with flamenco guitar fret work that sizzles as Maria's voice takes you soaring on an Andalusian  voyage that will bring the Spanish music to you. The instrumental and electronic work is hypnotizing and magical; it is a fusion of dance and flamenco that has evolved from ancestral villages to the modern era. It is Earthy and spicy at once; like fine Spanish Tempranillo and tasty tapas the merging and marriage of styles and flavors creates a perfect accompaniment to a good night. Highly recommended for fans of Chambao and Flamenco fusion.

First and foremost I loved this book and think that you will too. Through the years I've read quite a few books , both in Spanish and English on the tragic and tumultuous life of Mexican artist Frida Kahlo. I considered myself somewhat of a Kahlophile at one point in my life and have read nearly every book written about her including her poignant and revealing  The Diary of Frida Kahlo: An Intimate Self-Portrait. I've also read what is  considered by many to be the definitive biography on Frida Kahlo  Frida: A Biography of Frida Kahlo and by the same author Frida Kahlo: The Paintings , amongst many others. So how does this book hold up against he plethora of books written about Frida ?  I found this book to do more than an adequate job, actually it is an outstanding addition on the abundance of books available. Given the brevity of the book and the fact that it is not a biography on Frida but rather an overview of her life and that of her husband, the great Mexican master artist , Diego Rivera. The book is ambitious and delivers an insightful perspective that is full of photographs that compliment the narration and bring to life the lives of Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera. The fact that Rivera and Kahlo's lives were inextricably linked makes the  brief overview both easy and a challenge for the author. Coupled with that the book is intended for a younger audience, quite possibly with little knowledge of these two giants of Mexican art, the author Catherine Reef was faced with a daunting task. She makes the book entertaining with anecdotes and a real life experiences for the reader. The mixture of direct quotes by the artists and the author's master full storytelling makes for an enjoyable read. Although intended for the younger audience, the book should not be limited to high school readers. The book can be used for middle school readers and without a doubt the adult. For the adult or advanced young reader this book can be read in one session as it is very enthralling and the lives of Rivera and Kahlo come dramatically to life. I found myself wanting to read more and more of the book , reacquainting myself with their most interesting lives, knowing that this beautiful union of lives would inevitably wind to a conclusion This is an excellent book that takes the reader on a roller coaster ride not unlike the lives of Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera. It is a satisfying experience for the for the initiated reader and those without any knowledge of Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera. Teacher's, students and Kahlophiles will find this book to be very pleasing. Artists and those with an interest in Mexican art will especially be satisfied. Highly  recommended for readers of all ages from middle school on, this book is a must for the public, school or private library. Read it you'll like it.

The concept is simple enough. A plastic bag similar to the one's we have all used to marinate foods, probably made by Ziploc as well but with a twist. These bags are designed specifically for marinating and they are an outstanding product for this purpose. The fact that they stand upright is a major design innovation. This allows you to place your food upright, taking up less space allowing you to pack the foods in  and avoids possible leakage that may result if the bag is placed sideways. The size is also another plus as a gallon really holds a lot of marinade and takes care of the savory concoction marinating your chicken, fish or meat. This product is extremely useful and practical and there really is no negative downside. Heat up the grill and  buy it now for all your marinating needs. Recommended for the practical gourmet cook.

This a very tasty salsa. It is not by any means overly hot or spicy; as stated on the label, it is mild. It is very flavorful however which makes up for it's like of heat. fairly or not I took away a star because it could be spicier. To be exact it would be 4.5 as the flavor makes up for lack of heat. The combination of fire roasted and fresh tomatoes give the salsa a unique taste that compliments the overall flavor. The same can be said for the roasting and use of fresh corn. The roasted Serrano peppers give it a little heat but there are so  many other flavors that  all blends together quite nicely. There is a recipe on the jar suggesting using the salsa for a base when making tortilla soup. It sounds like a good idea but I've yet to use it for soup. Since I received four jars, which are thick glass, packed very thoroughly and shipped in a strong box, they arrived perfectly. I've eaten one jar, in a sitting I might add with another person and half of another on another occasion. The opened jar has been in the refrigerator and has not gone bad over the course of several weeks closing in on a month. This is a testament to the jar and the freshness is maintained. Some store bought salsas don't hold up well but that is not the case with Arriba!  I'm a big chili head and grow my own and make my own salsa as well as store bought so I rotate my salsas so that is why I have half a jar left. I'm having some now, very delicious but not too hot. If you like more heat just dice up a fire roasted Serrano pepper and add it. I used to use this trick many years age when I would buy Pace. Anyway this is good stuff and perfect for a tasty salsa that doesn't bring  too much heat. Recommended for people who don't like their salsa too hot.

For the price this a bargain. I was a little apprehensive when I ordered it because I thought it might be, for lack of a better word, cheap. To add to my skepticism I figured this would definitely be destined for the picnic table or outdoor table. I couldn't have been further from the truth. Surprisingly it is high quality in feel, the texture plus the color add an element of elegance to the cloth. This is one to be used inside or outdoors. It dresses up the table for everyday use or special occasions if you're so inclined. Add a touch of class by adding a runner and you've got all the making of a special night. I was pleasantly surprised and very happy with this product. If you're looking for a tablecloth that won't break the bank and holds up to stains, perfect for wine spills btw, and washes easily in your washing machine than this one is for you. Recommended for your dining table.

I recently purchased the Samsung Galaxy S4 phone along with a cover for protection. If you have this phone you may know the cover that I purchased as it comes in several colors and the has a cover that flips that has a slit near the top to view the time, battery life etc. This cover worked good until , you guessed it my phone dropped and broke the glass face which although covered shattered it with the impact of falling. I got a replacement phone and bought a leather case for extra protection in which to place the flip covered phone.  It worked okay but it was a bit of a hassle to take it out often missing calls etc. Then I went with the Otterbox and could not be happier. I still kept the flip cover and placed it in the Otterbox. So I get a stylish look and extra protection with the protection of essentially two covers. Although the Otterbox would suffice for protection I went with overkill since I can be a little rough and careless with my phone at times. I also bike alot and am always concerned if I crash or fall that I may damage the phone. The Otterbox gives the phone a solid well protected feel and the surrounding edges are extremely durable. I mention edges because speaking from experience this is usually where the phone initially makes contact before it goes boom. There is also a hard rubber liner on the edges that add to the protection. This is a well made product that also looks good and is unobtrusive and does not take away from the phones sleek looks . It does make your phone a little heavier but that's the trade off for protecting your smart phone investment. It is simple to put in place to protect your phone. I am definitely happy with the Otterbox and would absolutely recommend it for your Galaxy S4.

I believe this product is for professional groomers but it worked well with my two dogs as I used it myself. I also gave some for another family dog when she was bathed and the results for all three pets was fantastic. As claimed the product makes the grooming process easier. My dogs have hair or fur that often tangled or gets tangled and this shampoo pre-wash seemed to help make the bathing and grooming job easier. I have only used it once bit on three dogs and there are no complaints only positive results. Since it is concentrated there is plenty here to last a long time and to bathe many dogs numerous times. I was very satisfied and would recommend this product to dog groomers or pet lovers who do the cleaning work of their pets themselves. Your dogs will love  you for it and come away with wagging tails.

Although my dog has not been skunked recently I have used this product to get the pew odor of several months without a bath on my dog. My dogs are outside dogs and therefore pick up all kinds of odors and mostly unpleasant. When I used this product on both my dogs they came away smelling fresh and clean. I will post an update to how this works specifically when skunked but I hope that is not too soon as the odor is not only on the dogs but everywhere the skunk has been near the dogs. It usually requires a thorough cleaning of the bedding and the general dog kennel area. I can only at this point comment on the fact that it does remove the "dog" smell of my outdoor dogs. Recommended to get smells off  of your loved furry family members.

This energy drink is a little different  than some others on the market. For one it is better in so many ways. It has an exceptional taste that is  hard to describe. It has an effervescent light carbonated taste. As for flavor it reminds me of Tang, yes  I said Tang, the old orange flavored drink the astronauts used back in the day. Difference is this drink has a punch. This is a great picker upper in  small can that packs a punch without the jitters. There is no come down feeling or electrified hair feels like an electrical circuit that has short circuited feeling. Delicious and seemingly good for you I would definitely recommend this product for your pick me up needs. Try it as an alternative to the traditional mimosa if you are an adult looking for something different. An excellent alternative to the overcrowded energy drinks on the market. Try it you'll like it.

My dogs get a variety of treats as I like to mix up their diet with variety. One of their favorites are the jerky treats sold through Costco amongst others but I must say my dogs loved this Purina product. One of the things I was impressed with the ingredients. Nothing artificial and made with real chicken. It does not say what parts of the chicken so I assume it's a variety of chicken parts as it compressed and pressed into small slabs of jerky. My dog's are small dogs in the 20lb range and I went with the common sense suggested portion. I treat is too much so a half treat each is about right. As stated their is a suggested portion amount with big dogs over 60lbs getting up to two treats. Discretion should be used when giving treats and Purina gives the pet owner a good idea how much should be given to their dog in relation to their ordinary diet. I think the dogs love these because of the brown sugar and the fact that it is real chicken. They are very hard so older dogs may have trouble chewing them. I say this because one of my dogs is a senior pet citizen and she had trouble chewing so I broke it up into bite size pieces . How do I know they are good? Easy, my dogs were real eager and their dogs were wagging the whole time. They love these treats. My furry friends give these treats five arf arf arf arf arf's!

I'm a subscriber and read that the app was available across all formats.  I downloaded it for my S4 phone without any problems. However when I tried to get a kindle version on my kindle it would not allow me to get it. Very disappointed as I would prefer to read the kindle format rather than my phone.

I found this small book to be very entertaining despite the brevity and language. The language is scholarly but presented in novel form to tell a story  buried in antiquity. Mr. Schiavone presents the reader with a compelling account of Spartacus, the gladiator slave leader who led a revolt against the might Romans. There has much been written about the mythic Spartacus, much of it romanticized as a revolutionary, creating a man of larger than life character whose epic battles both in the arena and out of the arena helps create the legend of Spartacus. Mr. Schiavone presents a more realistic perspective that is based upon historical documents of the time. He uses the ancient sources of Plutarch and Appian and other Roman writers from the decades following  A.D.100 to supplement his other sources. This is a scholarly study of Spartacus the man separating the legend. Little mention is made of his exploits in the arena but rather the focus is on his militarily doomed revolt. Since little is known factually of Spartacus much of what is presented in many accounts of Spartacus are idealized visions. The author presents various versions of certain events and does make conjecture of his own but gives the reader the option to choose the real sequence of events. I really enjoyed this book and found it a good compliment to various other media, such as the highly fictionalized  but amazing Starz version of Spartacus or the classic movie by Stanley Kubrick starring Kirk Douglas. I would recommend this book to anyone who is interested in separating the myth and legend of Spartacus from the Roman warrior.

Well there are lots of reviews here for this unique and intriguing novel but I'll throw my dos centavos in anyway. First of all, it has all been said before in other reviews both pro and con. If you are interested check out the listed review from Publishers Weekly which gives a complete synopsis so that you know what you are getting into. What you will get into is a bizarre world, bordering on the macabre, a Gothic tale set in another place and time. I came upon this book because I'm a lifelong avid reader who is always looking for something new. I must say that I was filled with same type of excitement I had as a teenager when I discovered the writings of Edgar Allen Poe. There is an element of horror but it is disguised within the shadows of the gargoyle guarded doors that open to the soul. The writings of Carlos Ruiz Zafon were recommended to me and I was not disappointed as he commands attention to detail, weaves an extraordinary story that captivates the soul. The soul becomes part of the story as you are transfixed with sordid transgressions that mix with all the emotions of the human soul both good and bad. Within the story you become part of the story as questions ping at your own soul and you travel the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona in 1945 looking for answers that will be evident but it is like life, a journey where we sometimes know the answers but we continue to seek them anyway; sometimes in spite of the danger and potential harm lurking. I found Zafon's use of language to be like a massage, gentle but hard, soothing yet alarming but always reeling you in closer to become part of another world. A world of inhabited by characters where the profound geniuses like Dali and Picasso once roamed the streets seeking their own answers. The world where the  Cemetery of Forgotten Books is the norm and encounters with Julian Carax or is it Lain Coubert become part of the labyrinth  within the Shadow of The Wind. If you enter this world you may just enjoy your visit and become part of the story. I believe it is a fresh narrative and worthwhile of your time; if after beginning to read you don't like the book don't read it.

The Allman Brothers have a legacy in rock and roll that was honored with their induction into the R&R HOF in 1995. They were a terrific band that was instrumental in the creation of what may be called Southern Rock. However they were also known for  being a jam band. You know, let it rip and just jam, much like jazz musicians are known to do. An opening is given with a passage and the artist lets it fly, going to places on the instrument that is the moment. One of the songs where this is most evident is the seminal recording by the Allman Brothers entitled " In Memory of Elizabeth Reed. " This has always, both then and now been one of my favorite songs by them. With it's jazzy style it rises to heights with each solo and mellows out when the band converges again. The guitar solos go from sizzling, blistering riffs to laid back precursors to smooth  jazz that is dreamy. The percussionists are part of band and in turn take their turn in soloing. This is not a studio version but rather a live version that captures the spirit of a long jam with audience interaction. The percussion solo is reminiscent and in the lasting tradition of those performed at Woodstock by the Santana band when he electrified the crowd. Long drum solos have their place in a live show, especially if it is a jam band. Drums are the heartbeat of a band and should be appreciated along with all the other solos. If drums are not your thing it comes at the end of the song so you can stop it then.  Although this version(nearly 21 minutes) is longer than the one recorded most famously at the Fillmore East by about seven minutes it still is an awesome track; you can  never get too much of a good thing. If you're familiar or not with this song you might give this version a try. Their are no lyrics, lots of jazzy interplay guitar battling and just a flat out terrific song for the ages. I have several versions and can't ever get enough  of this song, check it out , you'll like it.

Throughout the years I've used a variety of Miracle-Gro tagged products. I like the Bloom Plus for obvious reasons and the All Purpose fertilizer for year round use . The first I used was the old school  feeder that you put the granules in and connect to your hose and it dispenses accordingly.  I have three or four in various locations throughout  the yard  as I still use them with regularity. I've given my son one too as begins is life long love of gardening. One of my sons preferred the Shake and Feed All Purpose product so I decided to give it a try. I am happy to report that this is the easiest way to tend to fertilizing my plants. No mixing in a watering can, no scooping into the feeder, no muss no fuss! It is so easy it almost makes me feel guilty as I sprinkle it around my plants and water as usual. It works marvelously with potted plants as they tend to loose nutrients in the soil and have found new growth complimenting nature's seasonal blessing. It's springtime here in Cali, so everything is growing rapidly. The noticeable difference with the Miracle-Gro continuous release feeder is the size of the leaves and the beautiful vibrant  colors of the flowers and leaves. Another thing I like about it is that I don't have to feed as often because it is time release and lasts about three months. I must admit I cheat with my favorite plants by giving them the liquid Miracle-Gro as well! I like all the Miracle-Gro fertilizing products and always have some of their mulch and enriched soil on hand and it use it regularly whenever I give a plant or tree a new home in the garden. Am I a pitch man for Miracle-Gro? No, I just like and believe in their line of plant food products because I have seen the results year after year. You can't go wrong with this easy to use shake and feed fertilizer. However, I still like my old school liquid dispenser; this is a good compliment to my old fave.  Buy it now for a greener garden and you'll be the envy of all who pass by and admire your yard. Good stuff and highly recommended for easy gardening. Happy gardening!

By nature I'm a skeptic, I'm from the show me state(of mind). I have never used any whitening agents and always get a bit jealous when I see people with pearly whites that seem to always be smiling and showing them off. I always write it off as they're blessed with genetics or have lots of money for treatments. Enter Colgate and the common man with a special brush and whitening pen! I was thrilled to give this product a chance and was pleasantly surprised with the results; remember I'm a skeptical person. I tried using the special brush but preferred my own brush which is motorized, you know, the cheapies with batteries. I alternate and use both, sometimes in the same brushing session since it is a "special" brush and want to get the maximum benefit from the Colgate product. What I really do like is the whitening pen but it does take a little getting used to. For some reason I imagined it would be thicker and  easier to apply. Although it is marketed as a gel, technically it probably is but it has a consistency more like toothpaste. It is a little messy and requires a little work to apply correctly, if there is such a way. Considering how  the gel is not that thick it is a little difficult to determine  the right amount to apply. Applying it evenly is even more challenging. in spite of these issues I have with the whitening pen it does eventually get on the teeth and sticks to them. I drink a cup of coffee in the morning and have an old set of choppers but I have noticed an improved whiter shade. Now if I would have only been blessed with pearly white teeth through genetics I could be smiling continuously! Colgate has a whole line of products that will enhance  the color of your teeth and after trying the whitening pen and brush this skeptic may be willing to try some of their other whitening products.  I think for the price and if you want to get whiter teeth quick this is a good place to start on your way to a omnipresent smile on your face. Recommended for satisfaction at a reasonable price.

This is a good small bird feeder that works quite well without any assembly, which is a big plus! Don't you just hate products that require assembly that come with instructions so complicated and convoluted that you eventually end up just tossing them and figure it out yourself? Anyway, although the bird feeder is small it does the job and does attract small birds, well, until the bigger one's come and chase the smaller birds away! A simple solution I have found to work is have several bird feeders of different sizes. The birds always seem to claim their preferred feeder and than there is plenty for every birdie! This particular bird feeder is a perfect starter for developing gardens in an urban setting. We tried several locations with my son's newly planted garden and the birds have been using it quite regularly requiring refilling frequently. We tried it on a tree branch at first but found it to work best on a fence post. Attached to the post it works perfectly as it doesn't move or loose as much feed as when it was on a branch. The product looks like it will last  a few years and with proper care, cleaning etc. it should give many years of pleasure. Since it does have plastic components I recommend placing it in a shady area so that the plastic does not deteriorate with the sun. If you're looking for a small bird feeder at a reasonable price you can't go wrong with this Perky-Pet feeder. Recommended for urban gardens to add to your bird feeder collection that will keep your feathered friends happy and hanging around your garden for years and years to come. Happy birding in your own garden!

Very nice and sweet taste if you're looking for some  hot apple cider. This product is sweet but overly sweet as it is not primarily sugar. The essence of the apple bits makes for some tasty brew. I do believe the price is a little high but it was a gift and when giving no price is too high. My man sons both love this flavor addition to their ever expanding K-Cup collection which among others also includes Green Mountain Coffee. I myself don't get the fascination with K-Cup products but my son loves them and I do enjoy having a cup of brew with him, in this case the Hot Apple Cider. This product is more flavorful than the packets that are sold as apple cider when in reality they are nothing more than sugar with flavoring. If you have one of these machines the addition of Hot Apple Cider is delightful on a cold winter night. Try some you'll like it.

I have not had very much experience with products like this but was indeed curious. When it was introduced as a surprise their was approval and was appreciated very much. I don't want to get to graphic but suffice to say that this product works and is a nice enhancement for fun in the chambre. You don't need very much and it lasts for a pretty long time. The good thing is that it is not overwhelming. I was told that some products tried have been too hot; this is not the case as it is like an Anaheim hot versus a Habanero super hot, if you know what I mean. The good news is that it can heat things up successfully and can be a tasty treat for both you and your partner. If you like heat and want to spice things up try this product for some hot times. Recommended for adventurous times when you want things caliente.

If a product passes military standards than it is good enough proof for me as a US Army Vietnam Era Veteran who served overseas on two continents and depended on military standards. My prejudice aside I can honestly say that this cover is more than adequate and is an excellent protective cover for your IPad mini. Although I have not dropped it from 6ft. I have bumped it around roughly on hard objects and the cover absorbs the bumps and bruises just fine. I must say I was a little concerned that it might take away from the sleek and lightweight IPad mini but it is a tradeoff. The compromise in a pound heavier tablet is worth the security and peace of mind. The features I love are the multiple lock in viewing angles and the magnetic closing locks. This is an excellent product that is worth the money for protecting your investment in your IPad mini. Recommended for peace of mind that your IPad mini is safe from the everyday potential hazards of daily use or maybe an unforeseen drop from a table.

First off let me say that there are already many reviews for this product with the vast majority very favorable. Of particular interest are those by Top Ten Amazon reviewers that include a video along with technical data and analysis; they are highly informative. I have had this product for a couple of weeks now and listen to it whenever I can and really enjoy it. It has a big sound in a little package. The engineering in the construction of the little XBoom is top notch and very impressive. No cheap short cuts were made in the production. It is solid. Everything fits precisely and maintains the compact nature of the XBoom. It is about the size of a rubber hand ball and little smaller than a racquetball. The cord that come with it pretty much let you play with any device as it comes with a standard radio plug, USB and mini USB that plugs into the device. The cord comes with a built in Velcro strap that allows you to store the cord in the pouch that holds everything. The XBoom opens up and expands in height with an accordion type expansion center that closes and snaps securely shut into the ball shape for storage. You can play it while not expanded in height but it sounds so much better opened up as it was intended. The volume control is a traditional "thumb roller" with a separate on/off switch.The sound is quite amazing for such a small speaker. I must admit I thought upon opening the package that there is no way that this little speaker could produce good sound. I was wrong. I can play the speaker in my bedroom and go to other rooms and still hear it quite well in a quiet house. For listening to music in a room it is ideal as it fills the room with sound because of it's 360 degree engineering. Right now I am in the living room a good thirty feet from my bedroom where I left it on and I hear it loud and clear. Sometimes I listen to it on a lower volume level while I watch sports highlights on ESPN and it is unobtrusive and compatible while competing with another audio source from the television. It is perfect for your tablet, phone, or lap top as the sound is superior to those that come with them; it definitely is an upgrade and an enhancement to the sound you get built into your device. I have used mine with my Kindle and phone listening to my Amazon cloud library and Pandora and am very pleased. I have also used it with Netflix and it is ideal for an enhanced audio visual experience superior to the sound built in. Outdoors it is perfect for a small group where you can listen and still talk. I have numerous portable speakers for various devices but love this one the most because of it's size and great sound and of course mobility; you can take it anywhere without giving up much space in a backpack. It also fits perfectly in a pocket of your jacket. You can take it anywhere with you and have a good portable sound system. I would definitely recommend this product for all ages. It is an excellent portable sound system that delivers a big sound in a small package. You can't go wrong for the price so get one now or get several to put away for gifts for those who love music.

This is a nice set for detail cuts on your small plants. I suppose it can be used for other purposes but have only used mine for cuts on some of my Bonsai. They are delicate and do require getting used to using such a  small set of essentially garden scissors for the potted Bonsai plants. They are like tiny clippers and good for small detail work. I probably misread the product when I bought it but was expecting three different sizes. Unfortunately all three are the same size. This is ok as I have placed them in various work locations and even one in my backpack for use on the road. They are a nice addition to your garden tools and recommended for the amateur horticulturist.

This is a very good tool for the garden enthusiast. Actually after using it for some time now for various landscape projects I would say it is an essential tool. It is quite versatile and comes in handy for a variety of gardening needs. Since it is extremely durable it is a fantastic digging tool for planting small transplants, digging up weeds and perfect for planting bulbs in the fall. If you are looking for a good tool  garden use in a number of different ways this is a perfect hand tool. It is an ideal supplement and addition to any garden tool arsenal to attack and create beauty in your own backyard. The only drawback, hence the four stars instead of five is that the handle could be a little more comfortable to grip. I owned a similar tool I bought from Japanese Woodworker that had a more ergonomic handle. cost twice as much and was actually a better tool, comfort wise, but for the price it is a good choice.

I must admit I was a little reluctant to spend hours watching a series about a woman detective but with some female persuasion I submitted. To my surprise I got hooked in rather easily and thoroughly enjoyed the mysteries evolving around the plots. One of the reasons for my hesitation to invest time into watching the series was my unfamiliarity with the lead female character; also I felt it would be somewhat of a "chick flick" with the modern twist of women can do it all, including packing heat and knowing how to use their seductive charms to save the world, well, Melbourne anyway. On the contrary I liked Miss Fisher and I was the one seduced! Also I was not familiar with the books so I had no previous knowledge of what I was getting into. Surprise, surprise as I was in for a real visual  cinematic treat. The sets and outfits, or wardrobe if you will, were amazing and recreated with authenticity. Watching the series you really feel the time period and get transported to a different time and place. The music, especially if you like jazz was very nice. I'm not one to try and guess every moment what is going to happen but rather like to just get wrapped up into the story and let the director, actors and visuals take me along for a ride. What a ride it was as I couldn't get enough!  The series is very entertaining and I would recommend it to all. That includes the male audience and that is coming from a skeptical male viewer who really liked the series, after all, Essie Davis is very easy on the eyes. I look forward to more mystery adventures, where's the next installment?

If you are a coffee lover and like variety, essentially not stuck on one style, brand, or coffee bean, give this Ethiopian coffee a taste. You may even like it to the point where it becomes more than just part of your daily rotation and one of your favorites. It is bold enough yet smooth enough to rough out the edges unlike the more bolder styles like a dark or medium roast. In my estimation it has it's own distinctive qualities from the bean itself and lies in taste somewhere between a dark and medium roast  but different because of the unique bean qualities. Like terroir in wine, where each wine region gives a one of  kind taste,  the coffee bean has it's own distinctive qualities because of where it is grown and harvested. I find this coffee to be a nice change of pace coffee has I prefer  the more robust flavors of dark roast; taste is very personal but I do think most coffee drinkers will appreciate the quality of this product. It is not bitter at all and rather mellow. I would recommend this coffee to the java-caffeine heads who appreciate a good cup of Joe.

I love this product! My 2000 SUV was in dire need of something to make it shine. I have tried several different waxes, such as Turtle Wax most recently but none have achieved the results I got with Meguiar's White Wax. My paint job was white but dull in certain spots where the sun had done it's damage. I applied the wax in the shade, after washing my Mountaineer of course, and then used my buffer to bring out the white from the dullness. What a difference! As my truck began to shine which inspired me to do the whole vehicle as opposed to just the dull spots on top. My SUV is going on 14 years old and the paint job now looks bright almost like new; well, at least protected and taken care of. I'm going to get the black version to bring the pop back into my classic 1956 Chevy. Recommended for the car enthusiast who wants his car to be looking good!

I like the laptop lift to do just that; lift my laptop. However I do not like to use it, by use it I mean using the keyboard, when the laptop is in the elevated position. It is very uncomfortable to type in this position, that is when it is resting in the lift. I use it primarily for viewing video material or doing work that requires little typing like just moving the cursor and clicking, such as downloading music. It is a good modern looking addition to the work station to store your laptop so that it is ready for use. Since it is lightweight it can be mobile and thus your work station can be as well. I do not think it is by any means an essential item  or an can't do without accessory for your laptop but it is cool looking and keeps your laptop upright, cool if turned on and ready to go. Good for the college dorm or your modern cyber work space and a nice addition to your tech accessories.

What does it mean to make disciples? Thats one of the key questions that Robby Gallatys book Rediscovering Discipleship seeks to answer. Further, Gallaty works to address what it looks like to actually do the work in our churches.First, lets look at the structure of Rediscovering Discipleship. Gallaty gives us thirteen chapters, broken in two major sections. The first section, comprising seven chapters, looks at how Jesus made disciples. The second section parlays that into how we can emulate Jesus.Second, lets look at the rightness of the overall premise. Has the Church neglected discipleship such that it needs rediscovered? Gallaty makes the case well that this is true, at least of those parts of the church in the United States of America. Hes rightboth the witness of the Church in the world around us and the experience of those within the church support the lack of depth in our discipleship.Third, lets consider his recommended solutions. He recommends such ordinary means as time, Bible reading, and personal relationships. Since his concepts are based in the same practices that we see Jesus use in the Scripture, its hard to argue with that idea. Some of his suggestions stem from ideas used by Wesley in the development of the Methodist way, which is not bad unless you turn legalist with it. This is, honestly, the biggest threat to most discipleship groups and plans. The step from accountable to control is a short one in the wrong direction. This is one of the main killers of discipleship these days, the trip and fall into legalismor the fear of doing it so that you never start!The above fear is why we need community and not commanders in the church.How practical is this book? Immensely. I would highly recommend this as one of the better practical books on church growth I have seen. What is the one major flaw? Zondervan saddled it with endnotes instead of footnotes. Beyond that, its well worth the time and study.I did receive a free book in exchange for the review.

Pepsi has taken an interesting turn with the "small batch" concept behind their Caleb's Kola offering.First, to the beverage: shipped in a pretty solid cardboard box, which will soon be reused for Christmas decorations, all the bottles arrived intact. I expect it would take a deliberate effort for these to not arrive in good shape. No bets on the summer time, though, with heat building up internal pressure.Taste? It tastes good, all the way through a whole bottle. The first sip was different from what I expected, because I had no real guess what "genuine kola nut flavor" should taste like, but by the bottom of a well-chilled bottle I found it very satisfying.The sweetness comes through well without being too syrupy. That's probably the result of using a cane sugar over a corn syrup sweetener.Caffeine level was fine, not a wake-up jolt or a sleep stealing monster. I still haven't figured out how caffeine enhances taste, but you should know it's there.All in all, this is a luxury type item that won't become an every day consumption, but it's a good add to a special event

First, the appearance: yes, it looks nice. I store my can opener in a drawer, so function matters more.So: can opening first. This works well on both normal and big kitchen size cans--the bulk ones that we use around the church big kitchen of green beans and such. I have had no problems with it.Cleaning? Not dishwasher save. You probably don't get it that dirty anyway, and hand-washing is not that hard.The main drawback I find is that the magnet should be stronger. I like the idea, it just needs more pulling power.

If you look at other reviews, you'll see that some folks have had serious trouble with setup. Their experience is different from mine--For me:1. Removed printer from box, plugged into the wall per the directions. (After I found the power cord, which I had dropped somewhere and spent several minutes unnecessarily cursing Canon for not including a power cord.)2. Setup: fairly normal setup. Install cartridges, put paper in trays.3. Wait. For what seemed a long time....while the printer aligns and primes and whatever else. I don't know how much ink that takes, but it may have been a lot.4. Setup via WiFi for one Windows 10 PC: easy but time consuming. You need to download and install the software package for it to find and program the printer to the WiFi network. That was fine, just involved.One note: Canon gives you two permission pages to accept. The first is the critical one, where the printer actually works and the EULA for it. The second is for the ongoing data back-and-forth between your printer and Canon. It looks like a "yeah, just click accept and go on..." but it's not critical and is data-sharing you might not want.5. Print from PC? Done. Overall, took about 20 minutes. Constant attention not required, but it's not completely automatic.6. Print from Android tablet? Pretty straightforward, if you install their app and print from it.7. NFC from phone? Didn't try but did NFC from an actual camera with that option...worked well. Obviously you have fewer options doing that than printing out of Photoshop.8. Did not go purchase printable CDs or DVDs to test that feature. Sharpies work for my low-volume use of those.9. Print efficiency: it's fast. The color looks good. The ink usage seems about normal, but it's hard to know for sure as you're dealing with the opaque print cartridges.10. I'm pleased with the scanning/copying.If I could change something, I would remove using a gray ink cartridge. To my eyes, nothing is improved by it. All it is is one more cartridge to have to buy that isn't included even in the "value packs" sold here on Amazon.Beyond that, this is a good working printer. Photos and documents both. Setup was smooth, and wireless works fine.

Soft. Comfy.With deep enough pockets on the fitted sheet to hold the slightly fluffier mattress.Beyond soft and comfy, what shall I say? That these cleaned nicely? They did, but they weren't exactly super dirty. The color held well in the wash, and the pillow cases fit the pillows well.Good product.

Because it's the first set that has the Torx varieties I needed for a project, this gets a bit higher star rating from me.The basic thing is what you see: organizer with bits. There's an add-on collar to hold screws while you drive them, and it's a mixed bag. I didn't have much luck with it driving down, but straight-out (into the wall) it helped stabilize the screws.The bits seem durable, and they all have a space in the organizer. The add-on collar doesn't, which means it's headed to the bottom of the tool bag, never to be seen again. But the bits are handy to have. I don't think these are any more durable than my B&D sets, but they held up well through one major project.Value is questionable--prices fluctuate too much to be certain, but there's nothing here worth a major premium over other brands. But these deliver as promised.

Obviously not the most creative product, as it's very similar to some other chocolate products out there. It is, however, a new form of the classic Hershey's Kiss. And here on Amazon, you get a 12 pack of 15....which, if I remember math, comes out to 180 kisses. That's a lot of chocolate. And budget-wise, a good bit better than the competing products.Quality and taste are our real questions. First of all, I'm pretty used to Hershey's Chocolate as kind of the normal taste of chocolate. So I think it's good. These are a bit creamier, actually, than the standard Kiss chocolate. I could do without the crisps added in, but they don't hurt the flavor.The hazelnut center is a nice middle, and overall this feels like a fancier gift idea than a normal sack of Kisses.Taste is good, quality seems good--it's an okay product. Just not that exciting or new.

Pretty cool MP3 player. The only drawback, for me, is the need to be wearing something with a strap (goggles, etc...) to hold these up.Otherwise:1. Easy file management. That's the first plus--one has little difficulty adding or subtracting files from the Duo.2. Great sound quality. I was very pleased. Also, by not needing to be jammed into my ears, I was able to wear ear plugs.3. Control: simple. Shuffle, skip, play, start, restart. I had some trouble getting the volume to adjust, because that shares a button with the skip/search feature. But that's my fat-finger issues, not really a device issue.Overall: well worth it. You do need to wear goggles or something to hold this on, so it's not going to be your running in the rain or music in the shower answer. But if you are a serious swimmer, this is perfect.

Full disclaimer: I received this book free from Kregel Academic in exchange for writing this review.Tough Questions About God and His Actions in the Old TestamentIve read several other books by Walter C. Kaiser, Jr., over the years. He is a go-to scholar for evangelical America on Old Testament issues. So, I was interested in his latest from Kregel Academic/Ministry, Tough Questions about God and His Actions in the Old Testament. I was hopeful that this book would become a great resource in pastoral ministry.The questions are certainly present-day questions, such as The God of Mercy or of Ethnic Cleansing? or The God who Elevates Women or who Devalues Women? These questions form the chapters, providing the framework for the book. One question/chapter was unnecessary, and that was the last on dietary laws. This question fits into the wider framework of the chapter on Grace/Law, and the space could have been used for another question or issue. One that I would have liked relates to truth, accuracy, and historical records for the Old Testament.Overall, though, while I find no major errors or issues with this work,. (As if I should sit in judgment on the Old Testament work of someone whose books were used to teach me the Old Testament,) I dont find anything to commend as a necessary book. Some of the questions are framed as either/or and then answered with both. Others are answered with a fairly standard concept: whatever God does is right, but what God did then is not something we should assume He is going to command now.While these answers are essentially accurate, they are not much help in the apologetic or teaching domain. That God ordering judgment on the Canaanites is fundamentally different than jihad in Islam is something I would accept on faith. Kaisers explanation isnt much deeper than that. It presupposes that the Bible is right and the Quran wrong, which is part of Christian belief. (Just as part of Islamic belief is the converse of that statement.)Do I feel like it was a waste to read this? No, I do not. Kaiser has consolidated here a basic Christian response to the questions he cites. But all-in-all, I dont think his answers cover the material well enough to work outside of the faith community. Theres just too much that grounds in the presupposition that God is always right.Again, free book from Kregel in exchange for the review.

It looks just like the....advertisement for the movie.Does it go together well? Yes. 20 minutes, start to finish, with the help of a 9-year-old.Detail level looks good, though it's not like the TIE Fighters that I flew when I was actually in the Imperial Navy. I'm not sure that whoever this "First Order" is actually used all the plans we left them.Other than that? Sound chip is good, though it's not the bone-rattling terror of a squadron of TIE Fighters blowing your moisture farm to smithereens. It's about as fragile as the TIE Fighter in the old LucasArts TIE Fighter simulator--the one where the Rebels blew me up, constantly.Anyway--Fun model, easy to assemble.

Keep in mind what it is: it's a low-end model kit. Kind of in that bridge point between Legos and serious model-building. So the detail isn't as great as you'll get when you paint/shape it yourself.And it's less durable than a toy construction. This is more for putting together and hanging from the ceiling than for playing with.Sound effects are okay. Obviously, not quite THX or surround sound.Ease of assembly: it went together in a little less than half-an-hour. Looks good on the shelf. Isn't that really the main goal?

First, I find the lids to work as advertised. They pop on/pop off easily with one hand.Second, though, I find the lids to work as advertised. They pop on/pop off easily.That about sums it up: because there's not a tight seal with closing, which enables the one-handed operation, the lids just don't stay closed well.I wouldn't recommend using these for unsealed food long-term. But as a general purpose canister, these are okay.

This watch looks great on my arm. Which is fine....because my arm's not exactly a great looking arm.It is a bit on the large size, as far as the face of the watch. That's an advantage to me, as I can quickly tell the time at a glance rather than having to look closely.The blue coloring looks elegant, and it keeps time just fine. Watch was easy to set.The band feels durable and there's enough water resistance that washing your hands doesn't require removing your watch.Which, given the clasp, is a HUGE benefit. I've gotten it down, now, but the first time I tried to put this watch on, it took some serious doing. And the lack of documentation was a problem there.

RAM.You need it. You probably need more of it than your laptop has out of the box.And the difficulty or ease of install depends more on your laptop design than it does on these modules. Check these things:1. Clock speed and compatibility.2. What RAM do you already have onboard? That is, if your laptop has 2 slots with 4 GB in each already, this doesn't help. You need a single 8GB chip to step up.3. It's generally a matter of taking out a screw or two, popping in a chip. Works and speeds up the processing of your computer.

The Carols of Christmas adds to my shelf of story behind the song books, but in fairness to Andrew Gants hard work Ill leave the others unnamed. I mention this just to show this isnt my first trip into music history.Of course, one fear of digging into the stories behind the songs is that youll find your favorite songs are just bad underneath. Fortunately, Gant hasnt destroyed any favorite songs. It may be that he left out some with checkered storiesbut well have to wait for the sequel.Instead, we have good stories behind 21 fairly well-known songs. Except for Personent Hodie, that is. The rest youll know. In this book, I appreciate Gants depth of writing and his willingness to acknowledge the differences between facts and legends. I also like that he did not stuff the book with unknown songspresenting just one lesser-known carol for our enjoyment.Overall, of course, the presentation is repetitive. Each chapter has a song, a story, and the sheet music for the song. Thats not the way youd want a novel but this is a collection of stories. It works just fine this way. I honestly couldnt sit and read the whole thing straight throughunless I was a history nerd. Which I am. Otherwise, though, its a bits and pieces book.For example, in our house this is going to be part of daily leading-to-Christmas celebrating. One chapter a swatch, with singing the song each day. Good stuff.I think this makes a great book for music lovers and Christmas celebrations both.I did receive a free copy of this book from BookLook in exchange for the review.

Durable and warm. That sums up the pullover rather simply, but it hits the goal. This isn't for formal occasions like the Royal Garden Party, but for booting the kid out of the house to go play instead of watching a movie.And it works for that. The pocket holds just enough rocks and other yard treasure to really cause a problem. The hood is warm enough on the ears even when bike riding.The elastic on the sleeves keep the arms covered and warm. All in all, a good fit for our big boy shirt wearing big boy.

Basic laptop. There's good enough audio to go with the above average video, but you've got a shortage of RAM overall.Here's the bigger picture:1. Full keyboard, including number pad. That's good. On mine, the left side CTRL key sticks, but not too often. I haven't decided if the space bar issuesI'm having are my typing or the PC. I'll assume that's on me.2. Audio sounds good.3. Hard Drive is a touch on the small side at 500GB. I never thought I'd say that, but it is. By the time you install Windows10 and other programs, it'll run out quicker than you expect. And if you're not comfortable putting in a second one? That's problematic.4. 4GB of RAM isn't enough. I added 8GB and it now recognizes 12GB of RAM. That works better.5. SmartGestures/Trackpad: it's easy to use and easy to set to turn off automatically if you plug in an external mouse. I like that.6. Durability? Feels a bit fragile. May not be, but I'm not dropping it to find out.7. Battery life? Meh. Not a lot of oombh in the battery. Also, I don't like inaccessible batteries. Not in phones, not in laptops. Should be more accessible than it is.8. Included software? It's mostly auto-download links rather than full programs.9. Video quality is better than my old laptop. I can see my nosehairs in Youtube videos now. Whether or not that's good for the universe is another discussion.10. It's not a major workhorse, but it does the job solidly.

Uninvested promises on the cover to show you how "Wall Street hijacks your money" AND "how to fight back."The first premise is one that few of us would likely dispute. Monks, with Jaffe and Lacasse, help demonstrate *how* and document cases, but there is really nothing surprising about this idea. While the overall evidence is that neither regulations nor industry "safeguards" really help, they do not advocate tearing them down. Admittedly, I think differently and recognize that there will always be more money in the private sector than in government and that greed will out rather than true regulation.Still, the definite evidence presented helps clear the fog about how well the government regulates. It doesn't. And to keep clear this: money managers make a living, whether they make you a lot of money or not.Further, Monks advocates strongly for being a better educated investor. I am all for it--and personally would suggest that less regulation would allow more people direct access to the markets.Instead, Monks' suggestion still sets up investors in groups controlled by money managers. I think that's the Achilles's Heel in his plan--he fails to acknowledge that no system will work any better than the people who run it, and even his systems will attract greedy people to run them, in time.Overall, the call for investors to get their heads out of the sand and pay attention is crucial. Further, the call to reform and improve regulation to allow better participation from detached investors is also worth looking at, though it's not much of a factor here.I liked this book, but I felt like it could have been somewhat more practical in terms of clear tools for the everyday investor. I came away knowing I need to know more, knowing that companies don't want me to know more, not trusting that any financial adviser will help....and wondering just how to invest my money. Because even Monks' CIP involves trusting a financial adviser....Informative but leaves one waiting for the next step.(I did receive a free book in exchange for the review. Had I received a free million dollars to invest as well, I would have reviewed the book the same.)

A the outset, I must be honest and admit that my Hebrew skills were never as good as my Greek, even in seminary. So I cringed a little, remembering that the Devotions on the Greek New Testament volume featured no English Scripture. I was afraid...And now that I have this in-hand and see that the separate devotional authors have included a chosen English translation, I realize that I kind of wish they hadn't. Part of the challenge and joy of doing the Hebrew reading is lost when you can glance over and use the English as a crutch. Having to look it up in a different book is slower, but it drives me to try a little harder.I will definitely side with the reviewer who found the Hebrew font a little on the small side. It could be bigger by half and would not look too large.Then there is the devotional content: I liked all of these, even with the divergent viewpoints inherent in a group writing like this. They were helpful, and I particularly enjoyed the efforts to dig out some different passages rather than retread the parts of the OT most of us are well acquainted with.

Well, first, it's hard to know whether this is movie-accurate, since the movie's not out yet. But, it looks like it's movie trailer accurate :)First: it comes with batteries. That's always nice. The description says "demo" batteries, but they're Duracell. So, since you're not getting one here on Amazon that has been sitting in the store having the batteries run down, you will probably be fine with the included batteries.Now, you have 2 major parts. A lightsaber and a light dagger. I'm guessing that, at some point in the film, the little light dagger is a surprising thing for the person dueling with Kylo Ren. Perhaps how the bad guy kills off someone we love? As a toy, it's a shell without lights or sounds. It does attach nicely to the handle of the main lightsaber, making a weapon that (if real) would cut from any angle.Which might explain the ready availability of hand replacements in that galaxy far, far away.As to the main lightsaber: nice. It extends easily and then collapses. The lights/sounds have two modes, one is reactive where a swing or hit makes a sound, the other just makes random noises. Both fully illuminate the lightsaber and the 2 side prongs. I would have preferred two modes, one with sound and one without, because parent sneak-attacks work better without the sound!It does connect in with other lightsabers in the whole "Blade Builders" system. That might get bad for the fragile items in the house, though...Worth your time. Grab one for Halloween or for standing in the line to get into Episode VII!

The book itself, A Commentary on the Manuscripts and Text of the New Testament (hereafter something like The Commentary) presents not only the differing manuscript readings throughout the New Testament (in canonical order) but also discusses which readings seem most likely. There are also notes on where some manuscripts have used devices such as nomen sacrum (a marker for sacred names) and potential explanations for various manuscript development.In short, Comfort attempts to explain many of the variants that are often footnoted in newer translations and also to highlight important facts lost in the realities of translations. It is a highly academic work. The first two chapters will orient the reader to the issues involved in textual criticism, but one definitely needs to be read-up in Greek to truly benefit from whats going on here.I am not an academic, but just an ordinary pastor. That means I grapple with different texts every week and rarely have time to fully research all the textual issues related to any of them. Further, Im leaning on Greek I learned a while back, and am trying to keep up with in these days. My view of Comforts Commentary is related to its usefulness for an every week preacher and teacher of the Bible.First, its not a necessary book. As much as I like it, its not critical to your weekly preaching. The information is helpful on background but not absolutely necessary. In fact, if you dont know how to work this into your teaching ministry, you can do more harm with it than good.Second, though, is that this is a helpful book. If youre putting together an in-depth study, this illuminates some of the background. Further, Comfort has provided a deeper look at something we often lean on a book-specific commentary for. Here, we have a look at the text as a whole and how the variants developed. Its handy. Especially in those times when I have a little bit of extra study opportunities.Form factor is great. Fits right alongside my Greek New Testament, my Apostolic Fathers, and the smaller hardcovers. Put it on your should get at some point list.

I use PowerDirector to compile videos of speeches and put them in a format to upload to Youtube. Occasionally I also do the same with family videos--as to using the software to import VHS tapes, which some have trouble with, I haven't tried that. Don't have the right cable for that anyway.As to Cyberlink PowerDirector 14:First, a dislike. Almost every time that I open PowerDirector, it gives a little pop-up encouraging me to buy another software product. I'm sure it's a fine product, but I just want to work with videos. Not have to click away an ad.Second, though, ease of use: remarkably easy. About the same as v. 12, but the processing speed is a tick faster. Click, drag, cut and slice. It works fine.Adding in transitions is easy. Downloading and adding new information, like more transitions from the web? A little more clunky than I would like, but it still works.It's probably the most robust that you will need for a home user.

Well, let's see...it's a towel-like skirt with velcro.Once you get over that weird feeling, it's just fine. Velcro closure does its job and hold tight.The material is absorbent enough but you'll still want a towel. Also, be careful putting too much weight in the pocket. Think 'locker key' or 'one car key,' not 'all the keys you have plus your wallet.'All in all, a good item for the pool or the dorm hall.

Seven lives. Spread across history, starting with Joan of Arc and ending with Rosa Parks, 7 Women and the Secret of Their Greatness is an introductory biography. Obviously too short to be an in-depth look at any of their lives, the chapter length looks get past the one-sentence summary that we often get.First, of course, one could look at how Metaxas chose the women to feature. History has not always been balanced in recording the lives of women and men. As such, writing a biography can be very difficult if you go looking too far back. There's just not the source material. Metaxas' choice of Joan of Arc is understandable, given the records that are available about her. Beyond that, he's chosen women from the Enlightenment Age onward.Additionally, it was his choice to include women who excelled at whatever they did, rather than seeking the ones who were "pathbreakers" into the traditional "men's world." Rather than setting up the false idea that women have to pick one side or another of the gender gap, instead he chose to highlight women who succeeded in both traditional and non-traditional fields.How is the writing?Metaxas writes with a friendly style that is easy to follow. It's not as in-depth as some writers, but this is an intro work. hopefully it will spur you to read full biographies of all seven named in the book.Factually, I must proceed on the assumption that Metaxas and his editors have ensured the accuracy of what is stated. I know that some aspects of the lives of Joan of Arc and Maria Skobtsova are hard to prove and drawn at parts from legend. These still read well.All in all, this is well worth reading. It's on our shelf for all three kids, as well as having been enjoyed by the adults.As noted above: book provided in exchange for the review.

One radio, added to our other 2 radios, and works well.First, weather alerts: this is actually the best of several weather radio options I've tried. Works well.Second, communications: this connects well with my Motorola TalkAbouts on both FRS and GMRS (yes, I have a license for the latter). Range is anywhere from 1 to 4 miles, depending on terrain. (The box shows 30 miles from mountain to valley. Haven't tried that. Might be 60 miles from a helicopter, but I won't be trying that, either!)Third, the add-on widgets like the flashlight are fine, but the communications are the main purpose for a radio. Pack a real flashlight!All in all, a useful household tool.

Just what I never thought I needed: the ability to cover an entire table with dry-erase surface.But then again, I'm a dad. I should have thought about how handy this would be.Plus, it's useful for long-term planning at work. We've spread the 3x2 out on a table and jotted out all the ideas, then used 3M Command strips to put the whole thing up on the wall. (I'm not sure if the sticky will actually hold this to a wall on its own. But it does hold it smooth on the table.)It doesn't come with markers or eraser, but I've got so many of those anyway it seems a bit pointless to have one more anyway.All in all, this was just what I needed. I'll be grabbing a couple more for further brainstorming ideas. Cleans well, also.

These are a bit on the thin side, but they have absorbed well. Also, due to the thin nature of them, I'm concerned for durability.Overall, they work. And they've survived one washing. But the smaller size means you aren't cleaning up too many messes with just one dishcloth.For cleaning glasses, though, excellent. If that's your main purpose, then you have the right item. Get a good streak-free look on your glassware.

What do you do with someone who does not age, and would only die under certain specific conditions? What would that life be like? These are the bigger questions found in Rick Barrys The Methuselah Project: A Novel. (The A Novel part is necessary because there is already, apparently, another book with The Methuselah Project as its title. I digress.)Barrys not writing philosophy, though, so you experience those questions in the narrative of the life of a man. A man who simply had his duty set before him, and then it all went wrong. That man is Roger Greene.This is a fairly straight forward science fiction/thriller novel. Is the science plausible? Possibly, though Barry is vague enough on the science that you realize its fictional. Then you have the thriller elements as Greene approaches the new world he lives in.I was surprised at the smaller number of fish-out-of-water moments for Greene. The focus was more on the survival/action of the moment. Which is a fine focus. It just wasnt quite what I expected.In the current Marvel-dominated media world, the comparisons between The Methuselah Project and Captain America cant be ignored. Barry has enough differences, though, to separate the two. The first being Greenes forced involvement, the work of a classic mad scientist, compared to Rogers voluntary work. Other items will be clear to the reader.I have no qualms recommending this as a sci-fi thriller to you, my readers. This includes a willingness to hand off my copy to youth readers like my children. There are some heavy plot moments, but all are handled with a respect for many peoples preference not to have all of the details of love or death.I like it. Its a good diversionary read, though wondering whats next? is the way this one leaves youI did receive a free copy in exchange for this review.

Soup for supper? On a road trip?You bet.Keep pasta warm? Indeed.Remarkably, the Stanley Food Jar works as it claims. If you put hot foods in it, they stay hot. Chili for the potluck dinner? Cooked, hot, and still hot after sitting out 3 or 4 hours.Why? The latches, all 4, work well. This holds the lid on securely. It does not leak even if tipped over, though I would recommend not transporting it upside down.The capacity is good for a family. Handle holds well. It also cleans easily.For us, a great addition for our kitchen and food transport needs.

First, I must admit to not wearing these. My wife does. It would have hurt a great deal to jam these through my lobes. She, on the other hand, has holes in her ears.Moving on--1. She does have sensitive ears. In the other words, earrings that are of too reactive of material cause pain. These do not.2. It is fairly clear that these are crystals. They are a touch big, but not too bad.3. These catch the light well and sparkle. All in all, a worth while pair of earrings.

On first inspection, my thought was...that's a seriously long-handled ladle.Which is the primary selling point here, though the flat-bottom is also relevant.Flat-bottom works great for spreading out sauce, and the 4 oz ladle holds the right amount for the pizzas we typically make.The long handle: 1. reaches well into the bottom of the really big sauce pot. That's the first good thing. 2. Allows one to pour sauce some distance away--not enough to avoid all splatters if you're careless, but still good enough. 3. Is great for ladling pancake batter to the back part of the large griddle.It is a bit harder to store in a basic kitchen, but I'll find a place better than just hooking it over the cabinet door.

I remember being a kid and learning to play Othello. On the box was the slogan "A Minute to Learn...A Lifetime to Master!" (Now, I think the Othello slogan is "Reversi without batteries!" but I digress.) That slogan applies well to the 5 Gears concept.First, of course, one should go out and learn to drive a stick shift. That helps the book make more sense.Overall: like most business/leadership books, the length is doubled by testimonials and case stories. That's okay, because these flesh out how the principles worked in individual lives. If you are a facts-without-stories person, skip them. The book reads faster that way. But then you'll miss some good inspiration along the way.The principles are drawn from the image of a stick-shift, and how there are times we need to be working through the gears of life to make progress. If we try and start out in fourth gear, we stall out.One thing I especially liked was how Kubicek worked to draw out differences in how this looks for introverts and extroverts. Obviously, a book has to be broadly-aimed and use some generalizations, but this helped narrow a few points for my use.I'd highly recommend this book, especially for those trying to work in an unstructured environment.

The fit is about right for a size 10.Color faded a little quickly in the first washing on the bright green shirt. Not sure if that's the product or the detergent.Shorts are sturdy enough for outside play.In all, considering how fast boys grow and wear out clothes, a decent value.

The question I always have with "store-brand" items is this: "What is the quality drop-off from the name brand I'm used to?"In this case, I don't see any. The markers aren't completely unscented, but they aren't insanely overdone. The lines are clear, they erase well, and the mileage I've gotten is comparable to the more expensive. These work as money-savers in place of the brand name. Standard big chisel tip.

The heavy duty gloves have proved useful for:1. Changing oil in the vehicle and keeping my hands clean.2. Working on the cleanup of the trash pile where the former owner of this house burned trash, including some broken glass.3. Pursuing a fugitive that escaped from an Alliance research facility with the help of her brother and is currently traveling on a junky transport ship.4. Dealing with animal carcasses in scraping roadkill out of the little street we live on.Here's how it is: these are good and thick. Perhaps on the edge of being unwieldy, but sturdy. They were easy to get on, and easy to take off.Also, if you're curious, you can operate a cell-phone touch screen with these on.

First: based on the Scope cap, it takes about 5 pumps to get the right amount of mouthwash.Now, on to the rest: it looks like a martini shaker on my bathroom counter, but that's fine because it looks better than leaving the 55-gallon drum of bulk mouthwash I purchased at the warehouse club on the counter.The pump stays clean looking, and though you can't see its level, you can tell that you need to put mouthwash on your shopping list when you empty the last of the bottle into the pump.I would have liked either a measuring line on the cup or a clear definition of how much is pumped each pump, but that's more preference than problem.Looks good, works fine.

I don't if I have a lousy face (no comments) or not, but I can't tell the difference between these 3-bladed razors and the more expensive 5-bladed I was using. So, that's the first observation: it cuts as well, or at least feels like it does, as the more expensive big brother.Second: blade sharpness feels like it has held for a week, with daily shaves.Third: the handle is fine on comfort. It's a razor, I'm not holding it for hours. It's a five to ten minute task.Fourth: cost. Check against your local stores. That's what the Amazon App is for.Fifth: the major drawback is no trimmer--you're shaving one way, one way only, and not getting close to that one edge.Overall--you can try one or two of these by buying it in a store, but they aren't too expensive and worth a shot.

Todays book is Understanding Prophecy from Kregel Academic. Authored by Alan S. Bandy and Benjamin L. Merkle, both of whom are New Testament professors at Baptist schools. (Bandy is also the author of The Prophetic Lawsuit in the Book of Revelation, which sounds fascinating.)On to the book at hand, which is substantially more affordable than Bandys Lawsuit volume. The prophetic passages of the bible are among the most studied and least understood, overall, as we often go to them as divination students rather than Biblical students. Authors Bandy and Merkle make the case in the introductory matters that when we look only to the end-of-time concepts in prophecy, we often miss what God is revealing about His character and His everyday work in the world.That is not to say there is no element of forward-looking in prophecy. Nor that we shouldnt check out those ideas, only that the Revelation (and Daniel, Isaiah, Ezekiel) is Gods Word about today, not just about that day.In view of this, we have a book with 10 chapters and 2 appendices guiding the reader through the concepts of the prophetic in Scripture. The authors do not attempt to explain every prophecy in the Bible. Instead, they present a framework for understanding prophecy.It follows that their presuppositions about Scripture and prophecy come through in the writing.
