I can't complain about this though because I wouldn't use those anyways, but for others who want to you might want to check other people's reviews and see if anyone else mentions this. I might have just gotten a factory defect one. I don't know. Like I said, I don't care, but for other potential buyers this could be an issue.Overall, I love this shirt. I'm wearing it for our family Christmas pictures. It's extremely comfortable and pretty. Every time I've worn this shirt sweatshirt I've received compliments on it.During a promotional period I received this shirt at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Easy to applySticks wellAdds personality**Cons**NoneI absolutely love this skin for my keyboard. It definitely adds a spark of personality. I have gotten a ton of compliments on it too.Applying the skin is incredibly easy. There are simple picture instructions on the back of the packaging.Directions (pictures to ago along with it too):1. Peel the white part around the sticker up. Leaving just the keyboard stickers on the sheet.2. In the package there is a thick plane white piece of paper. This is actual a clear adhesive. Peel it off and stick it on top of the keyboard stickers.3. Take a card or a coin and press it over the adhesive on the stickers to get them as smooth as possible. This is what makes the stickers transfer to the adhesive.4. Turn your computer all the way off. You can apply this with your computer on, but it's a pain. Just turn it off and save some hassle.5. Peel the adhesive. When you do this it should bring the keyboard stickers with it. If it doesn't, then you need to use your card and keeps smoothing. Also, start peeling from the right side, for whatever reason that side made it peel up effortlessly for me. (I did start on the left side as you can tell from the picture, but quickly moved to the right side.)6. This is a really important step. This is where you line the stickers up to the keyboard. I suggest starting in the middle and making sure it lines up all the way across. Take your time on this step because if you don't get it on straight it will be scratchy and worthless. Don't be scared or daunted it only took me about 30 seconds and some major eyeballing, but it does pay off.7. This is the most important step and the reason you turned your computer off. You need to smooth the stickers on to the keyboard trying your best to get out all the bubbles and making sure the stickers transfer. I didn't turn my computer off so I didn't smooth the stickers out as well as I should have and I regret this. Please learn from my mistake.8. Gently peel the adhesive. Do this slow and steady just to make sure the stickers transferred.9. Tidy it up. You can try and press out any bubbles you come across. I had a ton of bubbles because of the lack of smoothing, but I was able to gently peel the sticker corner up on a key and smooth it out. I no longer have any bubbles. Also, make sure to take the circle off the caps lock and the little slits off the pointer keys F and J.10. Enjoy your beautiful keyboard.I've been using this skin over over a week and haven't had any problems so far. The stickers have stayed on it, there isn't any peeling. I'm a writer and work from home so I'm on my computer for 10+ hours a day. Finger oils haven't been a problem so far, however, if you get down on the keyboard you can see fingerprints, but you have to get close to see them.Overall, this is a really great skin, fantastic quality, easy to apply. I've gotten a ton of compliments while at the coffee shop and my writing group on how awesome my keyboard is.During a promotional period I received this keyboard skin in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Gorgeous grinderHolds a decent amountLabeledGrinds greatSmooth turn**Cons**NoneMy husband is a pepper grinder snob. We received three grinders when we got married and have acquired so many more since then, but this one is by far our favorite.The color is gorgeous, it's a rich brown with silver plating. It looks really nice on our table giving it either a homey feel or a modern feel depending on my table setting. The top of the mill is labeled with a letter P for pepper, it's discreet, but there if you buy both the salt and pepper grinder and clean them out at the same time you'll still be able to tell which one is which.The canister holds a good amount, not a ton, but enough to make it a few weeks or longer depending on your pepper use. The grind is fantastic and exactly is perfect to spice any of your foods with. The best part about this grinder is how smooth it is to grind the pepper. It really is a flawless grinder.Overall, I highly, highly recommend this pepper grinder. It is fantastic and only 6.5 inches tall so it wont stick out or take up much room.During a promotional period I received this grinder in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**All levels of coloringFront only designsSoothingNice pages**Cons**NoneI adore adult coloring books. This particular coloring book is really awesome because it has pages for kids and adult, meaning the intricacy of the designs are basic to expert.There are 33 pages with designs on them plus the back inside cover has a coloring page design too. Each design is on its own page, the back of the page is blank, this allows you to color without worrying about bleeding through if you use markers or pens. It also allows you to tear the page out and frame it or hang it up if you want. The designs range from animals, geometric shapes, to mandalas.The designs are soothing and are great for calming down the nerves. I can see these being used for therapeutic purposes.The pages are good quality, not department store coloring book type. They're more like thick printing paper. They do curl up when you color on them, which isn't good if you plan on tacking the page up, but it's okay if you plan on pressing it behind a frame.Overall, this is a great coloring book for the whole family. It has great designs and will provide many hours of soothing entertainment. (The photos I have provided are only part of the page out of respect of the seller)During a promotional period I received this coloring book in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**72 different colorsLets colors flow easily - doesn't bleed colorsReusable case with snap closure**Cons**Not all same consistencyName of shade not listedThis is a great set of pencils for a coloring enthusiast. There are 72 different shades of colors, some are very similar, but they really are all different. The quality of the pencils is better than most. It takes little effort to use them. In the photo of each shade I did those by loosely holding the pencil and swiping back and forth, no pressure at all.I love that it comes with a plastic case to hold them. The quality of the case isn't great, but it will last the use of the pencils if you take care of it. I did find that it takes up a ton of space. If you don't need to transport these to and from class or anything like that then you can always cut the plastic packaging to separate the sections. This will allow you to open the case without taking up a full table.The only downside I found to the pencils is each wax is a little different, making the consistency between each pencil slightly different. Some of them were more moist and others were dryer and some had it so there was more color dust. For most this isn't anything noticeable, but if you're looking to use these for more of an artist use, then I'd take note if that would be an issue for you or not. Again, this isn't noticeable if you're just coloring or letting kids draw. Also, the name of the color is not listed on the pencil or the pack, so it's really based on what you see and trial and error to begin with. These aren't a big deal to me, but could be for others and is the reason why I'm posting about it.Overall, this is a fantastic set of color pencils that would be great for many people. Great for coloring, arts and crafts, writing notes, scrapbooking, and for many other occasions. These are good for all ages too, from toddler to adult.During a promotional period I received these colored pencils in exchange for an honest review.

Absolutely delicious beef sticks! The flavor is full, there's just a slight spice to it, but it's not spicy. My toddler took a bite and loved it, my husband thought they were great, and I couldn't eat enough of them. They're really one of the best beef sticks I've ever had. Great for all ages.They're moist, not watery, but enough so that they aren't dry and chewy. The only downside I found to these beef sticks is that they're extremely addicting!These make wonderful snacks, an addition to a lunch box, something to grab while on the go.During a promotional period I received these beef sticks at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**ComfortableLuxuriousBeautifulFold down waist band**Cons**NoneI ordered the Chiffon Fabric Paisley Peacock Blue in a size small. These are accurate to the size. Measure your hips and waist and choose that size because they will fit. I was impressed with that. They're also quite long for pants, which makes me want to give these even more stars because I have long legs and it's hard to find pants to fit.The pants are thin and breathable. I had no problems with them being too thin or being see through. The material feels almost silky making them luxuriously comfortable. You can dress them up or down. Wear them out or just to lounge around in. I am impressed with the color of the pants, they're definitely high quality.Overall, I am in love with the quality of the pants, the material is fantastic, and they can be worn in many situations.During a promotional period I received these Palazzo Pants at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I really dislike writing a review when I don't care for the book, but I also know it's appreciated so others know what they're getting into.This book has a great general idea, but I feel like it was rushed and never went through a proper editing process. There were hardly any contractions, which made the dialogue feel unrealistic with everyone talking so proper.I was disappointed in the climax. It lasted two pages, it was completely rushed, and spotty. It was all telling and no showing.I truly do like the idea of the story, the background, and the dual point of view, but the book needs to be edited. When it goes through that process I believe it will end up being a favorite for some people, but until then it's just a choppy mess.

This was my first bear shifter book and I loved it. I adore fated mates and this left me feeling full and satisfied. Jess and Thomas have both been cheated on by their previous partners and are left a bit depressed by it. Coincidences keep bringing these two together.Even though it's a short story it feels complete and whole. There's nothing crazy going on in this shifter world, just moving on from s***ty exes and moving into the arms of your true mate. It's a quick standalone read that is full of sweet tenderness.

Read this series! Hands down, one of my all time favorite! I have loved every moment with these characters, from the horrible moments to the sweet ones.This book is the final book in Violet's Story and it doesn't let you down. It picks up just after we left off in the second books, The Faerie Prince. You'll be taken on a journey with Violet to get her memories back and to stop the war, but it's never like it seems.I don't want to give anything away because these books were so enjoyable that when I finished it and I couldn't turn another page on my Kindle I just sat there staring at it for 15 minutes.I. Didn't. Want. It. To. End.Violet and Ryn are still very much part of this book and you even get dual point of view. I love Ryn's humor, it helps give light in an otherwise bleak world.Overall, I can't get enough. I want more of Violet and Ryn! Really this book is full of joy and heartache and hope, you will love them.:::Spoiler::: Why did it have to end with their parents kind of having a thing for each other?! Why? I wanted a better happy ever after for Vi and Ryn! I didn't want the awkwardness of their parents being together.I received a copy to read and review in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Bumps and ticklersHits g-spotStays in placeFlexible**Cons**Vibration is extremely softThis is a nice vibrator for people who want something tame. I'm sure it wouldn't be for some people especially those who are new to the adult toy world.Overall, this is a nice vibrator. I love having a handle for such a small vibrator. You will need one AA battery. I didn't try it in the water because it didn't look fully waterproof to me even though it says it is, try at your own risk.During a promotional period I received this vibrator at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

Librarian and a biker! Hell yeah! Aren't all of us reader ladies wannabe librarians? Or is that just me? I loved this book. The characters were fun to meet.Ryker was every bit of a biker man that I expect. He has Hellions on him all the time, no settling down, ever!, takes no s***, and territorial as hell.Elizabeth, aka Pinky, was one hell of a girl, maybe a bit quiet at times, but she got her backbone by the end and put Ryker in his place. I loved seeing her character grow and get a bit of a biker attitude.The story didn't have much to it except an ex that still wanted to have some action. Nothing crazy at all. It was very much Sweet.

These colored pencils are beautiful. I love everything from the black box they're in to the simple black pencils. They're very modern and grown up. The pencils do not have any writing on them, not even a color. It does come with 12 colors (black, brown, purple, blue, light blue, green, light green, red, pink, orange, yellow, and peach).The color flows right off the pencil. I had no problem blending the colors, it was smooth and didn't glide everywhere, but just enough to take the harsh lines out.Overall, these are decent colored pencils. They're a beautiful set and the colors are great. Great for drawing and coloring for all ages.During a promotional period I received these colored pencils in exchange for an honest review.

What an absolutely beautiful and enthralling retelling that takes your through Thomas's dark, hurting, playboy life, to a man who feels, cares, and loves like no man ever has! You can read this book by itself without reading The Sound of Salvation, but I highly, highly recommend reading both. They're so different despite being about the same thing. It is quite extraordinary! I deeply enjoyed Nadia's point of view in The Sound of Salvation, but nothing compares to reading Thomas's point of view. I said before that I need Thomas like I need air to breathe and this book solidified the fact that he is the perfect book boyfriend.I.A. Dice did it again. She created this beautiful story that was much more intense and obsessively sweet. Thomas is a character that you will enjoy being in his head, seeing things from his point of view. He isn't perfect, but boy does he try.I seldom come across a book that will leave me one hundred percent sated, but this book was everything a romance should be. Each of I.A. Dice's novels are complete masterpieces at taking you on a beautiful journey. If you're looking for a new book to read then grab this book, you won't be disappointed.I received an ARC in exchange for an honest review.

What the-? What did I just read? I was excited to jump into a sexy alpha biker story, but instead I got a twisted, warped, hell of a story.I didn't care for the heroine in the story, Nicole, she kind of creeped me out. She's definitely a strong female, but kind of crazy. Weird wasn't a strong enough term to define her. She starts off as a boring college girl and 10 pages in the story she wants to spit on a couple of guys to put them in their place. It felt pretty unrealistic like that through most of the story.Nicole and Jase are an interesting couple that we get to follow along with their story, but it really isn't about them. This story is quite amazing with how everything tied together. I knew exactly what was going on from the beginning, but I didn't know the extent that it went. The twists Nikki Pink created was amazing. It really is a masterpiece how she stitched the story together.It's told from multiple points of view, not just Jase and Nicole, but a few other people as well. I'm disappointed that we didn't get to clear things up (Bigfella or the sheriff). I'm also highly disappointed Nicole's family wasn't brought up especially her father in clearing up Bigfella. Maybe it's in the next book, but it feels like it should be in this book since it pertains to these characters.If you're looking for a wild ride then look no further, this has it all, murder, sex, psycho characters, lies, arrests, interrogations. It could use some tidying up and loose ends fixed, but it is an interesting read.

Fantastic quality dice. These aren't factory seconds and you can tell! I could barely tell the difference in the orange and red, I really think they both looked about the same with different color for the numbers.These are designed just like any other dice except the d4, I've never seen a d4 where it's read from the number that is touching the table, usually you read the number by what is at the tip when it's rolled. They're great for DnD, Pathfinder, board games, math lessons, etc...During a promotional period I received these dice at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I love how simple this thermometer is. You can definitely use it right out of the box, but I highly recommend reading the directions so you learn how to do the fast calc and know the other guidelines for the thermometer. I am really impressed with the fast calc feature. It makes this thermometer worth it!The display is wonderful. It's simple and large which makes it incredibly easy to read. The probe has a nice tip making it easy to poke through all types of food. The best part about this thermometer is the temperature range, you can measure out hot oil for frying or to make sure your chocolate temperature is right, you can even check to make sure your cold items have hit the right temperature. To clean the thermometer just get a sponge hot and soapy and wipe the probe down.The only thing I dislike about is that it doesn't have an off button. It auto shuts off after 2 minutes. I realize it's not a big deal, but I like to conserve things when I can and an off button would help prolong the battery life longer than the 18 month prediction.Overall, I like the simplicity of this thermometer, it's a no frills get right to the point thermometer, I just wish it had an off button.During a promotional period I received this thermometer in exchange for an honest review.

This is a beautiful, classic, yet modern frame. It's not anything extraordinarily fancy, but it does look really nice. It does not have glass, which is both good and bad. I purchased the Christmas theme washi tape set, but I received the Nature theme set. I was perfectly okay with this because I like the polka dots and the chevron stripes in the Nature set.If you're new to washi tape then let me point you to a quick Google or Pinterest search for Washi Tape Projects. You can get an idea of all the things you can do with Washi Tape through that. The benefits of washi tape is that it doesn't leave a sticky residue, or any residue. It wont tear up pictures or paper. This means you can decorate a wall with washi tape if you're in a rental and want something beside plain white walls. You can scrap book without worrying about destroying pictures by taping them down. This stuff is really wonderful.I mostly got these for my planner. I like adding a little color here and there to make it fun. These 5 rolls are pretty and add a nice color. There's greens and purples and blues in the Nature theme set. I've put them in my planner  to help me get to the notes section easier. I even put them on some tea lights so they aren't that ugly silver color. I had to peel some off my desk and it didn't leave any residue and it was still sticky so I could put it on my project after peeling it off the desk.Overall, I really like the Nature set, they were just the right colors and patterns for my taste. The tape is wonderful quality and exactly what I expect out of washi tape.During a promotional period I received this washi tape set at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**SturdyPretty7 hooksDecent sizeMultiple uses**Cons**None**Measurements**The rack is 16.5 inches wide and 9 inches tall. It will fit on a door that is slightly less than 2 inches thick.I ordered this in 7 Hooks Black. The design is attractive and not just a plain ol' door rack. I am extremely pleased with it. I keep it next to my front door on the closet door and it is quite lovely to have there. I just stick my purse and jacket on a peg and they're waiting on me when I leave the house.The hooks are quite sturdy. I can put my huge 5 pound purse on one and it hasn't bent a hook yet. I'm sure over time it will slowly start bending with the purse being pulled and just general wear and tear of it being used so much. However, I can say that it is a great door rack and will serve its purpose for quite some time. You could use it in a bathroom for towels, in a coat closet for scarves, hats and gloves, or in a garage to organize chords. It's very versatile and a good quality.During a promotional period I received this door rack in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Brightens roomLets light into the showerComes with hooksMetal eyeletsModern designSoft**Cons**NoneI adore this shower curtain! It's absolutely beautiful and definitely brightens up my bathroom. It's really wonderful if you don't have a light over your tub because this curtain lets light through. It's the best thing about this curtain for us.I love the design on it. The tree really adds a nice modern touch that will go with a lot of themes or even be the center of a theme for the bathroom. That was one hell of a ride! Definitely a book you should pick up if you're into sexy fighters. The story is a roller coaster ride for the heroine, Rowan. She has a past that's eating at her every day, but she fights it especially when she sees her daughter for the first time.Jax, a sexy MMA fighter, doesn't know what hits him, or squeezes his hand, until it's way too late for him. He's the epitome of perfection. Sweet, caring, understanding, loving. Can we make a machine that makes fictional characters real? I want Jax!I'm used to the fighter stories having the MMA always playing a huge role in the story, but it wasn't that was for this book. Family was the center of this story. The climax wasn't intense like a fighter story normally is, but it definitely grips your heart.This is a book to get lost in. Pick it up and find yourself aching to be cherished by Jax. and craving to know more about the rest of the guys. It's a standalone which will make you angry because you'll want more of Jax and the story with his dad. What's the rest of the story there? Grrr!

**Pros**Great sizeSeals greatMicrowave/dishwasher safe**Cons**FlimsyIf you're in to meal planning or just portion control these are good containers. They have two compartments. I had to break them apart with my fingernail. I thought I had gotten them completely unsealed and started to pull them apart and ripped one of the containers because I didn't fully break the seal. My fault, but be careful if you buy these.They are extremely light and thin plastic. They are quite flimsy (or what they say is flexible) and the reason why I docked a star. After it cracking on me from pulling the containers apart and how thin they are I feel they're flimsy. I've only used them for one week though.I love that they're microwave safe so I can prep my meals for the week and then heat them up each day. Plus they're dishwasher safe which saves me time and money.The best thing about these containers is that they seal fantastically. I didn't test them with liquids, but I know the lids sealed. Plus the individual containers didn't seal completely, but it's still marked off so steam stays in the appropriate compartment. This was great when I had piping hot potatoes and a cold salad. The hot rice steam stayed on its side and the salad stayed cool.Overall, these are good starter containers. They're quite affordable and will last a good amount of time if you take care of them. Just be cautious the first time you pull them apart.During a promotional period I received these two compartment containers at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

1:13 Mins**Pros**Easy to useDurableSensitive controlsComes with a memory cardFully equipped**Cons**NoneSome assembly is required before using this drone, it is not ready to fly right out of the box. You have to attach the camera, legs, and blade guards. A small screwdriver was provided. The camera is attached to the battery cover so the camera will always be on it while flying even if you don't want to use the camera. Spare blades and screws were provided. You will need 4 AA batteries for the remote. Assembly only takes a couple minutes if this is your first drone, less if you know what you're doing and not reading the instructions for everything.This is our first time being around a drone, let alone flying one. I recorded the first flight so you can see from the drones point of view the first flight. It was much easier than we expected, but it was also not a great flight. It will take a lot of practice to fly it perfectly. One thing I can definitely say to be mindful of is landing, you have to be mindful on your throttle especially on decreasing altitude, you have to pull back the throttle slowly or the drone will drop out of the air.The controls are extremely sensitive so be careful. You aren't playing an intense video game where you have to move the joystick as far as it'll go to avoid being shot. The remote for this drone moves at the slightest touch! This is great for those who get the hang of flying.We flew it around a few times, never really testing the range of it because we aren't confident enough with it yet. I'll come back in a month or two after getting the hang of it and really put some specs in. However, after using it a few times I can say this drone is extremely durable. We've had several hard landings, one that practically crash landed and the drone was perfectly fine.The video on the drone is awesome. I love that it comes with the memory card so you can get started right away. The video clarity is decent. This drone comes fully equipped with everything you need to fly the drone and to record. Plus it comes with a USB drive that you plug the memory card into so you can upload your photos and videos to the computer.My only suggestion when buying this drone is read the instructions first and make sure you have an idea of what you are doing. Then take small test drives, just going up and landing. Then build from there, rotating, turning, etc... It's not hard to fly, but it takes a bit to wrap your mind around how to maneuver it.Overall, I think this is an excellent drone for beginners. It's easy to use and you'll get better with practice. It comes with everything you need to fly and record.During a promotional I received this Zuzo Drone at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

The cables of the launcher stretch really far, but aren't flimsy, they're strong and durable.We weren't trying to launch the balloons as far as they would go because we were entertaining our three year old, but even with a little pull back these things got 200-300 feet. we attached each handle to our hammock stand, which was very useful for this, but I think to get the 200 yards you would need 3 people to pull in the correct directions to get it to go super far.The hammock of the launcher is a great size and great quality. The quality is great that I don't think it can break unless you're abusive to it.Overall, this launcher is a ton of fun. You can create a lot of games using this, wreck some havoc, or just show off.During a promotional period I received this launcher at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Doesn't get stuckBrightBig (13 inches)Lots of fun**Cons**LoudBattery eaterDo you have a friend that you love annoying to death and love spoiling their child? Then this is the perfect gift for them!The fun stuff first. This toy is about 13 inches long so it's good size toy that would be great for babies that are crawling all the way up to about 5-7 years old depending on their maturity and toy preference. The music is catchy and will keep a kid moving and having fun. The light are entertaining and bright, they look 3D in person like the star glob is floating in the train. Plus the lights flash with the music. The best part is, the train never gets stuck against a wall, it bumps into it and immediately spins and keeps moving until it hits something and then it rotates again. Wonderful toy to keep a child entertained.The annoying stuff now. The lights are extremely bright, if you're kid wants the lights in the house off to have fun with this toy then expect to see strobe light quality flashing. The music gets does get annoying because it's so loud that it's the only thing you can hear. I have the loudest dishwasher ever made and this toy drowns that noise out. My big dog barks the first time it comes on and then goes into another room to stay away from it. Our neighbors small dog came over and hated this toy, he yapped at it before leaving the house rather quickly. I think it's so loud it hurts their ears. Plus this toy eats batteries like no other. I have rechargeable Energizer batteries that I made sure were fully charged. I put all 3 in and within 3 days the batteries were dead, I already had another set of batteries charged so I put those in and again in 3 days the train was dead. That's with about 1-2 hours a day of use, maybe more.Overall, this would make a great gift for someone else, but probably not the toy you would get for your own home until they make a volume button on the train or just lower the sound because a piece of tape covering the speaker barely helps.During a promotional period I received this train at a discount exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Large PackGreat lengthConnectors providedBright glowLasts 6-12 hours**Cons**NoneI originally got these for GISHWHES, but have found so many more uses for them than silly props. They're great for raves, the Neon Run, 4th of July, New Years, birthday parties, sleep overs, camping, homeschooling, or just to have some fun with the kiddos.This pack comes with three tubes, each tube has 100 glow sticks and 100 connectors for a total of 300 glow stick and connectors. It to me a minute to find the connectors, you have to pull all the glow sticks out and they're under them in their own little bag, but don't worry they glow sticks are in a bubble wrap pouch so it makes it easy to put back up.I love that there were connectors so you could make bracelets, necklaces, sashes, or go all out and make a skirt or something else that's extravagant... there's enough glow sticks that you could make something awesome.I have a 3 year old son so he had fun searching for the glow sticks in the dark and counting them. He also made shapes and fun designs out of them in the floor one evening. I never thought to use these in a classroom setting, but I'm sure there are a lot of things you could do with them for elementary kids to have fun and learn.There are 5 different colors, pink, orange, yellow, green, and blue. Once I cracked them they lasted about 6 to 12 hours depending on how much you crack them.Overall, I think every parent and teacher should have a pack of glow sticks. You never know when you're going to want or need them. They're great rainy day fun or just something to turn off the lights and let your kids be entertained for hours with the glow sticks.During a promotional period I received this pack of glow sticks in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Devilishly handsomeDetailsBottom straps**Cons**LargeWe needed these boot tops for my husband's halloween costume. **Pros**CoolStays in placeComes off easyNo residue**Cons**The masks were hugeJust like any beauty product this isn't a quick results product. I'm half way through this package of 6 and I see a small difference, but nothing major so far. I'll post an update after my final use in the box so you can compare my first and last use in the box to see what it did for me.I have huge bags under my eyes that are hereditary and I've tried just about every under eye cream, roller, balm, mask out there to try and get them to diminish, but haven't found anything that works. I'm not 100% impressed with these masks, but I can see that they would work after many, many uses and I'm not sure if it would be worth the price in the long run.This package comes with 6 uses. My first use I put them on during the day because I was worried about something being on that delicate skin for so long and I wanted to watch it and make sure I didn't have a reaction. I kept them on for 7.5 hours and they were cool all day, they didn't move, and were only slightly bothersome, which wouldn't be a problem at night while you're sleeping. They're slightly thick/puffy when you first put them on because of the sticky residue that does it's job. However, after 7-8 hours they're fairly thin.Try to get them lined up great because the masks are huge and long when they're on your face, at least that's how they felt. They nearly reached my temples.When you take them off they just peel right off, there's no pulling or pain involved. There's also not any residue on your face, it peels completely off. My skin felt so soft and tight after removing them, just like any face mask.Overall, I think if you have major wrinkles this would be a great product to start with and tighten the skin around your eyes. I don't think it's worth it for under eye bags or dark circles, but I could change my mind about that (I still have 3 uses left and I'm using them every other night).During a promotional period I received this Oxygen Eye Mask in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**12 unique colorsGlitterySmooth glideMinimal scratchingTextured gripCaps stay on end of pen**Cons**Light green color is closer to yellowYellow color is closer to orangeI've loved gel pens since I was a girl in the 90's when they were a fad. **Pros**Tinker toyDurableHours of funDoesn't get stuck**Cons**NoneThis gets 5+ stars from us! My 3-year-old son adores this truck. Plus the tires come off so you can teach about rotating tires and fixing flats. It's the perfect toy to take outside when mom/dad is working on the car and your son/daughter wants to help.The truck requires 3 AA batteries (not included). Out of the fires of Orodruin, and forgotten for many centuries, the One Ring has passed unto me. I have had the pleasure of purchasing this artifact from a merchant for far below it's worth, in exchange I agreed to let my opinions of this Ring be known to the world*. I believe it may be safe to say this merchant knew not of the treasure they traded away.Unlike the other great rings, the One Ring holds no gem and has no intricate designs on it, at least at first glance. However on closer inspection you can see in elven runes on both the inside and outside of the ring, and in the language of the black speech the words (translated into English):One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them,One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them.As the Ring has traveled from the realm of Middle Earth, it has lost some of it's magical properties. Since I have been in possession of it, I have not turned invisible or seen the invisible (wraiths or otherwise). The Ring has remained the same size from the time I have bore it to present, without it leaving me of it's own will. And I have not felt the presence of any other ring bearers. I will say that I have had a strong urge to keep it and the thought of losing it troubles me greatly.I have not verified Isildur's research by testing the mettle of this Ring, nor would I wish any harm to come upon it. But after several days of wearing and normal hand washing, it appears to have not changed in the slightest.When I first donned this Ring, it fit well as the merchant described it's size accurately, but it weighed my hand down with a weight I was not accustomed to. It is, however, becoming a natural weight to me, although quite a bit heavier than my wedding band. It is also fairly thick too, but not too much to be troublesome. If, for whatever reason, if this Ring didn't fit or was uncomfortable, a chain secured around the neck will keep this close to the heart at all times.All in all, I believe I will keep my precious for quite some time.*During a promotional period I received this ring at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**StylishThin Material**Cons**StiffNot wide enoughHard to put onToo tight (not tall enough)Let me start by saying, we're a barefoot family. We have extremely healthy feet because we rarely wear shoes. However, we do know shoes are a tool. When the blacktop is too hot to walk barefoot, it's great to put shoes on. Since my son has only worn shoes a dozen times in his 3 years of life he has really wide feet, nicely spaced toes, and a high arch, which makes finding shoes difficult.Shoes should be flexible to move with the natural movements of your feet, they should be comfortable, not tight and not loose. These shoes were none of those things. My son wears a size 9.5 shoe, so I ordered a size 10. As soon as I got them I thought they were absolutely adorable. Then I pulled them out of the box and immediately tried to bend them frontwards and backwards and they were so stiff. I held out hope that maybe it was just because they were new and I should try to work them in. I did that for a bit, but didn't feel like they loosened up any.We had to do some errands so I let my son wear them out. I forgot to take a picture of them as soon as he put them on so you get a picture after a day of going out and getting them nice and dirty. They were extremely hard to put on over the top part of his feet because the tops of his feet are really tall, I had to stretch them as far as they could go and still had to (unfortunately) shove his foot into it. When they were on he had a difficult time walking in them because they were so stiff. He has never stumbled (except when he was learning to walk), but these shoes had him tripping a few times. After a couple hours of wearing them we came home and he immediately wanted them off, but couldn't take them off himself because they were so tight. When I pulled them off there were indents on his feet from the shoes squeezing his feet.Overall, I think the shoes are cute, but they're not for our family. I do not think they made these shoes with the health of your feet in mind.During a promotional period I received these toddler shoes at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**LightHas some giveGreat sizeEasy to maneuverDurable**Cons**Too FlexibleI have a small 2 foot deep by 10 feet long pool for my son and we have a ton of trees in our yard so there's always bugs and leaves getting in it. Plus he likes to get out and back in with grass all over his feet. That's a good amount of water to drain frequently so I thought a pool skimmer net would be a good investment.This net is nice because you can use it with or without a pole. The buttons on the skimmer to attach to a handle are easy to press. However, I don't have a pole because my pool is so small. I really liked that the outer plastic edge was thinner than most net skimmers. This helps brush it against the sides or the bottom of the pool and actually get more gunk out. The net is very fine mesh that got out the smallest of dirt and bugs from the pool. I appreciated how much give the net has. If you look at the pictures you can see it isn't pulled tight against the net, there's what looks like ripples in the mesh, that's how much give it has. My 3-year-old son wanted to help clean the pool so I let him use the net skimmer and it held up against his abuse without any problems at all.The only downside I did find was that even though it's flexible so that it bends just a little as you move it through the water, it was so flexible it bent at one point. I was able to bend it back like you would a spoon after digging out frozen ice cream. I'm sure it was because my son was playing in the pool while I was cleaning it and the water was moving around, but it's still something I wanted to note for others.Overall, this is a nice net skimmer. It This feels durable, it's made with longevity in mind, and can be used with or without a handle.During a promotional period I received this pool skimmer net at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Easier than false lashesLong Lasting!!!Creates gorgeous lashes**Cons**Fiber gets everywhereThis is how I did my lashes:1. Apply gel (the black end) to lashes with one single sweep to wet lashes and spread them evenly.2. Immediately apply fiber (beige end) to lashes.3. Apply one more coat of gel to lashes.4. Brush off fiber from face.This was my first time using any type of fiber lash mascara so I had no idea what to expect. I've seen so many posts on how amazing fiber lash mascara is, but it's taken me a while to jump on board. I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it is to apply. It's basically like putting on regular mascara, it does take an extra 10-15 seconds to do.I have used a ton of different mascaras, every drugstore brand, Lorac, and what was my favorite Urban Decay, but I've noticed with each of them, by the end of the day my lashes have drooped, they're no longer curled up giving me that bright eyed look. This fiber lash mascara, honestly, lasted ALL day! My lashes had very minimal drooping. I even slept in it one night and woke up without it smudged at all.I was very impressed that the mascara gel wasn't goopy and it didn't clump my lashes together at all. The gel is tinted black so you don't need any other mascara unless your lashes are extremely fair. I love the brush, it's one of the best brushes I've used, it separates my lashes really well. The fiber brush was odd to me, it was just the stem with fiber coating it, there wasn't any bristles or anything.You can't use regular face wash to get the mascara off, I tried, and it just smudged it all around my eyes. You do need an eye makeup remover. I use a generic kind from the supercenter and it took the mascara off without any problems.I have included pictures to show my lashes without any mascara (before) and what my lashes look like after applying this fiber lash mascara (after). The only problem I found with the mascara is that the fiber gets everywhere and I would assume any fiber mascara would do this, but I wasn't expecting that since this was my first time using it. The fiber is not tinted so you can wipe it away without an marks getting on you. I've included a photo to show what the fiber looks like when it drops on your face.Overall, I adore this mascara. I like wearing false lashes, but it would cost a lot to wear them daily so I only wear them for special occasions. However, with this fiber lash mascara, I can get that extra oomph without the extra cost.During a promotional period I received this fiber lash mascara in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**LightweightComfortableVersatileStylish**Cons**"Belt"**Size**Should fit most people between a US size 2-14People under 5'3 these might be a bit longAnyone over 5'9 these might be too shortI am always hesitant about buying pants online because I can rarely find any that fit me. If I wear them any higher they become too short though.They're a beautiful black color with a slight shimmer in them. The pants consist of two layers and inner layer and an outer layer. The inner layer is black without any shimmer, but it's very thin and see through. The outer layer is black with the shimmer and extremely thin and see through. Together you can't see through them unless they whip in the wind, but don't worry you can't see your underwear through them unless you wear something extremely bright like neon yellow.The waist of the pants is elastic, which is how it's made for a one size fits all. There is a belt with the pants, but it does not help cinch the pants up, it's there purely for decoration purposes. I, personally, thought the belt was not needed and quite ugly. It reminds me of something that would come with draperies. Plus it's so long I had to wrap it around my waist twice. After having the belt on there for a couple of days I've now taken it off and love the pants even more.To wash them I suggest putting them in a delicates bag in the washer then hanging them to dry.The pants are super cute and can be dressed up or down. You can tuck the shirt in or keep it out, either way will be stylish. Plus it would make a great beach cover up. I prefer to wear the pants with tank tops tucked in for more of a hippie look. I definitely think these are spring/summer pants, They're way to thin to wear in the cooler months.Overall, I love these pants. I wear them everywhere! They're perfect for lounging or wearing out on the town.During a promotional period I received these casual pants at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Super softAbsorbentCleans hands/mouthGreat for bath timePerfect size for little hands**Cons**None**Measurements**12 inches by 4 inches (about an inch thick)My son absolutely adores this hand towel. When I pulled it out of the package he gasped and said, "So cute!" I placed the towel in the kitchen next to my towel and he takes the extra time to dry his hands off because it's almost like a toy. He thinks the little fabric pieces are funny and tickle him.When it was time for bath the other night he went to the towel and asked to take it with him. I thought he might want to use it to cover his eyes while I wash his hair, but that wasn't the case. He wanted to play with it and use it to wash his body. It worked just like any other hand towel would except it doubled as a bath toy, plus we played like the panda was tickling him. I know it wasn't designed for bath use, so it use that way with caution.If you use it in the bath I suggest wringing it out really well and hanging it to dry afterwards. I washed and dried it by placing it in a delicates bag and it held up perfectly.I love the colors of the panda towel, the purple is very vibrant and bold. The stitching is fantastic on the panda and hidden on one side. The loop is perfect to hang on a hook or to loop it through the panda to hold on to a bar. I'm a huge fan of microfiber because it is deceptively soft.Overall, if your child doesn't take the time to dry their hands or they want a fun bath washer, I would highly recommend this hand towel. Plus when your child out grows the towel, microfiber is fantastic to clean/dust with so you'll have it for many, many years.During a promotional period I received this kids hand towel in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Deceptively sharpFits great in handScissors have large hand areaScissors are sharpHolder is adjustableAffordable**ConsFlimsy holder for scissorsEvery kitchen needs a quality set of knives. I have a ton of stainless steel knives in my knife drawer, but ever since I got this set of ceramic knives I've reached for them every single time I need a knife.There are four sizes of knives (6, 5, 4, and 3 inches). I really wish the largest knife had been an 8 inch blade, but the 6 inch is decent and can be used for most things. The blades are ceramic so you have to be mindful of not bending the knives while cutting your food. Plus the ceramic blade is sharp, deceptively sharp and wont need to be sharpened.The downside to them being ceramic is you cannot use a glass or marble cutting board. I have invested in a set of rubbery plastic cutting boards and have since put my marble board up. Also, the knives are not dishwasher safe, but they're super easy to clean. Food doesn't stick to them plus they're white so you can see if they're truly clean. Please be careful while cleaning the knives, I nearly cut through my sponge because I was cleaning them how I would any other knife.The knives are very comfortable in the hand. They have a rounded handle that fits great in your palm. Plus there's an extended piece over the blade by your fingers so you don't cut yourself while holding the knife. The holder for the knives is phenomenal. You can move each knife holder to slant at an angle or stand up straight. I love this because it lets you customize how you want to set it up in your kitchen.The bonus pair of scissors is absolutely wonderful. They have a big handle so your fingers can fit easily. The blades are super sharp and can cut thin strips of meat. I do have to say the holder for the scissors is quite flimsy and I can see it bending if you aren't careful.Overall, I think this knife set will outlast any stainless steel woodblock set.During a promotional period I received this knife set at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**AffordableGreat Quality10 cards/10 envelopesPostcard sizeBeautiful**Cons**NoneWhat a perfect Father's Day card set. It comes with 10 cards, 5 of each design. The red card is very much for a father figure. However the peach/cream card could be sent to anyone, which makes this set even more perfect.The cards are smaller than most greeting cards, but I found I liked the small size better. They're 3.5 inches by 5 inches and were perfect for my son to draw (write) on. The quotes on the front aren't sappy, but they are sentimental and convey how much you appreciate your father/husband/grandpa.The quality of the cards is exceptional. I was afraid they would be like folded card stock, but that wasn't the case. They're thick like a greeting card you would pick up in the store. The envelopes come with a place so you can lick it and seal it. The cards fit perfectly inside the envelopes.Overall, I think this is a beautiful set of cards that would make any father happy to receive.During a promotional period I received this set of Father's Day cards at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

**Pros**Resealable bagPleasant aromaChewySweet and bitterOrganic!!!**Cons**Sticks to teethMy husband is a big snacker at work and he loves dried fruit. I've never seen Goji berries in our local store so I was excited when I found them here on Amazon. I don't really know much about Goji berries, but they smelt sort of like raisins. They had a unique taste almost salty, I think the best way to explain it is the bitterness of a cranberry and the sweetness of a raisin combined.These Morning Pep Goji berries are chewy and delicious! They're the perfect snack that you can feel safe about eating or giving to your kids because they're organic. They only have 1 ingredient, raw goji berries. You can even cook with them if you wanted to make cookies or put them on top of your salad.I really loved that they came in a resealable bag, that makes it nice for my husband to throw in his desk drawer and know that they wont spill and they'll stay fresh longer. The seal is nice and strong and easy to close with a pinch of your fingers.Overall, I'm pleased with these dried goji berries. They're definitely different from other dried fruits and have an addicting flavor.During a promotional period I received these dried goji berries at a discount in exchange for an honest opinion.

You can set your phone up on a tripod, on the roof of you car, on the table and step back and snap a picture. It's great for family photos where you want everyone in the picture. The remote is small and fits discreetly in your hand, which allows you to take photos that look flawless. It is waterproof, but that means it can be used in the rain, not in the pool. Works at least 40 feet away, I didn't try any further than that.Overall, I think this should be on everyone's keyring because you never know when you're going to need/want it. It works great and the button is easy to push. Plus you don't have to worry about charging it!During a promotional period I received this wireless remote in exchange for an honest review.
perfect fit, good quality although shirt is thin so you need to wear a t-shirt under it. Otherwise, it washes well, holds up nicely in the dryer and was perfect for school pictures, holidays, etc

My son has been asking for this jacket for months. It had to denim. It had to be Levi's brand. It had to be grey. I think he saw some character on TV wearing it. But I went with size Medium figuring Medium typically translates to a size 10. The size was perfect, I'd say maybe a 10/12. The jacket is a heavy denim material, great for fall weather. cord is really thin and short, but for what I need it works fine

Love, love, love the colors! It's bright and fun, but not "too girly". The colors are graduated from light to dark purple. Fabric is 100% polyester so colors won't run. The holes at the top for the hooks are stitched rather than metal. Size is 72 x 72" which fits standard bathtub/showers. Item arrived quickly and seller was fantastic to deal with. Would happily purchase again

I had mixed feelings about this book. Overall, it was good. I love the series and went into this book expecting greatness. This book probably had the most YA feel to it though, which was a slight let down.So, this book starts with Luminescent Juliet ready to kick off on their first big tour. Romeo, lead guitarist and band manager (and our hero from book one) decides to hire college student Peyton to tour with the band doing publicity and blogging. She is aspiring to be a writer for a rock magazine so this would be an ideal job... if it weren't for Sam. Sam, bassist for the band, is the twin brother of  Peyton's ex boyfriend from high school. When Peyton and Seth's relationship ended badly, she was destroyed, so she and Sam basically hate each other. They agree to put their past aside and get through the tour together. Like that's going to go well.Overall, the romance part of the storyline was predictable, but not in a terrible way. I did feel like the way the book handled Seth's mental illness and Sam's coping through drug use were what really made the book take on it's YA feel.  These are strong topics and could have taken a darker view, but that's tough to do in a YA book without getting too dark.  But what saved the story for me was the characters. The characters are really well written and genuinely likeable. I also really liked the attention Gabe in this book. He's been a bit of a jerk in previous books, so I was glad to see his character develop and become more likeable in preparation for his story in the next book.

Stay With Me is book 3of the Wait For You series.  It can be read as a stand alone, but character development works better if you read the stories in order. I really wanted to love this story. I loved the previous books and had been looking forward to learning more about Calla. The storyline has a lot of potential and I was pulled in at the start, wanting to learn more about Calla's back story and how she plans to fix the mess her mother has left her in. But I soon found myself really disliking Calla. I really have no patience for stupid characters. She is beyond nave. Ok, so she is a virgin. But the way her character was written, it's like she's been living under a rock. Her virginity is used as a crutch and a free pass to excuse her stupid decisions in every aspect of her life. Plus, she didn't exactly grow up sheltered. Her naivet seems to extend not only to her comfort level in sexual situations but also to her lack of decision making around her personal safety as well. After growing up exposed to drugs, gangs, and prostitution, she still has no idea how much danger she puts herself into by living in her mother's house and poking around in her mother's sketchy dealings.  She had a drug dealer threatening her. She was attacked in her mother's "abandoned" home and yet she still stays there and tries to handle everything on her own. The only thing she does actually stress over (and over and over and over) is her scar and how Jax could possibly be attracted to her (even though he assures her repeatedly that he is). Halfway through the book I found myself internally yelling at her to stop whining about her scars and do something to actually protect her safety.This story is not a good representation of the author's writing, and really doesn't do the series any justice.
product is as pictured, shipped quickly and worked really well for us.

Death of Cupids is the Third book in the Blood of Cupid series. This really can't be read as a standalone and should follow Blood of Cupids (book one) and Betrayal of Cupids (book two). With this book, as with the second book, I did struggle though with whether to rate this 2 or 3 stars, but again opted for a more favorable rating to focus more on the writing style and less on my dislike of the story line.What worked:- Overall the writing was well done. I did like the way the author managed the transition from book 2 to book 3 without pages and pages of rehashing what was already written in the previous book. There were no inconsistencies between books, and the way the chapters flipped point of view between Grace and Ryan really shows each characters thinking behind what drives their actions.What I didn't like:- This just doesn't feel like a romance novel at all. The story has so much focus on revenge and anger and violence, that the love story is really lost. By this point in the series, the main characters, Grace and Ryan, are just broken. Ryan continues to waffle between whether to take a stand or cave in to whomever has his attention. It's disappointing how easily he falls under the influence of anyone with a more powerful personality. I kept rooting for him to stand up for himself, and I think that's what the author intended for the ending, but it just sort of fell flat.-  Again in this book, the "twists" were all really easy to see coming. And there really was more violence, revenge and anger than there was romance. And again, this series reminds me so so much of the Gypsy Brothers Series by Lili St Germain (for those who weren't bothered by the darker story line).I guess this book is intended to end the series. But it did leave some weird loose ends, so who knows. Never did find out what happened to Mark (the nurse) or Mr Muscles (from book 2), or Ryan's family. Did they die? Meh, just an blah kind of ending.

Betrayal of Cupids is the second book in a three book series. This really can't be read as a standalone and should follow Blood of Cupids (book one). It starts and ends with a cliffhanger. But luckily, the series can be read for free through Kindle Unlimited so I didn't mind so much the way it was split into parts. Each story is a pretty short, quick read. I did struggle though with whether to rate this 2 or 3 stars, but opted for a more favorable rating to focus more on the writing style and less on my dislike of the story line.What worked:- as I mentioned, this book is in no way a stand alone. But I did like the way the author picked up with book 2 after the end of book 1. There wasn't a lot of rehashing from the first novel, just enough to catch the reader up, refresh the loose ends, and then jump right into the drama of book 2.- the writing is decent. there are no major grammatical errors and context flows pretty clearlyWhat I didn't like:- So this book just didn't work for me. If I thought book one was dark, this story is much MUCH darker. The main characters, Grace and Ryan, became even more twisted and angry. For a guy that grew up in an MC club, Ryan is really kind of a wuss. He keeps whining that he doesn't want to be part of the club, and he reinforces that every time he refuses to step up to the plate to stand up for Grace, but he also doesn't even have the guts to walk away if that's what he wants so much. And Grace, for someone who so adamantly wants to be away from the life, really seems comfortable bossing everyone around, using violence to protect anyone who gets in her way, and basically acts just like the people she wants to be away from.  Just seems like a role reversal from a typical romance novel where the man is the hero saving the woman.  Not that that's a bad message, but just not what I look for in a romance novel.-  Again in this book, the "twists" were all really easy to see coming. And there really was more violence, revenge and anger than there was romance. And again, this series reminds me so so much of the Gypsy Brothers Series by Lili St Germain (for those who weren't bothered by the darker story line).

So this book just didn't work for me. I'm not a big fan of breaking one story into multiple parts and ending each with a cliff hanger. It feels like a cop out and aimed at charging double and triple the cost of what the story is actually worth. But in this case, I was lucky to find the entire series through Kindle Unlimited so I thankfully did not have to pay extra. Blood of Cupids is the first in the Blood of Cupids MC series. The story is much MUCH darker than your typical MC Romance novel. I wanted to like this story. I liked the premise of star crossed lovers from rival MC clubs finding each other. I liked the twists that kept intertwining Grace and Ryan's pasts. But I just didn't like Grace and Ryan. They kept making awful choices. The "twists" were all really easy to see coming. And there really was more violence, revenge and anger than there was romance. Book One is definitely the tamest of the 3 stories. I rated it 3 stars because it was grammatically well written and is more focused on the romance than either of the other books. This series reminded me so so much of the Gypsy Brothers Series by Lili St Germain (also not a favorite series of mine, but  those who weren't bothered by the darker story line here may like it).

While I didn't hate the story, I just didn't find anything more to it than what you read in the synopsis. So Stella has a secret sex addiction, leads a double life, feels empty inside, blah blah blah. Then along comes Matthew to take her away from all of that. She finally finds a connection... yawn. There just wasn't anything else to the story.  Didn't love it. Wouldn't recommend it.

I've been waiting for Shade and Lily's story since the characters were first introduced in Razer's Ride (Last Riders book 1).  The author does a great job building out secondary characters. While I wasn't really into the whole BDSM part to this story, I suppose I should have seen it coming. It just felt a little forced - like the author wanted to find a way to work the topic into her series because the theme became so popular after the success of Fifty Shades of Grey.  It just didn't feel like something that Lily's character would ever be open to. Shade could have still been written as possessive and strong without being a dominant. Ms Begley should have saved that for a future book on Evie, Bliss or even worked it in with Knox and Diamond.I also don't know that Shade's Fall would work as a stand alone book. You really, really need to read the series in order to build up the suspense of wanting to see Shade and Lily finally get together. I wish we had seen more of the nice guy side of Shade. And I wish we had seen more of the fighter in Lily.Final criticism is that I wish the author would label her series better. She has several series going at once that cross pollenate characters (a good quality that sells books and has me buying books that I maybe wouldn't have found otherwise) but it wasn't as easy as just reading one series in order; you have to jump from one series to another and figure out which order to read them in. I read them in this order: Razer's Ride (Last Riders), Viper's Run (Last Riders), Knox's Stand (Last Riders), Sex Piston (Biker Bitches), and then finally Shade's Fall (Last Riders).  I guess I missed Teased (VIP Room) and Tainted (VIP Room) - which I will go back and read later. I also read Riot (Predators) a while ago  which I LOVED and didn't even make the connection to the characters that showed up at the end of Shade's Fall.Despite the criticisms, I gave this 4 stars because in the end I still love the characters, still want to read more, and will continue to follow the author as she puts out more books.
material is kind of thin, and shirt runs a little small, but overall it was fine for a Halloween costume that we only need for one day. I was happy to find this at a reasonable price.

After reading Ms Foster's `Love Undercover' series, I was anxiously awaiting more on Yvette and Cannon and was not at all disappointed with their story. You'd think as book #1 in this new series, that the story would be able to stand on it's own, but this was really the first of Ms Foster's books that I felt needed the prequel to lay the ground work for character development. That's not a criticism, but worth noting.  To fully get into Cannon and Yvette, you really do need to read "Dash of Peril" from the Love Undercover series to get their history. Cannon and Yvette had SO much chemistry as supporting characters in the earlier series.  But Yvette was too young to begin a relationship, and then something horrible happened to her causing her to run off to California and leaving Cannon to dive head first into his career as a professional fighter. Now, three years later, Yvette's grandfather has died, and Cannon and Yvette are once again pulled home.Without the lure of Cannon and Yvette, I don't think I would have gravitated to a book about a professional fighter.  I had no idea what MMA (Mixed Martial Arts) and SBC (Supreme Battle Challenge) were. Had to google them for definitions. Yet, this has been my favorite of Ms Foster's books to date. Haven't read all of them yet, but I'm intrigued enough to keep reading more. The editing in her work has greatly improved. It was one of of the things that annoyed me in the last series, so I'm glad to see it has gotten better.As always, I love the way Ms Foster really spends time on building all of the characters in the story, not just the main couple. I can't wait to read more on Armie, Stack and Denver.

This is the last book in Lori Foster's `Love Undercover' series, telling the story of Dashiel Riske and Lieutenant Margaret "Margo" Peterson.  While this book can easily stand on it's own, you really get the full sense of the characters by reading the other books in the series as well. Ms Foster is has a writing style that I want to dislike, so I'm always surprised when she keeps pulling me back in. The series is very formulaic and each tale reveals a the super hot "bad boy" guy who can't be tied down, goes through girl after girl until he meets a somewhat reserved "nice" girl with a dark past. They are immediately attracted to each other and then must overcome her past, his past, multiple misunderstandings, trust issues, and any random bad guys who stand in their way in order to fall in love. It certainly is a little clich. But for some reason, it works. Until now. I really loved Dash as a side character in her other books. But I could never get into Margo. She's supposed to be this tough as nails, all business, no nonsense head of the police department. Yet in no time, Dash is walking through the police department, strolling into her office unannounced, and groping her in front of the police officers and detectives who work for her. Um, awkward.  And she always seems to get her shirt ripped off in like every altercation with criminals. I'm all for a strong female lead character, and props to Ms Foster for at least trying to add a new dynamic to her usual character development. But it just didn't work here.I would have rated this much lower, but give it 3 stars for Cannon and Yvette who show up as supporting characters and steal the show. So, while I was disappointed Dash and Margo, I am still drawn back for a new series. Can't wait to see what happens with Cannon and Yvette.

This is the third story in Lori Foster's `Love Undercover' series (first was Run the Risk (Hqn), second was Bare It All (Hqn)).  While the plot does still work as a stand-alone story, I feel like you need the character development from the first 2 books in order to develop a connection and liking to Rowdy and Avery's characters.  Without the background from the earlier stories, I can see why many reviewers think of Rowdy as a total jerk, and Avery as an idiot for falling for him.  This story follows the same basic formula as Foster's previous books where the super hot "bad boy" guy can get any girl he wants (and does) until he meets a somewhat reserved "nice" girl  with a dark past. They are immediately attracted to each other and then must overcome her past, his past, multiple misunderstandings, trust issues, and any random bad guys who stand in their way in order to fall in love.  It certainly is a little clich. But despite the formulaic writing and the overall cheesiness, I really did find myself liking the characters. I liked that there was at least an attempt at a story line outside of the steamy romance scenes. I loved the addition of Marcus and Cannon (characters we did not see in the previous 2 books).If I could wave a magic wand to improve the story, I'd wish to give Ms. Foster a better editor. I think she writes her characters well, and I like the added suspense that comes from the police cases to keep readers interested beyond just waiting for the characters to get into bed.  But the spelling and grammatical errors were really unnecessary, and there were several dialog scenes that were just so over the top cheesy that I had to skip over them entirely. There were logistical errors too where the writing would describe the surroundings that then conflicted with the descriptions in the following paragraph.  Sometimes I found myself rereading sections just to figure out what I was missing. Mostly, I just tried to let it go and move on. They were all just minor errors that any quality editor would easily see through.As for the rating, I give this 4 stars and feel like I need to explain why. First, I may have "graded" a little easy because I am comparing this story only against other books in this genre. If I were comparing this against all fiction books, I would have scored this lower.  I don't read a lot of Romance novels, and tend to hold them to a lower set of quality standards as "beach reads". Could just be that I haven't found any really great Romance novels yet and hope to find some soon.  Of the few Romance series I have read, I almost never have any interest in pursuing what happens next in the characters' lives enough to make it past the first book. But this series held my interest enough for me to keep reading.

These were my first shoes ordered through Amazon. I was super impressed with the quick shipping. I placed my order on Saturday and had the shoes in hand by Monday. These boots are a deep purple, in a creamy suede with strong purple laces to tie in back. the height hits just above the ankle and which makes it snug but not tight. I typically wear 7/7.5 and ordered these in a 38 EU/7 US.  I wasn't sure I'd like having laces in back, but it makes them roomy enough to fit with either thick socks on colder days, or thinner socks/tights for a dressier look.  The sole is a sturdy rubber and the combination of heel height and platform gives a nice height but doesn't feel too high to walk. These are definitely my new favorite fall boot.
great quality

Yowza this is one expensive toy!  The huge novelty of this toy is the built in camera.  This contributed a big wow factor and my son couldn't wait to tear into the package and begin filming battles. But before I get further into the camera, let's start with the blaster itself.  It works using an automatic firing  method which is why it requires batteries.  Automatic firing means that it is easier for younger kids to use because it doesn't require arm strength to pull back a handle or pump.  But, automatic firing also means It is kind of loud.  This takes away the stealth factor since you can't hide from or sneak up on your opponents, but my son and his friends didn't seem bothered at all since they were mostly running around screaming and shooting at each other. When you hold down the trigger, the blaster fires 12 darts in rapid fire.  The ammo clip and the foam darts are interchangeable  with other Nerf products so reloading was pretty standard. The blaster did jam a few times if a dart got stuck, but that is also pretty standard across Nerf toys and it's something the boys seemed to take in stride.Now back to the camera feature.  I know there are lots of people who hold pretty sophisticated battles that they film and upload to YouTube. I've seen a lot of feedback commenting on the poor quality of the camera, audio, etc.  For us though, we play with Nerf just for fun, not a sport or official league playing.  My son is 10. He holds mini-battles with his friends in the backyard.  For these kids, having a camera was a super cool feature and the boys were just scrambling over who got to film each battle. Then I uploaded the video and camera footage to my laptop and the boys were in fits of laughing with the fun of it all.  I will say that we just are not going to put the time and effort into editing and uploading footage to any kind of social media .  So, overall, I give this 4 stars because while I think the feature doesn't warrant the extra money,  my son says it's one of his favorite Nerf guns and has been using it every day since we got it.

This was our first in the BOOMco line.  We have long been fans of Nerf products, and must have at least 15 different Nerf guns, boxes and boxes of ammo, and all the accessories. So my son was anxious to see how this new Blaster gun would compare to some of his old favorites.First, the darts are really different from the standard Nerf foam darts. These darts are a think plastic with a rubber tip that allow them to stick to the targets that are included in the packaging.  The gun requires no batteries (definitely a plus), and works by pulling back on the rear handle to shoot up to 8 darts before needing to reload the clip. Then there is a cannon on top of the gun that can be activated by a switch in back. The cannon will shoot 3 darts at once.  The remaining 6 darts can be stored on the blaster for faster reload. There are also these wings on either side of the blaster that can capture any darts shot at them  - which make for finding extra ammo quicker when it's time to reload.Overall, we were happy with the product. It shoots really far (probably farther than our Nerf guns).  But then we had a bunch of 10 year olds over  and put this gun through it's paces. First, the targets quickly got lost or ripped or discarded.  After all, the boys wanted to shoot at each other, not at targets.  Then, they were complaining that the plastic BOOMco darts hurt a little when you are shot at close range. The Nerf foam darts didn't hurt as much (I think they were just looking for something to whine about though).  Last complaint was that the wings on the side of the blaster kept getting in the way and needed to be removed.  At the beginning of the games, everyone was fighting over who got to use the BOOMco gun, and then by the end of the day, they were fighting over who got stuck with it.So, I'm sticking with 4 stars for this.  From my perspective,  I found that it jammed less, shot farther, and seemed sturdy. I love that it doesn't need batteries.  But in the end the Nerf products won out due to their interchangeable darts, clips, etc.

We got these to match the Nike Mercurial Indoor soccer shoes http://www.amazon.com/Nike-MERCURIAL-VICTORY-INDOOR-SOCCER/dp/B008D35Z0G/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1407581488&sr=8-1&keywords=BOYS+JR+MERCURIAL+VICTORY+IV+IC+FIREBERRYProduct is great quality, arrived quickly, and my son is super pleased with his matching shin guards and shoes. As for sizing, my son is 10 and the Small size was a perfect fit

8/9/14: Updating review:I first found these boxers through a different third party vendor earlier this year. My son and I have had this power struggle going around getting him to wear underwear. Every morning there is an argument to get him to put on his underwear under his pants/shorts. We tried briefs, boxer briefs, and finally boxers. Once we found these though, they quickly became his favorites. They are super soft, great quality cotton, and wash really well. The cute sayings make them "fun to wear" and eliminate the struggles I have been having with my son to get him to wear underwear. My son will wear them to bed as pajama bottoms in the summer as well.When I went to order additional pairs, I was happy to find these listed on Amazon. I did have some initial trouble with sizing listed for the product. The only sizes listed are small/medium/large and there was no sizing chart posted for this product. The ones we had ordered previously were a boys small (my son is 10 and small fits perfectly). The company, Lazy One, makes these boxers for both men and boys sizes so I ordered the boys small and hoped that was right. When the order arrived, the items that arrived were mens boxers, not boys. I contacted Amazon, who put me in touch with the seller, and I found that their customer service was fantastic as well. They quickly shipped out a replacement in the correct size.I absolutely recommend these - great product and great service.
